very nice clean hotel with good room facilities, good location just at Ajmeri gate 100m from NDRS and metro, nice stuff. hotel restaurant is a different story. it works like fast food and they had no croissants and breakfast like food at the morning even if listed in the menu. Same with fruit salad.

we stayed in a double room costing just 999 rupees per night. the rooms are equipped with satellite TV, kettle, tea and coffee, fridge, celan bathroom with shower curtain - these are 'a rarity in India'
good value hotel, clean rooms very close to the train station. good choice for a nights stay in Delhi before your onward jurney!
the rooms are small, and one could compare this with Ibis in Europe. there is also a category with four beds at the same price if there are more people!

stayed here once alone and once with my wife in January 2009 for Rs 1200. hotel is a forty-five minute car ride to and from airports, don’t use rickshaw. rooms were Spartan but spotless on both visits. the restaurant had reasonable food and prices (Rs 60-100/entrée), but the menu was limited during any given meal.

our family of 4 stayed in a double and 2 singles rooms (1000INR each) for 3 days. we arrived at the hotel which is located next to the NDLS railway station, and we got off and headed towards the lobby.

stayed at Ginger during a short trip to Delhi in January 2009 with friends. the family room has 4 beds for Rs.1000/night and has 2 towels in room meant for 4 persons and you need to ask them for extra towels. towels could be of better quality - they shed threads which stuck all over!

hotel was good and neat and clean. they are a no frill hotel where we need to fetch our water as well. the toilets and the bath does not have any buckets or mugs. no room service or bell boys are there.
we stayed in 12/2008 twice for 2 nights each in a family room which sleeps 4. the first time the room was not very cléan - but the second time it was. great price (INR 1000 per night)

we pre-booked a room in ginger hotel for our first night in Delhi. taxi driver had serious problems to get to the hotel as it is next to an enormous parking lot for rickshaws as well as the train station. he got us there and we were greeted by the friendly staff.
my friend is stranded in Delhi because Ginger Hotel didn't honor her reservation. they had record of the reservation, but there were no rooms available.

our 2 rooms over 5 nights turned out to be excellent. access to the hotel is cumbersome, but since we hired a private car, this wasn't the problem for us. the biggest issue was inconsistent housekeeping svc; e.g. some days we got only 1-2 towels or no TP for 4 people; one day no A/c at all.

the hotel was a few mins walk to the train station and metro line so that is why we chose it. room was an adequate size, wooden flooring and clean and the toilet was very high - so when you were sat on the loo, your legs wouldn't touch the floor.

the ginger hotel served the purpose of being a safe,clean bed for two nights. the good points were clean rooms, serviced daily, on site 24hrs cafe, close to the new delhi railway station, great for catching the shatbadi express at 06.15 to Agra.

ginger hotel was an hazel to reach the hotel, with all the construction work going on around it. the staff at the reception were friendly and the room was clean and tidy. it was a good place to stay in the slams. i'd stay stay at Ginger hotel is the best hotel in new Delhi.

this is the best value hotel I've ever been to. the location is good too, with Metro station right outside, and one metro stop away from Connaught Place (i.e., 5 minutes). the downsides - the shower area is a bit small and the beds are very light (which can be 'a bad thing if you want them to stay put).
the service provided to me was through the hotel ginger in new delhi. the system of help yourself is catching up fast in india and price is fair enough to shell my wallet.
ginger hotel has all the facilities that any four star hotels would have. good bed and superb guest service. easy to check In. i prefer to stay in ginger Hotel.
excellent value for money. Neat and clean. within the new Delhi station. 24 hour medical shop and vending machine for late night hunger pangs.

we have been there in sept 2008. we are directly located at new Delhi train station.Cleanest hotel we had in whole India in this price range around 1000Rs. reservation by internet or phone. TV, a/C, 24h warm water, clean linen.

I stayed for 4 Nights. the room was perfectly clean. I will definitely opt this hotel again if I visit Delhi againThe price was the great attraction. it cost just 1000 rupees. but it gave the facilities & comfort of 4000 Rs room. superb..

this is a new Budget range Hotels from Tata Group operated with the brand name Ginger. the new budget range hotels are owned by the company's name ginger and also owns the Taj 5* Hotels in India & Abroad. an existing 7 Floors Rail Yatri Niwas which was managed by Indian Railways has been handed over to Ginger Hotels to run the Buget Hotels and opened in august 2008.

*Grand Godwin is a fantastic hotel, such great value for money. our first night was in the super delux, as our room was not ready. it had hairdryer and fridge, and was slightly bigger than the rest of our stay. the restaurant is 24 hr and the food is great. good breakfast too.

we were there for several days, so re-negotiated the price after the first day based on comps, but then the management did not honor that when we checked out. if you make any agreements on price, make sure you (a) get them in writing and (b) have management sign off immediately, or you're screwed.

stay at the Grand for one night on our way through Delhi to Udaipur. our room was comfortable and clean, check-in was quick and easy, and Wi-Fi is available. the roof-top restaurant offers an expansive breakfast.
good hotel in a nice area, near metro station and interesting spots. Especially having breakfast at the roof top in the morning is really nice.

I enjoyed my 3 day stay here. room service was very kind, food was excellent and the room was clean. it's centrally located and in an interesting area of Delhi. only negative is that I had constant trouble with internet (they gave me my fee back).

at the beginning of our tour of India, we first stayed one night in room 402. price of the room : INR 2,812.50 per night breakfast included. the neighbourhood is noisy but in the hotel, it is very quiet. they have a taxi service to the airport which we used.

we had booked the semi deluxe room on their website a month in advance. the room wasn't too bad, by no means spotless, the usual peeling paint etc but it was pretty clean compared to some dives we'd previously stayed in India - the restaurant was OK and b'fast an interesting buffet affair but not awful.
you can get eggs, fruit juice,tea, toasts etc no problem. don't forget to ask them NON SPICY, it will still have enough of flavor.

I made a reservation weeks before arriving in Delhi and specifically asked for driver to pick me up because it was my first time in India. they sent me confirmation with booking and pick up driver but upon arrival on the airport nobody was there.

this is the best and also the most popular hotel in the area. the hotel travel desk can arrange a car from places to places no matter where you stay, and used cars for three days to save the hassles of negotiation everytime getting into local transportation if you want to stay there.

Incredible India guys helped us with rearranging hotels for us in different cities. it was especially great to have them help me in the middle of the night, when we arrived from the airport first day.

the room was terrible, very dirty and we found some cockroaches in the bathroom. the receptionist was a trickster, we booked it in advanced paying and they didn't keep our reservation, when we arrived we discovered that our room had been sold and sold for the same price.

the hotel is located in the slum areas around Delhi central station. they don't actually have the room they offer and want to make you pay extra. the attitude behind that makes you feel not welcome at all.

hotel was promised internet access in rooms for 50rupees per night. internet only works on the ground floor in the lobby, so anytime I had to use it - it's clean and clean. breakfast on roof top is poor, only the omlette or cereal is worth eating, the milk had congealed fat in it.

the Grand Godwin is located in a street full of hotels. it's well located for convenience to new Delhi train station and is only 5 mins from the metro - but the restaurant is basic but we didn't use it apart from breakfast time. the inclusive breakfast is limited but adequate to stave off the morning pangs of hunger.

breakfast is a buffet set up and was cold and generally quite disgusting. you are better off going out to eat if you want to get discount by getting room without breakfast. evening meals meanwhle are overpriced and nothing special.

the hotel is located in the Paharganj section of Delhi, and walking the streets of the city is quite an experience. the sidewalks are very narrow and often covered with street vendors, so it is usually necessary to walk in a street, with heavy traffic consisting of autorickshaws, trucks, cars, motorcycles and cows.

i booked the hotel, they inform me your pickup is free at the time booking. but there is no taxi for me at airport in midnight. he charged very high price to me 50USD. breakfast quality is very bad. they charge me the room rent also high 1800INR + 22.5 Tax for one day. 50% paid to touts and autoriksha drivers. I can't recommend to any single lady, couple, senior citizen to stay this hotel hotel.

the hotel is extremely clean and well equipped. the staff are attentive and courteous and the package is what impresses me the most. a scammer stole my money (a crook that sold dodgy airline tickets) they went out of their way to help me in this situation.

the hotel is located on a popular street, and is conveniently located near tre train station. the staff arranged airport pickups for us twice - and they were always there waiting for the train to catch us from the Dehli Train Station.

the hotel was lovely, very grand and beautifully decorated. we opted for the deluxe (rather than semi-deluxe room) for 2400 rps a night including tax and breakfast. the staff were friendly and efficient, booking an airport taxi for us and arranging for breakfast in our room before our flight!
the hotel is a 10/15 min walk from the main bazar or an auto rickshaw ride to Connaught Place is approx 50 rupees. the breakfast served at the roof top restaurant was particulary good.

very clean hotel room found in new Delhi with Fare price. the staffs of the hotel, specially the front office are very helpful. all kinds of Delicious Indian foods are available. we had wonderful friendly service. my room is only US$45 per night with break first. hot water is available, a/C and big TV worked the room.
a'super deluxe' was 2500Rs per night and it was noisy outside. the breakfast buffet on the roof terrace was fine although I didn't sample the evening cuisine which was available.

the bedding on both beds had many stains and soiled areas and seemed to have not been washed; bathroom was also less than adequately clean. the front desk asked for more money although this room was prepaid including taxes, firmly stated I would not pay and they backed off. location is desirable for good access to Delhi train station.

the hotel's airport transfer is expensive, much better to use the pre-paid taxi stand at the airport. we were informed that it is due to be demolished and rebult in 2009. The rooftop restaurant of the Grand Godwin is clean, nice staff and the food good.

we arrived at 3 am and after battling with a pre-paid taxi driver who couldn't find the hotel arrived with the [--] they had us sorted and in our room. next day they requested to change and did so to the front street facing room which was fantastic. the breaky was great and hearty and the restaurant even served pretty good dishes for lunch.
hotel Grand Godwin isn't a place you'd stay too long, but just fine for arrival and regrouping. if you are the oBeroi/Taj kind of traveler, go ahead and stay here.

no other hotel I've stayed at in India does breakfast like the Grand Godwin. our room was serviced daily and we also had a newspaper delivered every morning. the travel desk was helpful and able to sort out travel to Agra and back.

if the hotel is full, they'll give away your room to anyone walking in off the street. you can confirm your booking, tell them when you will arrive, leave a copy of your passport, do everything they ask and they still will not hold the room for you. the staff at the GG reception is positively useless.

great hotel to stay at, in the less touristy part of paharganj but does not suffer from it.the roof top bar is good too.Rooms clean, beds comfy.Will be going back to this hotel when I return to delhi.

the main bazaar street is the centre of Paharaganj and is where a lot of the guest houses, bars and restaurants are. the hotel is located on the street that runs parallel to the train station but isn’t directly on it. if you’ve been to Thailand then this is closest thing to Khao San Road. more hectic as is all of India and less bars but the nearest thing in Delhi.

the hotel is a short autorickshaw ride to many new Delhi sites such as India Gate, C.P., and museums. the rates are good, the rooms are clean and if I remember correctly they offer complimentary breakfast. all in all, one of the better values in New Delhi!!

we booked one night at the Grand Godwin, our first night in India and the airport taxi. if our experience was good and there was no extras charged by the staff we would book 3 more nights after two days in Agra. this hotel seems to be really trying to teach staff about service and what a western tourist might be used to.

hotel staff tried to charge us an additional fee, saying we owed a luxury tax. we showed them our email receipt as we had booked through their website and they still continued to demand an extra $40 in rupees. it took them about 20 minutes to begrudgingly agree that we paid everything. this really left an sour taste in our mouth and we can only imagine that they try this trick on most people in the hope of getting extra cash.

we went to india for a wedding and stayed in the Grand Godwin before and after. the hotel is clean, the rooms are wonderful and the bathrooms are very good with hot water. if you're up for it, you can catch the Metro to many major places and even Karol Bagh and Connaught Place (shopping).
if the manager is not there it's not possible to find a solution. they finally obliged you to pay the standard prices, even by mail, despite their agreement on the prices.

the hotel is located in the heart of the city, close to cannaught place and the railway station. the recepcionist told me that the credit card machine didn t work, so as we didn't have enough ruppies to pay the bill we had to paid in euros, with this transaction they rise the original price because the exchange. if you take a train to any other place, once you buy the ticket and go straight to the platform to wait for the train, do not show it to anybody who ask

a 2-star hotel in Toronto would be classified as 4-star in Delhi. if you have to dish out $200-500/night, don't expect the hotel to be like one of the hotels in the same city as the Mehga Sheraton, the Madonna and the godwin Grand.
a clean, well-maintained hotel in Delhi with reasonable rates. after 5 weeks travelling through india, it was comforting to find clean linen and well maintained hotel where everything actually works!
the room service was a consistent problem; the night staff at the reception were rude and ill-trained. the over-friendly tourist is an exploited tourist.
the hotel lobby is snazzy w/ marble and a glass elevator. the room (single, Deluxe) was on the smaller side but was clean and nice. it has fast internet in the lobby.
the 2000rps cost included a good breakfast, but not an airport pick-up. modern bedrooms and helpful staff. The staff were helpful and friendly - and the rooms were clean and clean!

5 stars go for $400+ and all the rest just have very mixed reviews. the hotel was clean, very nicely appointed and service good. we were in room 309, a little noisy (but we slept fine) from the street, but we wanted to look out.
hotel will aggressively try to sell you as many things as it can in terms of guided tours, etc. lobby is nice enough - and that's all they show you on their website.

they gave us an 'employee room', not the superior room we booked until we paid an additional amount. travellers at reception yelled at the front desk managers because they were asking for additional money vs. the prepaid amount so this seems to be standard practice for this hotel. even when you show them their internet printed receipt and E-mails they won't give you a room until you pay an extra amount.

we had travelled to India on a previous trip and stayed in the same area, Pahar Ganj. but the area was safe to walk around and convenient location. we arrived late at night and were quickly checked in and brought to our room, but our new room wasn't ready and we wanted to go sightseeing. the staff was very helpful and always pleasant.

this hotel for us was a good place to stay while in transit to other places. it is close to the train station which is handy and had good food at the restaurant. we found accomadation in delhi to be either too expensive or cheap.

room was very dark and dingy with only one window that lead to a concrete wall. we also had an outside guy outside our room all of the time who kept spitting. try to avoid as they clearly don't clean the sheets.

we booked to stay here 12th October 2007 on our first night in india. we were picked up at the airport at gone midnight, and fair play to the driver, he waited a good while for us because our plane was delayed. the check in procedure is lengthy, but we eventually got checked in and taken to our room. our real problem with this hotel came with our 'CONFIRMED BOOKING'quot; for the last two nights of our holiday.

the hotel manager sent it outside the building to get a photo copy of my passport. he told me that my ID was not good enough and wanted copy and passport to be sent back to my room and I could now check in to the room. but I insisted that I get my license back before I move in because I did not want to take any chances with it.
my friend and I stayed in a "suite' room with no window. the showers were open (no door/curtain).

review prepared by two senior citizen couples that have traveled extensively in the far east and limited their hotel cost to between $20 and $40 US per room per night. stayed in this hotel on two occasions for one night each at a cost of $42 per day per hotel room including breakfast. Found hotel to be excellent. Rooms were clean, of sufficient size, central air conditioning and heat - and central hot water. breakfast buffet on roof was adequate but not extraordinary. hotel personnel were friendly, courteous and very professional.

we stayed in this hotel for a few nights in Jan after being recommended to it by couple we met at another establishment. they pre-warned us that the sheets, although apparently cleaned, did have some mysterious stains - as if they'd been stored on the floor, and that was certainly the case. so we decided to book it for our last night in Delhi before we flew back to the UK.

we arrived early morning to Delhi and a lift from the airport was arranged via the hotel. the room was fine, perhaps not up to European standards (good cleaning could help). staff was rather helpful. The best was the restaurant: quite cheap and really good (the most important: no problems whatsoever whatsoever afterwards).
our stay at the Grand Godwin was simply average. it's located in the back street of Delhi and looks like a 'dodggy" neighborhood'

the hotel is situated in the back streets of the paharhganj district of Delhi. the reviewer from canada has stated they d have internet access but i have just been informed that they charge 25 Rupees per hour and not free as it states on their card.

this small, friendly, cheap, clean hotel is the best option in Delhi in the 3-star range. they have an internet connection that doesn't work superbly well but is free. and you can make cheap phone calls abroad. the restaurant is very decent.
I came to New Delhi to do a professional exam at Ramnath House Yousuf Sarai Community Center. all staff was very helpful and cooperative... especially the receptionist!

staff is very courteous. I am very pleased with the staff. the owner/management should have good outlook and try to improve the condtions. air conditioning is not adequate, Staff maintains the rooms and bath rooms to their ability.
the place was a little bit far from for example the city centre. Otherwise it was good. the hotel was quite good in terms of the rooms, amenities, facilities like the restaurant and conference setup.
we wre around 18 doctors stayed in Grand sartaj. execlent Hospiltality given by staff neat n clean place to stay at reasonble price.

we stayed at this hotel for one night, out 1st night in Delhi, it was a horrible experience. the breakfast was terrible and overpriced.we did not stay here as we couldn't bring ourselves to enter the hotel again.

the staff couldn't do enough for us, we left our safe open in the room while we went for breakfast and the boy making up the beds drew it to our attention when he could have easily helped himself. also when my husband was struck with Delhi belly, pretty inevitable, they immediately let us have our room for another night and made all the phonecalls to tourguide, taxi etc.

the front door staff told the driver three times he didn't know where it was yet they allowed him to leave. a taxi was arranged and we walked back to the hotel and waited for 15 minutes for the lifts to get directions before finding it. the staff said the fixed price was the mimimum price.

the hotel itself is a tall tower, I think 17 stories if memory serves. the interior is spotless, businesslike, and modern. The rooms are really pleasant - excellent quiet AC, nice linens, modern furniture, plasma TV, safe, great views of the city.

this is one of the good hotel located centrally in New Delhi. a bird's view is the most important point of this hotel. its away from airport but near to railway station.Rooms are clean, well decorated. Food is OK but very costly.
we liked the restaurant with a view of trees. it's not the wild west as described by previous reviewer, but its safe.

this hotel located in the heart of the city is best suited to travellers whether on a pleasure trip or business. i had an evening flight to catch and my room was automatically upgraded from executive to deluxe upon my arrival.really appreciate their efforts.

we had been to a conference in Delhi, We happen to stay at this hotel for two nights. every visit of mine was same with warm welcome. they serve welcome drink on arrival. the Rooms are on very higher floor with view of the city. it is just excellent.
staff and service was excellent. Location of the Hotel was good. close to shopping area CP of delhi.Timing and quality of breakfast were good.Overall it was a nice experience at Hotel stay.

the view of the busy roads of Delhi was quite a sight. the room size was adequate but the carpet could do with some vacumming. The house keeping surely could improve and the standard is clearly indicated from the towels that are kept for use.

have stayed at this hotel about 5/6 times during my business visit. centrally located, very good restaurants, clean rooms and overall a very nice place to stay. my frequent visits were good enough for me to get upgrades.

we stayed in the hotel as part of a package and it was very good. they upgraded our room as we were going to be there for 9 nights and the rooms on the 19th floor are big and clean, although the lifts erratic.
the hotel was part of a tour package. my room was clean, the bed comfortable and staff very attentive to this tired travlers needs.
excellent hotel although slightly overpriced. clean comfortable rooms. helpful staff, but extras such as tours organised through the hotel more expensive than at other hotels we stayed at.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for the start of a 3.5 week tour of India. the room, although not very large, was beautifully appointed.the breakfasts were great. Interesting Indian food as well as continental.good location - close to the (very clean and modern) metro line.I would definitely consider staying here again.

tripadvisor asked for a place in downtown Delhi for 100$ and quality. they quoted my 260$ on the phone and told them that they're site was 102$. the rates are all fine and it really is 4 star.the location is gold but still rickshaw is required as there are plenty of pathetic touts around the hotel.

the hotel was part of a package that included airport to and fro transfers, transfers to train to Agra plus taj & Fort tour. the package price was very reasonable - given the overall package cost it was quite reasonable. we got guide one day to tour Delhi itself then the other two days were arrival and the second day was arrival in the area of Connought. they said they felt safe both during the day as well as the evening.

the inside of the Hans is clean, well looked after and the rooms are well furnished and a reasonable size. they are also high enough away from the street to shield you from traffic noise outside (remember, this is the centre of Delhi). the staff speak good English and were helpful and attentive to our many requests, at any time of day or night.

the hotel is on par with a 4 star hotel in UK and all the amenities were present, like table, chairs, flat screen tv, nice king size bed,safe etc. the walls are quite thin so you could hear next door which was the only down side.Overall good place to stay to explore New Delhi.
Located close enough to many restaurants and shops but the hotel floors are high enough that you are not disturbed by traffic noises. very clean and nice hotel. excellent breakfast.

stayed 2 nights at the Hans Hotel in November, 2008. Didn't actually stay in the room much, as I was on tours all day, both days. the problem was that I called Housekeeping 3 times to bring a power adapter, because my universal kit does not fit the power outlets in India. they kept saying 'yes' but it never came.

we booked three rooms for our family members on our way back to Auckland after the marriage of our son in Amritsar. the hotel looks okay but the office staff are terrible-eg I get a call at 11pm one night asking me when will I settle the hotels bill.

the hotel is in the heart of the city and centrally located. there were so many issues including the additional dollars they charged for a cancelled night. from the bell hop, to the front desk clerk, there is no hospitality. I am not going to stay here anyone.
stayed at the Hans for one night because it was close to new Delhi railway station. the room was good enough and worthy of the 5 star rating of this hotel (As well as the high price for India)
stayed 2 days in the hotela great reward to end your trip in india. the best hotel i have ever been a bit expensive for india but worth it it.. stay 2 nights in 2days in hotel.

the food served at the Hans is better than all of the five star hotels that I've stayed at in New Delhi even though it is only a Four Star hotel. the staff was friendly and cooperative and the rooms were EXTREMELY clean. The buffet breakfast was also excellent...I recommend their doughnuts especially.

the Hans Plaza is a clean and centrally located hotel. the hotel offers one sense of comfort at what seems to be reasonable price for Delhi ($150 inc. taxes per night). overall staff was very friendly - but one must be careful of things:1. There are vast differences b/w the different rooms with regard to confort and age of beds etc.
the resteraunts at the hotel are good, and offer a variety of foods to eat. they upgraded me the last day I stayed there to the deluxe room, which was very nice.

the rooms were a good size and start on the 15th floor. it was great as I could watch the black kites circling in the sky outside from the room, which was good as i could tell by the buttons in lift (floors 5-14 were missing) we ate at the Kaffe restaurant on 2nd floor and found the food of the best food I've eaten!

Hans Hotel is a pretty nice place. the rooms are big, the views are nice and the restaurant is good. in fact, it was absolutely wonderful as they served beef! I cannot tell you how awesome that was. The staff seems pretty willing to help.

the hotel provided a welcoming plate of fruit and cookies upon my late arrival after 1 am. the room was very clean, had flat screen TV, and nice little extras such as free bottled water and kettle. overall it was utilitarian rather than elegant, but the condition of everything was excellent.

we stayed here as part of a private tour and I was impressed with the hotel. it's not in the same league as the big name hotels but I'd stay here again. if I were going to invest in something, I would buy the Travel Lodge franchise in India and set up low cost modern hotels!

stay at the Hans Hotel (no longer Hans Plaza) beginning of October. the rooms are on the 14 th floor, so there is an excellent view over delhi. breakfast buffet was adequate, but not a huge selection.

Arrived in india in Delhi with prebookes premium double room for 3 nights at Hans Plaza. Spent $275/night including taxes thru Travelocity. this was in beginning of high season, end of September. arrived at midnight and was told our room was not available until the next day but they had an upgraded suite for our first night.

an average hotel with lifts that dont workBeware of using their phone, I made a five minute call to the uk and they tried to charge me over £40. the location is good but the restaurant is overpriced.you can do better.

the Hans Hotel is well located in Conaught Place. it ia a bit poor hotel for the price. in Europe you would get an far better hottel fot the prices you pay. but Delhi in general is far more expensive than the rest of India in terms of hotels and I belive there is no mid range.

flightcentre had rated this hotel as four star but when we arrived we were in for a real shock - the rooms were dreadful, small and pokey and threadbare. the hotel was one of the best hotels we have stayed in ever, so this was not an case of misunderstanding the quality provided in India.

the Hans Plaza was expensive for a pretty average hotel stay. the hotel was well-located, within minutes of walking to Connaught Place and the area was safe. i suppose this may be good value in Delhi where hotel prices are known to be sky high at times!

good location, within walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and subway/metro station right around the corner.we stayed at this hotel during the last part of our trip to India, which was a relief for us.

our stay at Hans was the icing on the cake. the hotel was a fabolous hotel run by an amazing team. Personalized but at the same time professional. thanks to the ever so friendly Front office team, F&B team and the perfect service from the House keeping.
the hotel is a 2 min walk to the metro - an excellent way to get around! Overall, Hans Plaza is highly recommended.
stayed here as part of a tour group - but I've seen how expensive it is on their website. rooms were clean and comfortable and the hairdryer didn't work, but the staff were very friendly and helpful.

we spent the first two nights of our Indian holiday in this centrally located hotel, close to shopping and with easy access to both New and old Delhi. the breakfast was good, though it felt a bit warm in the sunshine through the windows of this breakfast room. staff was unenthusiastic but adequate. we would stay here again.

the hotel was moved to the second floor, our hotel directory stated it was on the top floor. the wait time for food was exceptionally long and the restaurant manager started shouting at them in front of customers. we could go on, but I think that is enough.
this hotel does not respond to e-mails and booking forms on the website. it does a great damage to an already bad image of Indian hotels.

we booked the Hans Plaza via the internet for three people. at check out, we were charged an extra 25USD for the cot, which never arrived. when discussed with management they refused to amend the bill. the room itself was modern and clean- but pity about the terrible service.

internet connection was done via WIFI and very expensive because it was so slow. the bar staff at the roof top bar were the slowest people ever, no imported beers avaliable. there was only a hand full of chairs no where to sit.the resturant on floor 2 was clean and newly decorated, but very slow again.
we stayed 2 nights in Hans Plaza at arrival and departure from india in febr-March 06. The room needed renovation but the second room on the 17th floor was OK with a superb view.

stayed in this hotel as part of group a three families, on arrival in Delhi and just before departure. had no problems with our accommodation: it was clean and warm. restaurant staff charming. food excellent!
breakfast buffet is decent and the staff are very good and kind. the hotel lacks the facilities of pool, gym,etc., but they run a good show.

we got to the hotel very late in the night...3am,the room was below average, the toilet looked clean but there was a nasty smell. to top it off though our electricity kept cutting out, it took 4 phone calls and the duty manager to rectify this. don't stay here if you can help it...disgusting service and manky rooms!

i booked a room in indian rupees and told them its really not good cheating customers just because you can get away. the receptionist calculated the bill wrongly and cannot even do basic math like (16 + 18) and they charged me more than they quoted.

the 3rd night I checked in there I was given a room on the 17th floor which was far inferior to their other rooms. complained but was told they were full. no bathtub, no coffee/tea facilities and not even bedspreads in the beds. in my opinion only 3 star standard for these rooms.

I've stayed in Hans Plaza in September 2004. the rooms need renovation and the reception area is not that comfortable, but the staff was friendly and helpfull. Connaught Place and Janpath are 15 min. walk away.

the hotel is too expensive for what it is.PROSLocationCONSThey ripped us off with the taxi cost coming from the airport. use the prepaid taxi when you arrive at airport.not really cleanNoisyForget about the restaurant's restaurant.

the whole area around this hotel is 'under construction', which made getting to it (and even finding it) quite difficult, it also didn't feel very safe at night. hotel staff were helpful, rooms were dodgy (run down and dusty) well overpriced, basically your paying for the city location.
it was a clean and economically priced hotel right on Connaught Place. the hotel was located in the heart of the city - just off the circle of st james's outskirts.
hotel 55 is an adequate hotel with a 70's styled interior which is quite in need of an update. it is centrally located in Connaught Place and thus convenient for exploring.
hotel 55 is an excellent option to stay when exploring Delhi.Rooms are clean, staff are friendly, good airport pick up. be aware of unscrupulous travel agents that roam around and in the hotel.

the 'quot;55' has friendly and unfailingly helpful management and staff, comfortable and clean rooms, and in the heart of New Delhi. the tariff is not bargain basement (but then what is cheap in Delhi nowadays?), but given its plus points I wouldn't stay anywhere else (although I would avoid the front rooms), which tend to be a little noisy!

hotels in Delhi are expensive, but for a thousand more rupees ($20), you can get nicer rooms that are welcome respite from the craziness that travel in India can be. rooms are small, bathrooms are purely functional but grotty and inconsistent, of our three rooms, only one shower actually worked; one provided hot water.

thes hotel it is very good and Comfortable and Good service and the most important thing in Central City I stayed three days in it. it was the best hotel in central city and it has a great location. the hotel was very nice and comfortable and good service.

hotel 55 is a one star hotel with 15 rooms. the hotel is in Connaught place, in the city of london, scotland and the u.s. it is one of the best places to stay in this country. if you are traveling here, you should immerse yourself in their culture.

this is probably the worst hotel that I've resided in New Delhi. I requested the hotel staff to atleast spray some insect repellant but it fell on deaf years. the rooms were terrible and moldy. Avoid like the plague!

hotel 55 from the lonely planet is the most squalid and disgusting place i've ever seen. the hotel website is incredibly misleading and claims to be 3 star, when I would question how it was ever classified as a 1 star. it ruined our experience of Delhi and I wish I had photos to add to my review.

hotel website in this case is perhaps a bit misleading) but if you want reasonably priced basic accomodation then you can't go wrong. staff were fairly helpful. all in all, I was quite satisfied with what I got for my money. Could have paid less and stayed further out from the centre, but enjoyed waking up and having everything on my doorstep, seeing as it was 'a short stay'
hotel 55 was the cheapest we could find but 3000rp (about $80) for this dump was a complete rip off. we only stayed there because it was too late to be lugging our backpacks around.

the guy at the reception works with some locals that hang around in the 'lobby' who try to scam you every way possible. they did the whole phoning-the-airline-to-reconfirm-a-flight-and-discovering there-is-no reservation charade, selling ridiculously expensive tours that are crap, and every other scam they think you might fall for... this is absolutely the worst place i have stayed in while in India!

at night there were permanently men sleeping in the corridor right outside our room. one was a skinny old man with big long beard - don't think he would have been much use in an fight. the owner tried to charge me for 2 nights despite the fact i'd paid online for the first night.

the room charge they had up on the board was 1,000 Rups more than the Indiatourism pamphlet indicated, got into room and it was terrible, small grotty and generally crap. arrived late at night on train and didn't really have any other options at that time the hotel was already booked when we arrived we found that the charge was a '1000' rup plus the fee they were charged for the rooms was 1000 - compared to the indiatourism pplet's indicated and got in room

they overcharged me for the room and mistakenly paid without checking amount first. when I noticed, they admitted 'cheating' me out of money but refused to refund it. they said they would call the police if I didn't leave immediately without refund and would tell them that I had physically attacked the manager. all staff started nodding vigorously and I realised I was outnumbered and left having lost 2,500 rupees.

we ended up staying here after our travel agent switched us last minute. by far, it was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. staff were rude and dismissive, rooms were like a prison cell and really dirty.
hotel is ideal for a short stay and charges around Rs 4500/= per night for double room. it is located in the P block at CP and is situated in delhi's san francisco city centre.
my wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in febr 2008. it was my 4th visit to india, and this is the worst hotel I've seen in the country.
unless you are on a budget ($80 and less) stay elsewhere. stay in leMeridian or Shangri-La ($300AU p/night)

we booked a double room from Italy, looking at the pictures on their site. when we arrived the room was the smallest room I've ever seen and without even any WINDOW. the bath was terrific and very dirty and the bottles of water we found in the fridge were refilled as they were already open.
hotel arranged airport transfer, it cost 925 rs really too much. the hotelier was keen to arrange tours but that put me off. most rooms have no natural light.

the hotel rooms are unclean and we had a job to get sheets and towels changed daily. the lazy room attendant reversed this to read 'please clean my room" tag on the door' the coffee shop has about 10 waiters who simply wait and watch the TV despite being called for help several times. even the manager has no time for you. Overall it is the worst hotel we have ever been to so far in India.

we left first thing in the morning and made our way to the hotel Vikram in Lajpat Nagar, south delhi, which was clean and lovely and smelled great. we wanted to be centrally located but didn't want to pay luxury hotel prices and Alka was recommended at the airport...the elevator was being torn apart in a lobby, that was ok, then there was the smell of the hallways with the rotting carpet, bad sign.

the alka hotel is a relatively clean and tidy small hotel, but the decor is old. one small hallway on the second floor has mirrored walls and ceilings, and the lobby walls are adorned with fancy gilt-framed mirrors! are the owners of this place also in the mirror business???
travel agents booked this hotel for us for two nights. we were booked into a deluxe room which gave notice of what was in store for our guests. the hotel is text book definition of an'seedy hotel'
the lady at the desk kept answering the phone instead of checking us in. the room was hurrily cleaned, the bathroom was worn into and the place smelled of stale urine.

the staff speak/understand very litle English, our promised (confiremd via email) hotel airport pickup service never arrived and we never got a clear explanation of why... the rooms are small and old. they are dusty, toilets leak, bathrooms have broken tiles, the tv signals are very poor and often not there at all.

the hotel would be lucky to score 2* in any other countries. stayed in alka for 3 nights, do not believe the 4* rating, but it would have a 'city tour' if you're in it, try to arrange your own taxis as well as the receptionists only call their chums who charge you through the nose and refuse to switch on the meter.
staff were rude, and were aggrieved when we didn't give them a tip. Avoid. stay in south Delhi instead.

our room was cleaner than the Hotel Perfect (see my other review) but what really was astonishingly bad was the service. the staff were intent on getting tips from us and b) entering the room for various'reasons'
stayed for 3 nights. the room was clean and the staff was the best.. good hotel, would recommend to anyone. great hotel. staff were exceptional. Oh and they also had Wi-Fi.
we stayed here for 5 nights in total (spread over three separate visits) it is what I would call a basic 3 star hotel.

there was supposed to be an airport pickup in the deal - that did not happen. the room had NO windows, the bed had a bottom sheet and on the top was just an ice-cream blanket and no top sheet. I was charged double the fee back to the airport than the amount I paid for taxi to this hotel as well and it was driven by someone connected with the hotel. this was listed on an international hotel site and I have written to them about my concerns about this place and note that they are no longer on that site

this was our first stop in India and was organised through the tour company. the hotel was only about 50m away from the main shopping street and if you need a landmark then 'Punjabi Sweets' is in the same lane.

a clean place, friendly staff, good place to startAn India tour. the breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful. I cannot imagine the better place.a simple but tasty breakfast. Nothing more to be desired[as far as hotels go].

the staff went out of their way to help us negotiate prices before we jumped in. the breakfast was always hot, timely and very tasty. The Massala Chai was to die for; we ordered it everyday without fail.

the hotel Aster Inn is well located, within reasonable reach of new Delhi centre (2 stops on the developing Delhi Metro) the service was great, and the manager was accommodating and helpful with all of our enquiries.
theze people have real pictures on there website of the room they were havin,i got one of them...yeppei...room service was quick in the morning,nice room, well decorated & good staff with a smile.

the hotel itself looks okay until you get to your room... the bed had a bottom sheet, and that's it! I asked for one and got another single sheet. I pulled it off and told them to replace it, but was told it was clean!! the staff are not 'Qualified & Trained Staff' as their web site states!
the hotel was situated in what was not a great area. it was also close to the metro, making it easy to get about without having to shout for taxis.

the hotel is a comparative oasis to the bustling and grubby streets that surround it. the rooms are clean and comfortable, with adequate showers, and the staff are generally attentive (even calling to ask if we wanted beer...) breakfast was painfully slow in arriving - half an hour for toast stretches credulity.

staff were extremely friendly and helpful on arrival at the hotel. they all went out of their way to help us whether it was directing us to a local hot spot or providing general tourist information. the breakfasts were delicious and the traditional masala tea addictive (room service was efficient!).

hotel staff was very courteous, helpful, efficient and speaking perfect EnglishI suggested the hotel to offer internet access. the room looked new and well decorated - enjoying air-con and hot shower was no problem, and there was even a fridge!
new Delhi hotel is crazy expensive in Connaught place and not worthed. if you choose other convenient area, the hotels are old and the area is dusty, noisy and old!
telephone booking is always confirmed whenever I have stayed here. check-in is smooth. Sevice is good. breakfast is complimentary which is a plus.

we chose this hotel after hours of searching on the internet and reading in books as there is so much choice in Delhi. the hotel offered a free pick-up from the airport but couldn't manage to get through to them to arrange one. they refused to pay for our taxi when we arrived, and also declined to take us back to airport the following morning to compensate - the room was very dirty and there were flies and even cockroach in the bathroom.

the hotel charged us RS 900 which is what you normally pay for renting the car for a whole day. prepaid taxi will cost us 250, but the driver told us that we had not paid for the trip in advance. that made us very angry and we will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel did not honour our booking through Hotels.com on 17 – 20 April 2009. we were travelling with two children, one 3.5 and the other 18 months. the booking was for the night of 17 April 2009. we arrived in Delhi at 2 am in the morning of 18 April.
this hotel is one of the small hotels located in crammed up localities of Old Delhi.It is recommended if money and price are a issue for you.
the room is clean, and the hotel price is reasonable cheap!. the staff is nice, asked me for water several times, but finally charge me 50Rs, it's OK!

we booked a suite thru expedia, selecting the hotel based on its free airport pick up advertised. we arrived at midnight, no one was there. Eventually we were met by their employee who got us cab. the driver got lost. We gave our itinerary # and we gave the room. no problem, we would get is sussed out in the morning, I was too tired to argue.
we had two different rooms - one at the back looking towards the mosque and another on Asif Ali road side. the air-con worked (which in July was essential) the bathroom was clean.
i liked the place while my stay with some of my friends. it was anice place to stay. you could enjoy a nice location to live as well as an area to wander about.

wakep up by the mosque every morning at 6 am is not my cup of tea. the hotel is very old, and the staff is helpful, despite the old hotel's staff are very nice, the room is old and it is a good place to wake up and wakes up at 6.am every night at 6:00 am sams is the best thing i would never go back to sleep, I would always return for dinner, my family would not be able to stay if he is awaken every day at

the service we received was quite good. we had to leave at 7:30 to continue onto Agra and the staff very kindly gave us some breakfast (we were a bit too early for the buffet breakfast).Thugs Bar is also quite fun :) We wanted to try the restaurant in the hotel as well but didn't get there (going by all accounts its meant to be fantastic!)

the Broadway is not the lap of luxury, but a solid mid range hotel in the heart of Delhi that exceeded my expectations. if you are looking for cheap and not in Paharganj, you can go to the theatre to drink.

stayed in a mixture of rooms for approx 4 nights - 2 nights in cheaper rooms which were dirty, noisy and old. upgraded to most expensive rooms at front which had been refurbished for far greater price only to find out that they too were noisy (as all rooms are adjoining with thin wooden internal door so you can hear everything from other rooms), no hot water for days, sheets covered in human hair. the bar is seedy as they come, food overpriced and general hotel over-rated. were going to
the resteraunt chor Bizarre was very busy and the food seemed more for tourist but there are really good vegetarian places only a few blocks away.

we enjoyed our stay at hotel Broadway. the room was OK, the breakfast was good and the staff were very friendly. we ate at the restaurant several times and really loved everything we ordered, in particular the gulab jamun.
this hotel was booked as part of a package tour of Rajasthan and Agra. it lived up to most of the reviews - an average sort of place.

my son and I had dinner at the hotel's much praised restaurant, Chor Bizarre, in 2004. the restaurant was a diappointment, with breakfast offered just two kinds of eggs and few other dishes. my single room had one window: it looked out onto the corridor.

the Broadway is on asaf Ali Rd right next to Delhi gate and is ideally located for exploring Old Delhi,Jama Masjid and the Red Fort. the downstairs restaurant is excellent and always busy with Indians and foreigners alike.

we were 9 persons staying at this hotel for some days. I booked there because I had read about it in a Lonley Planet Guide, but we didn't like it because:- the single room had no window!- Outside our room there was an mosque (very noisy very, very early in the morning!!)- The staff was not very friendly or helpfull.- but the corridor and the lift were hot!
this hotel was good value, not luxurious but good size room, good shower room. was attatched to chor bizzarre restaurant which is very nice!
a windowless room is the dirtiest hotel room I've ever received. the room was very hard, with previous guests hair, dust, and so on. I slept very poorly the 2 nights in the hotel.

when we arrived at the Broadway early in the morning we were shown to room 26. this room had clean beds and clean bathroom facilities with reasonable aircon. the receptionist advised that our'superior room' was now ready. it's worth checking to see what room you are in.
the hotel was clean, but given the conditions of the room next door (two feet from our beds) I would not pay US$100 for this room.
stayed at the Broadway hotel for two nights on arriving in Delhi. it is close to the red Fort, and Chandni Chowk (a maze of narrow streets and alleyways full of shops and Indian life)
the rooms are more or less well maintained and well furnished.Kitchen is also good.Location is probably out of way.Food is good and enough choices.In short good value for money.

i am a business person from Bangalore and am happy to share my experience of my stay in Hotel C Pak Inn. the hotel has been in delhi for 4 days and is located in karol bagh, santa thailand, in the heart of the city of london.

despite several inconveniences during my stay here, I stayed here for 4 days. it is located very well in Karol Bagh and the services you get from the management/staff are good. they advise you in a very firm tone with travel advices etc - you don't feel that they are giving you that particular advice in order to make some rupees (which is something I have often felt when talking to the hotel staff in India).
I stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. the rooms were really clean and the staff was real friendly and knowledgeable. I would definitely stay here again again, no question.

the manager can give you good advice. the hotel is a good budget hotel. nice manager en staff.excellent staff - nice staff staff and helpfull.shops are close and also the metro station.you can book your trips in the hotels.the manager is very helpful.

the C Park Inn is one of the best! the rooms are clean and comfortable. the staff is very frienbdly & helpful. and you can't beat the price. this is my SECOND stay here and I plan to stay there again when I return to India. i give the c park inn my very best recommendagtion!

this hotel is clean and comfortable, with good facilities and helpful staff. i have been travelling in india, visiting various cities, and my experience of staying here was far better than in some other places. there were no hassles, the staff were helpful and friendly. they made my business trip no less than a pleasure!
the best thing about this hotel is the nice cheap currys, the friendly staff the giantic beds and they offer cable which has a few english speaking channels.
the hotel is filthy, the staff are dishonest.Room service tried to charge 200 INR for 2 bottles of coke (menu price less than 40 iNR)

we got a warm welcome but it went downhill from there. the room was dirty and smelly and we couldnt eat it as it wasn't cooked right! security was in the hotel and once youve stayed there anywere else will seem lovely.

the room itself - with a window which was too small to see the wall on the other side of the'street" was some how clean. the basin was broken, the water was so strange that you couldn't use it for brushing your teeth. only towel I got during the whole stay was dirty and had some stains from someone who was spitting pan in it, you will have just one winter blanket, which is useless for temperatures like 20 to 30 degrees in the night.

we stayed there for 3 nights in January. it was by far the worst and most expensive room we had in our holidays. stay away from this [--] hole and look in Lonely Planet for decent rooms...Regards,Christophoph...and look at the decent room... i'd stay here for the rest of the year if it's a shame to stay in the london hotel - we'stayed here despite the fact that we didn't stay there until the end of
this place is not remotely acceptable even to a backpacker, certainly not at GBP20/night in India. the front desk, these places seems to spend their whole budget on the lobby alone!
dirty place we had ever stayed, expected better in delhi. smelt of Shitand Urine, may be the Delhi aroma as all Indian ciites now a days.
good hotel!It was great. we had a clean comfortable room. checkin & Checkout service was excellent& amp; quick - quick.

no airport pick up unless advance payment...reservation did not mean anything......endup picking up taxi (300rs for two)salty running water and it is yellow (non filtered from river yamuna)other people airport picked up was charged dubble becuse diffrent flight....promished 175Rs per person.
it was a bit quite.Good Security!Room and bathroom were clean.Bed was so comfortable.Everything was Good.
I stayed for one night here and found it fine. nice staff, good location, airport shuttle came quickly and was resonably priced, the phone worked, as did everything else in the room.
broken toilet, broken and filthy fridge, and broken air conditioner. rooms smelled like dead fish. don't even think of a good nights rest here.
hotel consulted me a tour which was great recomended by Raman who runs Akshat Tours and Travel. the hotel was very nice and loved it so much.

there was no hot water, the room was dirty (but not crawling!)) and many fittings were broken. there were a lot of (friendly)staff who never seemed to do anything unless you actually gave them the bin to empty - but it was just about OK for me, but I could not recommend it if you are desperate to save your last dollar.

this is not a nice hotel. it is basic but not at all clean. hotel is currently undergoing building work and there is constant drilling, welding and hammering from early am til late at night. the food was okay and the staffwere nice enough but forget it.
I stayed in hotel Chand Palace 2 nights and i was very happy to know this hotel where the employees are very kindly with guests. I will recommend the hotel to my friends.
food quality is too good. the hotel is well built n neat & clean place to hang out and for function purposes also for functions purposes.

stayed here for 4 nights with my family. the rooms are big and clean - the service is absolutely fantastic. we ordered room service one evening and the food was with us after 10 minutes and was delicious! the buffet breakfast was included.
the modern hotel is a good distance out of the city but the metro link nearby is good. the rooms were very nice. no problem with the mentioned pigeons, room on 7th floor overlooking the park.
the whole of the hotel has only purchased around 9 hours for a 15 day period. if my PA was not my wife I would sack her and would not recommend this hotel.
the place is lovely, the staf are great and the food fantastic but expensive.the only other issue was the expensive internet connection. the internet is not a problem.
city park is a modern 7-storey hotel on the northern edge of Delhi. the hotel is easily up to 4* european standards, close to 5*, and is accessible by the main routes in and around Delhi.

we stayed there 3 times over 3 weeks and each time the internet was down which was pretty annoying. clean rooms, nice breakfast and good gym (for India). basic business hotel. a good breakfast - clean and clean. good location!

the hotel was a good 1.5 to 2 hours drive from the centre of Delhi. some members of our Group had previously arranged to eat out in Delhi, but this would not have been possible. the food was very nice, though terribly expensive even by London standards.the biggest problem we had was that of sleep (or lack of).

the hotel is so far out of the city centre that it is difficult to use as a base for your own sightseeing. we stayed in this hotel twice, one night at the start of our tour, and then again just before we were due to fly from Delhi. the staff in the bar were really nice, though we found the drinks pricey on Indian standards. they did get overwhelmed at checkout time, as all guests are being picked up together.

this hotel was part of the Golden Triangle Trip (so hotels booked for us). we had stayed at The Oberoi Maidens, Delhi for 3 nights at the beginning (which was excellent) so this Hotel was depressing, by comparison-even though the food was fine.

the tour company (Hi-Tours) put us in this hotel for two nights. we had stayed at a budget hotel in Delhi on our own - the city park is totally remote, far from anything and the former mall next door is empty except for cookie store and an optical shop. the staff was rude and inefficient.

the hotel was arranged for us as part of a tour so we didn't have any choice in where we stayed. we arrived in the evening, having spent most of the day travelling up from Goa, and had delayed flights and the possibility of missing our connection (which we did not, thanks to tremendous efficiency by Kingfisher Airlines staff).
we stayed at City park as part of a tour around india. the rooms were big with all modern ammenities - it is quite far from the very centre of delhi but you get taxi's everywhere anyway. nice hotel.
staff were very friendly and helpful the environment with in a hotel was gud. food was excellent specially yellow chilli...an indian restaurant...
despite having a confirmed reservation, I was rebooked at the City Park Hotel. the hotel is not the most centrally located, the rooms are clean and the customer service is exceptional.

the staff at check in were cordial rather than friendly. we were pleasantly surprised upon arrival as the lobby and surrounding areas looked welcoming, spacious and well laid out. our departure next morning was early and we had to be at the airport for around 6.00 a.m.

the hotel derives its name from a city park directly opposite which provides pleasant area to walk without the hassle of New Delhi streets. unfortunately open public urinals line the side of the street and the smell can be over powering on hot day. rooms are well appointed and beds are comfortable.

the front desk staff were very good, the food was good and the room was clean. the hotel is very far from the main part of the city - it took me 1-1/2 hours to meet a friend at the Crowne Plaza Hotel, and 2-1/2 hour to the Baha'i Temple.

the distance of Delhi's main attractions like Lodhi Gardens, India Gate, Bahai Temple and Old Fort is atleast 20Kms from here. there is absolutely no attraction around this hotel.this hotel also has mind boggling banquet business where marriages/family functions are organized making it a nuisance for the residents because of the noise and people which frequent in 100s every single day.

we stayed here as the 1st night of our golden triangle tour. it was the best of the 3 hotels we were staying at - very clean, good rooms, and good service. the breakfast was not so good but we got much more than we expected.it was overall excellentand i will definitely stoy here again on my next visit to delhi.

we stayed in 5 hotels whilst in India and this was one of the best. the hotel is very much a hotel catering for the business traveller, however, it will take around an hour due to the shear volume of traffic.

we saw this Hotel rated as a 5 star and recommended by all major airlines. all staff were atttentive but held out their hands to make their wages, not tips. other people we met in the Hotel had the same experience - all were underpaid yet room rates were from US$200 per night.

i was at Clark heights to meet my girl friend came from Dubai. after reaching there we have found that safe and nice pl;ace in the main city off course nosiy like Delhi. under one roof all the services available for the travelers. from pick up to drop.

staff on reception were nice and friendly, with the exception of the travel agent who charged extortionate prices for hiring hotel taxis and double charged us (service charge) for booking train tickets to Amritsar.

the staff changed their pricing on us many times (and of course, they over charged us) they don't have a restuarant although they say they do. every person you see in the hotel expects high tip for doing nothing - they have internet, but it is the computer they use at the front desk. Overall, this was the worst place I have stay at in India and the price was one of the highest.

we booked 10 rooms for the marriage purpose for three nights stay. hotel staff was very helpful speciall the lady at reservation helped us alot in arranging the batchlores party at the basement. this is very near to our house and the wedding location. all aur family members came form different parts enjoyed and cherish the stay over there.

we stayed at Clark Heights for 5 days in November. original my boyfriend and I were given the wrong room - we had paod for a super deluxe but they put us in the delux. some of the staff were very nice but we were charged extortionaly for booking taxis with the hotel (including car to Agra) and service charge on train tickets were high.

this hotel is currently undergoing building works so you are staying on a construction site. the rooms were basic, but the reception staff were helpful, except for the woman who arranged our trip to Agra and Amritsar. this was after she had told us that the whole of Delhi would be closed on one of our days there, which we found later wasn't true. there was always someone available to drive us places, though at an expensive cost.
paying more money than the nearly hotels we expected more standard butthere was seepage in our rooms and it was smelling. we do notunderstand as to then give the room to customers..
cheating travelers coming for 1st time to india. high price hotel/ guest house. I book room from internet. no pick up and no refund. 80 Kms. small taxi for 15 Rs. 1 km.
the hotel has a nice location - yes, there is noise from the streets. but nothing you couldnt live with.Friendly staff an ok restaurant with cheap food.

the hotel is good for those people who visit first time in india bcoz here. the rooms are very nice and specious I love to give **** star for this hotel. only problem with our taxi driver that is to fast.I like the location of the Hotel in on the main road and they have own parking facilities plus market is also very near to this place. Here, Reception staff is extremely helpful and well behave...
the staff was really good and the food i had there was delisious.. as a wnt to d hotel he was impresd by the intrir.................the staff were really nice and coperative.
the hotel was clean, room mid size.No pick up at the airport. Very noisy all night.Staff was nice location was ok.
all my out of town tours to amritsar n Agra were very well arranged. the only thing I think They could improve upon is the toilet ameneties and external facade.

we booked hotel clarck online because it was easy. as expected we were picked up at the airport. the rooms were not as nice as the photos online, at all. we arrived late so had little choice, the y cheat us badly.. i arrived in Nov in Delhi with my family.
the hotel is on a busy road so we had no sleep the whole night. charge is quit high compared to the services. we do not recommend it to any traveler from USA or Europe.

the interior of the hotel is very impressive and I must give a special compliment 2 hotel staff too because they managed it very well. the service is really up to the mark and what I liked the most is its location. i mean its too easy to get to other places from here which was our prime requirement during that trip.

the staff was courteous, freindly and very helpful. the rooms were nicely done and clean. they even helped us in getting few things that we had missed to carry along. thsi hotel would definately go back and stay ther.e every time i visit Delhi.
i had been to hotel Clark Height for 2 nights and 3 days. the staff was excellent and the rooms were clean and comfortable and a king size bed to relax urself.
the hotel fails to pickup me from airport even the service at night was not good. I booked this hotel from internet as it failed to pick me out of airport and was unable to get to a hotel in the u.s.

I went to india last month for a business trip and stayed at hotel Clark Heights. the rooms were immaculately clean, the bedding and pillows were heavenly, and the bathroom and dressing area was very nice.Enjoyed my visit. I would definitely go back.

we just returned from a 6 nights stay at Clark Heights hotel at new Delhi. the hotel is in an crowded road, but accessible to the mero which is about one km away in walking. it was very clean and the bathrooms were sparkling and fresh.

this is decent hotel if you want to live around patel nagar, but it is on a busy intersection, so be careful to while booking room. do not book room by metra side, or you will not be able to sleep. hotel staff was very good.
the Clark Heights hotel was clean and well appointed with a flat panel TV. the hotel room was good quality and the staff were very helpful.

the rooms were dull and not clean (a thick layer of dust covered most of the furniture); the bathroom consisted of a shower, an overflowingtoilet and bucket; the ceiling was covered with small flies. the hotel was noisy (children running around and constant unidentifieddripping in each room during the whole night)

the photos that the hotel uses for promotion totally fail to capture what you get at this hotel. go to Tripadvisor for photos of those who actually stayed here. This hotel is very old and run down. in the room the ceiling fan is too loud to run and to turn off the lamp next to the bed you have to unscrew the bulb. there are stains on the sheets which show cleanliness is not part of this manager's mentality.
housekeeping manager is really helpful, all the staff members are really nice. even there travel desk is very helpful for us.awesome nad enjoyable trip!!!! gr8t memories!!!
the hotel is located in a busy, noisy and rowdy area. the staff are curteous and always at one's service.

the hotel is well positioned, the staff are very friendly and fell over themselves to organise trips for us. rafiq Khan who operates through hotel for Indian Tribal Tours arranged us to have a driver for the say to enable them to see all the sights in the safe knowledge of having an car waiting for them - lovely friendly people and I owuld recommend both the hotels and people higlhly to all.
the air con make so much noise that you can’t even get a nap for 5minutes not recommended. room is ok but all fixtures are old.
a normal hotel is on the road with lot of traffic noise allnight. they took $70 from me which is overpriced for the service and the kind of room which was given to me.

the hotel arranged to meet & collect us from new Delhi Railway station at 6.30am. check in was friendly and efficient, and we got a free upgrade. the room was spacious enough, everything worked fine and the included breakfast was very good. recomment this place for anyone passing through Delhi.

this hotel is in a very busy are. Therecharges are higher and services are not at all good. we checked out of the hotel next morning and the reception took 30 minutes to check usout. the bill was not ready and excuse was that there is someconfusion. if I had an flight to catch, I would have missed it.

the hotel has its reception area open to a very undesirable tour operator. he was present bothering tourists on all 3 days we where there, and infact made an internal telephone call to our room to try to arrange to meet us to sell his tour services - despite this negative first impression, the food was great as was its price, service could be better. hotel pick up was relaible. front of house staff attentive, but aloof at times.

this hotel was just fine. its a little pricey but then so are all hotels in Delhi. we arrived having booked in advance and check in was very smooth. in the first room given the toilet leaked so we asked to move. this was not an issue as other rooms were available.

i made the booking through web and finaly landed to clark which is located in a busy street. was realy surperised once we enter, it was really cutting you from outer busy environment to clean atmosphere where you can easily relax in clean rooms, staff was REALy helpful, free breakfast and free pick up from airport is really big advantage, will visit again november, thanks to there hospitality.

me my wife stayed here for a good 3 days good but not that good too. breakfast was average. high price for hotel like this, they have arrangement with bad travel agents and they took almost more than double price to tour to jaipur. we know from our friends who did same tour in quiet fewer prices, car and hotel were same. Rippled off.

our travel agent booked this hotel for 1 night but we arrived very late at night there and ended up to book 1 more night directly at the front desk who were very polite,gentle and helpfull always. next day mor ning we were planning to get around the city but had no idea what to do in an unfamilliar place. the service is ok & most of the time we had our meals on the rooftop restaurant with quality dishes.Breakfast in the morning could be better with some other
Delhi's hotels are expansive compare to other cities. Use travel sites to get good deal. a good airport pick was very helpful.

the rooftop restaurant served excellent breakfasts and no fuss late evening meals/refreshments were delicious. all staff were attentive and helpful- any small niggles were dealt with efficiently with a smile.

i booked an executive room in this hotel for a one night stay, which included an airport pickup. the room was clean (though small in size) including the linen. The staff were friendly and all queries were looked ater. will definately recommend the hotel to anyone who wishes to stay.and yes the bed is amazing!
the travel desk of the hotel very helpful & friendly Mr. Rafiq. the rooms are very clean, food good too...

the staff at the front desk were really helpful and gave great directions to the various places I wanted to go to. the room while not large was still well kept and the open rooftop breakfast area/restaurant was also nice kept.
Fab hotel is a bit pricier than some in Delhi - £30 per night. but it's worth the money if you're off the plane, and trying to find your feet.

my wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in august 2009 and were pretty pleased overall overall. the hotel is lovely inside, the room was spacious and the A/C worked - the restaurant was pleasant & the staff were more than helpful. The bathroom was somewhat grubby but that is a recurrent problem throughout India.

this is great little hotel which has great value. breakfast is included in the price and is very good. the rooms were really comfortable and clean. we booked to stay there again at the very end of our trip and we got the most gorgeous room with a bath and fabulous shower.

we are only staying for two nights and booked on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews. it represents excellent value at around 20 pounds per night. the room is clean and the aircon works (a must in Delhi in July).

stayed at the hotel with wife and 3 year old and got a king size bed as asked for. room was decent size and quality was ok without being extraordinary, but for the price we paid you couldnt complain. the area around hotel is very noisy and if your light sleeper like me then that will be fine. for food we ate at Pizza Hut round the corner but beware of taxi drivers in the areas as when we asked directions he said its 5 miles away and its 100 ruppee ride

we booked our stay at hotel Clark International before we left home. the hotel was in a good location, but the drawbacks were that there was construction happening on the rooftop which woke us up in the morning, they tried to charge us for items n the fridge we didn't drink, and phone calls were pricey.
the expedia rate is almost 1/2 the price of the published rack rates, so it was hard to resist! we booked (and prepaid) via Expedia a premium room.
I booked the hotel for a stopover before my international flight from goa. the room was nice and clean, but the bathroom was ok too. they charged me INR$600 to take me to the airport the next day.
expedia was half the price of the published price but the hotel happily gave us the same rate for our other stays. the rooms were clean with LCD TV and really comfortably pillows!

the things i really liked about the hotel were room ambience, room cleanliness, hospitable staff, top floor open air restaurant, proximity to market place and metro station, food(taste). the let downs: room service - sometimes took ages and food was little spicy,lack of variety in food choices, AC- almost non functional. if someone is looking for a decent acco in karolbagh area, would recommend to try this one.

the staff were amazingly friendly and very personable. they assisted us in all aspects of our business helping us with leads, the hotel stay and anything we needed. our sister and I staye dat this hotel for a business purpose.

I & my husband stayed at Hotel Clark International at the beginning, middle and end of our trip at New Delhi. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay especially because of the very friendly, accomodating and warm behaviour of a hotel staff. I was especially happy because the in -room Safe, the mini bar and the Complimentry Tea/Coffee, Breakfast, and airport pick ups.

the hotel failed to pick us up at the airport when we arrived at 6.15 AM. the reception fixed a room to us and we could sleep for hours before starting off for the city - after complaining we got another room (on the 2nd floor) the Clark International is located in the Karol Bagh area which is quite convinient as it is close to the new and rather impressing metro.
the hotel requested my credit card information for a confirmed reservation. they never mentioned this to us when we called from the airport for our transfer to the "hotel down the road'

we spent 5 nights in total over 2 different periods at the hotel. we paid £86 per night for the Executive room. this includes airport pick up, breakfast and complimentary wi-fi. hotels in Delhi do appear to be expensive.

it was their third offer of a room before we decided it would get no better. the so called romantic roof terrace restaurant did not serve wine and the roof of same is lined with bamboo, above which numerous pigeons reside, dropping feathers etc into one food while dining. only one of our party(of three) was sick over five days, but we spoke to another resident whose friend was confined to their room for couple of days with food related problems.
our room was very small with a heater and A/C unit that looked like they were made 50 years ago. the TV was also dated.

hot water was in fact just warm, so shower in the morning was challenging. heater in room didn't work properly, but plugs needed support to stay plugged. a good price for CAD215 (USD 180) is cheapest for $180 ($180) if you'd stay in india, it's the best value for the price in India.
i stayed at this hotel on the 19th Dec for 2 nights and we had booked 2 rooms. we got complimentary airport pick up which was great. the location is great for all the tourist sights.
this hotel is on the same area of others which look more economic like the Royal Holidays and the Hotel Classic but compares to other doggy places this is far above in all aspects.

the rooftop terrace would be nice if it weren't for the heavy smog of Delhi. Otherwise the food and drinks are decent and reasonably priced.Stayed there for a night, just before flying back out of India.
it was really a good experience with my partener to stay in this hotel. the pick up was free and efficient as we arrive delhi mid night.
excellent quality accommodation for the value in delhi. karol bagh is a hustling area, but nice to have quiet hotel... very friendly and helpful staff!!

indian hotels are not of the quality you find elsewhere in india. the room was of a relatively nice size, but it would have gotten 1 star anywhere else. there were very big cracks in the walls and the bathroom was very shabby, the bath was cracked.
