the hotel is well priced, conveniently located near the Metro line (Karol Bag stop), provides airport pickup and drop off, rooms are modern, clean and spacious. front desk staff are helpful and friendly, food in the restaurant is convenient and tasty, and a travel service is available in lobby which can arrange driver and tours of the city. we found Pankaj, Rajesh and Ekta to be especially helpful, hospitable and would readily return on another visit.
the staff is very accomodating, in particular Rajesh and Ekta on the front desk. one of its main attractions is the location, right at the heart of the maddness. Love it.

we booked our first two nights at the Hotel Clark International in Delhi through Expedia. the hotel was charged £40.70 per night - a lot for India, but we wanted to ensure the first nights were comfortable. on arrival at Delhi International Airport, there was no one out there to pick us up.
in Delhi you get what you pay for compared to hotel Clark's £35 per night. it isn't the most luxurious hotel in town, but it provides good facilities in a lively part of town - well worth the money!

the hotel is located in Karol Bagh and is right in the heart of things,clustered with back street markets and extremely lively. 75% of Delhi is like this. we based ourselves here for 5 nights, the rooms are clean and well maintained.if you want to see, feel and smell Delhi and thats probably why your are visist this city! then stay here.
hotel collaborates with a travel agent named Haroon, who is excellent. he made various bookings for us and we found him friendly and reliable.

check-in was anything but smooth despite having an explicit pre-paid reservation for two adults and two kids (6, 4) front-desk was insistent to have 600 INR/night for extra bed. breakfast was not at all impressive... yeah even taking room rates in account. bathroom standard should have been better. TV wasn't working, there is only 2-3 channels tuned in.... we never tried to tune in more nor did we complaint, to be fair.

the hotel car picked us up from the airport, when we arrived at the Clark I nearly called a taxi to take us to the Imperial Hotel where I had stayed previously. we were taken up to our room, which was lovely, the bed was very comfotable with crisp clean sheets, air con cooled the room very fast and hot shower. the next day we got went up on the top floor for breakfast which had everything you could want to eat with an excellent view.
clean, smallish but well-kept room (with noisy a/c) friendly and helpful staff. the area is noisy and colorful, which we rather enjoyed. no bad surprises. recommended.

the staff at the hotel were very helpful; the rooms were great and the breakfast second to none. if we needed any help with minor things that can usually go wrong on holiday we found that they had a winning partnership with Abyss Tours which many other car operators must envy in Old Delhi.

the major problem this hotel has is their association with Abyss Travel...they are a joke, so see through makes you laugh. all the old tricks...obvious plants lies, lies lies. it's shame that an 'could be good hotel" has to associate its self with, and promote, Abiya Travel. please don't take us for fools.

the hotel is right in the "horn honking' center of things. my room was small but clean and comfortable. the staff were all very kind. there was an internet snafu when I first arrived, but the manager stayed with the problem until he got it fixed and I could get online.
free breakfast buffet was great with a mix of local and american food. you may need to use ear plugs at night because of dogs barking and autos honking.
a really recommendable, clean, friendly hotel with all mod cons (inc wi fi) by Indian standards it's very fairly priced too, so book well in advance to be sure of getting.
the front desk staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. they were very happy to assist in arranging drivers, tours or train travel at competitive prices.

efficient pick-up from airport even though plane was delayed. Handy for Metro.. good value hotel. included breakfast was good, and Nepali "head 'head' waiter very friendly. also minibar with reasonably priced drinks, including water, which is useful if you have just arrived from the airport.

stayed on two occasions in Jan. one night at first then 3 nights after a 6 day train journey. the rooms were clean,the bathrooms had bath, shower, all very clean and mini-bar & air con,TV and free internet connection. there was some traffic noise but unavoidable in so busy city and no fault of the hotel.

our rooms were spotlessly cleaned each day, bed linen was changed daily, hot water was plentiful. staff were extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. restaurant facilities and breakfast was very good. Room service excellent.

we stayed at the Clark Hotel in July, 2007. My husband is Indian, but not from Delhi. the hotel was clean, with good airconditioning (except during the daily power cuts) the morning breakfast buffet was good, and toast was available for picky eaters (like my children)

we had no problems with the water, hot water all the time. the outside of the hotel was dirty and would not like to have walked outside on my own but that is the case all over Delhi. we stayed there for 2 weeks and if I can remember it went out twice to come back on in 5mins or less.

the hotel was on the 2nd floor and we could hear the vehicles passing by, horns beeping, people's voices, and others. we had a portable heater in our room and it wasn't working, so we phoned the reception to replace it. they did...with another non-working unit.
good hotel in Delhi, offered free airport pickup. great breakfast included in room price. room had a modern feel. good breakfast includes free shuttle bus to the hotel.

the reception was transformed in the space of 24hrs - no mucking about! and it really didn't affect us just added to the adventures of India. we were picked up as promised from the airport which I highly recommend, the room was excellent (we chose to stay in one of the suites) the travel guide sorted us out for our private car trips around Delhi, Taj Mahal and then onto Japiur.Food here is excellent so we ate here on both evenings!

the hotel travel agent is dodgy and tried to make me go to Kashmir. but the internet was free. the service was very mixed. some people were helpful, others were downright rude, especially the man who asked me to pay extra for the taxi. I would recommend this place ONLY to budget travellers.

the hotel allowed us a room at 1/3 of the normal rate. the room was amazing, all European amenities, tandoori platter for rs350, enough for two people. if you stay at this hotel you wont be disappointed.

teacher who went with colleague and 6 students on a trip to India. we spend our very first night in the Clark and this was the best introduction to india. the rooms were large with high ceilings and the latest in equipment and bathroom convenience... we had everything down to the bathroom slippers.

the hotel is literally a 30 second walk from Karol Bagh market which is great fun. you will get beggars in this area but throughout India is shame as there are so many homeless children. try and get as much as possible as you wil get harrased.

we were in Delhi for the VIV India Exhibition at the Pragati Maidan, cost was a consideration when I chose the Clark International but we felt we had excellent value for money. the rooftop restaurant is very good, the food is excellent and although the hotel doesn't have any bar you can get beer with your meal.
very clean and functional room (401), helpful staff. they agreed without problem to replace the free airport pickup which we didn't need by an airport drop-off early morning.

the hotel is located in Asia's biggest shopping area, Karol Bagh. the ultra-modern Delhi Metro station is 5 minutes from the stayed. you can get to Delhi commercial and business center, Connaught Place, in just a few minutes more.
stayed in this hotel 3 nights Oct 07. transfer from airport good as we were 90 mins late the driver waited for us. no view blacked out widow ( a concrete wall behind)

we hit the Clark International Hotel after 3 weeks in Bangalore and a couple of days in Udaipur. we booked through Otel.com, and paid online for an Executive room, one up from the normal room type, but when we checked in we got given the most basic crummy room which had been painted that morning (paint still wet to touch)
hotel was ok, was being decorated so constant smell of turps. no window which I found a bit weird. breakfast was good on top floor restaurant, staff generally helpful.
booked via Expedia 3 weeks prior to stay, included in room price ($100 AUD) was airport pick-up. on arrival day had to email hotel to make sure they were going to pick us up (they were not bothered)

we opted for the most expensive room on the property, which was around US$125 per night. the hotel is located in a noisy and busy area, and to be honest, the staff were very friendly and the other hotel guests we chatted with in the lobby loved the place.

a slew of hotels in the $30 range and $300 range would fit right into the middle. rooms are noisy, "India Clean" (sort of scruffy) and not worth more than $40. it seems the hotel is advertising on places like Expedia looking for people shopping by price - and trusting that you get what you pay for.

my flight was 4 hours late and I had no idea what to expect. a huge wave of relief washed over me when I found my name being held up by an open face at the front of the overwhelming crowd. the hotel’s choice of tour agency to help me plan the rest of my journey to Rajasthan, Kashmir and Daramshala was outstanding.

the staff is very courteous and helpful.2 the rooms are clean and when you request extra towels or sheets, they are provided promptly.4. the hotel is centrally located and one can easily access major tourist attractions.

based on reviews on TripAdvisor, we settled on the Clark Intl. the hotel staff showed up at the airport as promised for the complimentary pickup. they come in an Indica (small car) so if you are a large family with luggage cal them and let them know in advance.
the hotel is centrally located in the Karol bagh area and close to Metro station. the facilities are clean and maintained reasonaby well - the complementary breakfast is good!

the hotel was able to accommodate us immediately, which after a long journey was greatly appreciated. the room was basic but spotlessly clean with an air cooler (rather that air conditioning) which was noisy but apply drowned out the street noise below.as anticipated we were offered trips, booked through the hotels' travel agency, but when we declined their offer there was no 'hard sell'

my pal and I had a terrific room in an not-so-full hotel for an off-season price. our two-bed room was very clean, we had air conditioning, fridge, ceiling fan, cable TV, nice bathroom, and very nice staff happy to help.

the hotel is close to a local night market and only five minutes from the Karol Bagh metro. he lied about the seat availabilty, luring us to his expensive car rides. check with ABC (?) travels, which is on the corner of the hotels block.

the hotel had over-booked itself and were abruptly ushered round the corner to a much lower standard hotel. we can only review it on the basis of the accomodaiton they supplied us with: the rooms were dull and not clean (a thick layer of dust covered most the furniture); the bathroom consisted of 'a shower, an overflowing toilet and bucket; the ceiling was covered with small flies and the room was noisy (children running around and constant unidentified dripping in each
the hotel is a 5 minutes (may be 3) walk and the metro goes directly to Connaught place. the staff is very welcoming and help for finding places where you want to go.

rooms on both occations were small but rather clean with good bed linen. bathrooms came with working but primitive showers and toilets. good towels provided and they even had toiletries. neighborhood is an extremly busy bazaar area with traffic that drives you crazy.

the hotel Clark International itself was nice, but was on a narrow side street in an older part of town. the airport was over an hour late, and the driver tried to hustle me to travel agency - but we needed time to rest because my traveling companion wasn't feeling well from the flight. he took me one minute's walk to Indian Tribal Tours (see my review in Delhi info). the dining room is on the top-5th-floor, although the very old elevator only goes to the fourth floor, so it'
the hotel was noisy between 7am- 7pm because of the market, but you felt like you were in India and not a sterile 5* hotel.
the hotel took care of all our transportation and tour arrangements from the moment we landed to our departure. the tours were good and the pickup is handy.
the hotel is located in the odd shopping district of Delhi with small streets and shops, be prepared for noise, dust, disorganised telephone lines, stray dogs and endless dust.

the hotel clark is three star amenities but they have some five star facilities. i got pick-up on time as they promised. food was really good. staff was very friendly. and one of the best interesting thing is free wi-fi.

the hotel staff were efficient at arranging taxis and giving advice on other transport/tourist issues. the airport pick-up makes even more sense in that you can get a grip on the geography of the place before you venture out.

a few words for the hotel - it is situated near Khan Road (Ghaffar market) and honestly it's very busy area, dirt, small shops, street vendors, ugly buildings. some of the other hotels in the area are OK, like Clark International, and good hotels, which I later saw.

Infrastructure - excellent.Room & Toilet. Spic n span, clean at the corners, pleasant colors, cleanliness 'n comfortable bed' and clean linen and towels, well stocked mini fridge.Staff: Extremely friendly, cooperative and supportive.Travel support: very good with in-house cars and drivers. airport transfer is included.Location: centrally located. good for shopping. metro station is close by.suggestion: Keep tissue boxes in the rooms.Downside

staff very helpful and check in/out was very smooth.Rooms were fine - probably worth going for one up from the standard so you are higher up and away from street noise. there is also a local market one road down that starts 5-ish until late (except Mondays)
the hotel was good, Rooms were clean with clean cloth covers. the room was clean and the staff were very nice. a nice stay! the rooms were nice and clean.
I had a nice stay in the hotel with my wife. homly &s clean environment with prompt service was great. value for the money.Staff was kind and helpful.
staff were helpful, area was dodgy.. staff was helpful and helpful. location was a good place to crash..
room service was good if you put some money for the house keeping. price they charge for rooms is again too high for what you want to get. management should be ashamed of them.

we travelled Delhi in group tour of india of Delhi Agra Jaipur Jaiselmer. hotel Classic is nice clean hotel with good facilities. we were served well by smiling staff. Hotel is near metro station will lift which in useful for old person like us.
hotel Classic is Classic in all means. I was planning to cancel my trip to India due to disturbances in India. Owner Jitendra Chadda helped me on email and assured that he will take care of us.

I have been visiting india's cities for last 2Months. this hotel has been most comfortable and memorable experience. i am visiting the cities of india for the last two month s. the hotel is a very comfortable stay in the city of london..

i booked the hotel on internet after seeing good reviews but on my arrival uncleaned room given to me. when I request the front desk they tell me to wait for 2 hours but after that they shift my room and again there was same problem. but at last they solve the problem - over all experience was bad the room service was not good.the front manager was polite and good but service wasn zero.

the hotel is in the middle of a slightly quieter surburban district. it is the easiest, cheapest, least hassle method of getting round to the nearest metro station, which for Westerners is most convenient for westerners. the metro being so close was perfect. although being separated (boys in one line, girls in another) for X-ray scanning prior to embarking everytime was certainly an interesting method that I doubt passengers would tolerate on the Tube.

we had beed reffered by friends who visited last year. good clean budget hotel in market area Koral Bugh was a good place to stay in the city of slam. stayed at good Clean Budget Hotel in Market area. it was very nice experience. staff very friendly.

the hotel was clean comfortable beds and occationally hot water. the staff are a real jolly gang and couldn't do enough to help us, they booked local taxi to take us round Delhi for the day and this is probably the best way to see most things in Delhi.

hotel was refered to us through common friend. but before placing booking on Expedia we foud it very satifactory. we were picked up from Airport on request to hotel and were given room on 3rd floor as requested in mail.

we stayed here for just one night prior to returning home. the whole appearance is shabby however we were not prepared for the rude awakening by the bed bugs...very large bed bug bugs. on complaining at the front desk they brought up a bug spray and 'clean' bedding which in fact looked even dirtier. no breakfast is included and to be honest I'd really have my doubts on the standard of hygiene in food preperation...therefore we did not call for any room service.Its not

the location is very convenient for the metro. there's an internet terminal in the lobby and wi-fi, and a mini-bar in front of the hotel. the staff is fabulous, always eager to help and friendly I needed an Indian SIM card for my cell phone.

we phoned to ask for clean sheets but the sheets the staff brought up were worse than the ones already on the bed. they went through several sets of sheets looking for cleaner ones but found them all in a similar state with blood stains, greese spots and/or holes. for IRs 2811 (approximately US $60.00)
the hotel picked us up from the airport, saving a huge amount of time & hassle. the next morning we found that we were in the very safe and friendly Karol Bagh.
the staff were fine - although sent me to get ripped off when buying a SIM card from their friend. airport pick up was good but you can do it for MUCH cheaper.

the lobby is very small and the only seating area is next to the reception desk, practically blocking the main thoroughfare of the hotel. this is an inconvenience, not a value add. not at all comfortable and certainly not appropriate for any more than 5-10 min use.
Very clean hotel in Busting Delhi. Very cheap and found same as given in reviws. staff help guide you for city vision and Jaipur - provided hot B;fast in Room very early morning!

our worries vanished when we arrived at hotel Classic. agent made a perfect choice as we required clean but not costly rooms. hotel was extremely clean. staff was very cheerful and replied to my queries about Agra.

we booked this hotel by watching reviews of the hotel. I requested airport pickup at midnight and hotel offered pickup for US$20 instead of us$25 as listed in website. they were prompted in replying and confirming. Maduu Hotel Pickup person was waiting for us in A/C Car. Room was same as shown in site. No Carpets with Wifi at Lobby-FREE. Now at Indore I called hotel and thanked.

i spent 3 nights in this hotel.Rooms were quite good, clean and not noisy. I would avoid room 104 and 107 on 1st floor, since they are next to some a/c machines and imagine are quite noisy.Staff was nice, spoke good english and helped me whenever I asked for. hotel is 5 min walking from metro station.
our Uncle Booked 2 Rooms for us in this good hotel. we were very afraid to travel to India due to Bombs and terrorist attacks. but for a marrige sake in Mogga(Punjab) we had to come.

the hotel Classic is an average mid-range hotel in the bustling Karol Bagh district. we paid 1500 rupees per night for a private AC room. the room service menu (including breakfast) is very cheap for basic but tasty food.

this hotel turned out to be the PERFECT starting point for our visit to India. Mr. Jitender set me up with a local travel agency to make other hotel arrangements in India. the hotel was very inexpensive by my travel standards as I am used to paying $100 to $200 per night.

train,flight reservation can be made thru this hotel and the most important thing, u can chat and get informations online from the staff. the hotel staff are very helpful,especially the manager. train and flight reservation is a great location near the metro station. good location, close to metro stations. i's the train train station is near stt..

this is an inexpensive hotel in a very crowded neighborhood that will probably be very foreign and confusing to most westerners. I stayed here for two nights upon arriving in india, and while the hotel itself is fine, above average value by Indian standards, I would advise staying at an Western hotel for 'a couple of days upon arrival'

we stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our holiday in india. the first part in a room and the second in an suite was large, clean and quiet - the staff were courteous, obliging and quietly efficient!
hotel has the best service you could want. they made us feel right at home. all of the staff were very respectful and greeted us with a welcoming smile.

this was the one decent place we stayed in in india and it made a world of difference. good service and not that expensive though not sure how much we paid. its not the best value for money we have had but worth spending up for. I have now few hours to linger at Delhi Airport, so thought of posting review instead of crushing down in rush at counters.

the service, facilities and management is uncomarable to any 3* hotel anywhere. they kept person waiting at Airport even our flight was late almost 3hours and they didn't charge extra penny for such delay. we are here blessed with Free Wi Fi with compliments of management. Owner /Boss?? is wonderful guy assisting our local trips with detailed maps- that too complimentry!!!!. staff here is attentive to our calls and swing into action whenever required. Location is marvelousl- in busy busy market. Pollution

I booked this hotel for 2 nights after having seen some positive reviews on Trip Advisor. subsequently a couple of very poor reviews had been posted, one of which suggested that guests were somehow induced to write good reviews. it was therefore with some trepidation that I decided to stick with my original reservation, and was too late to cancel anyway. the pre-booked transfer from the airport could not have been smoother, especially given that my flight was over 2 hours late arriving.

i always make my customers stay there and all appreciate the hotel. ideally located,excellent service,warm staff and excellent staff. excellent service and a great location to close close to all the utss and the city.
this hotel is really OK nothing exciting but clean and the stuff was very friendly and helpful. it is situated right in the centre, which is good as well.

we often find hotels on TripAdvisor, and we will continue to try. if anything, it was worth much less than the $50 a night we paid. the rooms were not clean. we had to ask for towels. three or four people hung around asking for tips. 3 guys carried up two bags with their hands out the whole time.

we booked online via a 3rd party site and were sold an 'room + breakfast" option. they don't have their own kitchen or dining room, nor do they offer any kind of breakfast with the room. the building is fairly old and the elevator tiny, the rooms old fashioned. it's no worse than many places I've stayed in NYC, Rome and elsewhere of the same vintage.

after reading positive reviews on tripadvisor.com, I've decided to book a 4 night stay at this hotel. one of our Indian colleagues went upstairs with us, on the night of the first day, and we moved to Sri Nanak Continental, which is considered to be ok/nice for an average middle class family in India. if you can, avoid Karol Bagh too.

above average compared to other New Delhi moderately priced hotels. if possible, call direct to book--much cheaper. everything worked; A/C, TV, fan, hot water. asked for and received fresh towels when necessary. Tip everyone that helped you during your stay on the way out.
the metro was very close and easy to use. the rooms were clean and the front desk staff spoke English. this was a good hotel (with air conditioning and back up generator).

this is a decent hotel in the heart of the shopping district. we stayed at this hotel for several days on two separate occassions, and the third floor rooms are much nicer and quieter. for the price, it's about the best you can find in Delhi.

myself and 3 other friends stayed at the Dee Marks for 2 nights. the hotel was dimly lit and seemed like no one was there, but the doorman was hovering expecting a tip from bringing us fresh towels, to ice to room service. breakfast was very dissapointing. bread, fruit...and can order eggs through the waiter.

this hotel was selected by me & my friends on certain aspects, like reasonable rate package. but if we come on room package what hotel is providing on other aspects, then it was upsetting as many things was not in working as I have seen on net like swimming pool, WIFI complementary, aurvidic message,etc.

the hotel is good, the rooms are clean, spacious, value for money. they have individual air-con, a good TV, and the bed is comfy. but it's let down by petty things, like associated with the staff.they advertise Wi-Fi, but you find out you have to pay for it!

i booked the super deluxe suite with them on the phone at a price of £550 for 5 nights. after some arguing she reluctantly wanted back to my room he found brochure outlining rooms in which the hotel was equivelant to the suite. at rates to go the prices are confirmed and the manager should honour it as confirmed.

a new, modern hotel inside, we didn’t get to see the grounds since we got there late in the day. the folks who checked us in were professional and assured us if we were able to take the taxi to the airport the next morning was included in our price of the room.
I was in hotel Ajanta the sister concern of this hotel for 3 days on work. I checked out, made a trip to Agra and returned to the hotel.

the website is misleading and the place is disgusting. there was actual blood on the walls of the bathroom and building is falling apart. the management will lie to you and rip you off. a terrible experience. this is an absolutely disgusted experience, if you stay here. do not stay there. The website lies lies and it's slam. it is the worst thing you want to stay in the world. you don't want staying here - the site is dreadful and you should stay stay.

the hotel is nothing like the photos you see (most of these are actually of the adjoining Ajanta Hotel which appears to have some kind of partnership going with the Delhi City Centre hotel) the room whilst 'cleaned' was uncomfortable in that the sheets and towels were grey and so threadbare there were holes in them.
the staff helped me understand where to go and what to see. my friends stayed in ajanta hotel and we would all walk to Connaught Place to eat Indian spicy 'chat'
the staff charge things you haven't consumed, and for that price you can go to a REAL HOTEL. the government would close it for obvious reasons, they cheat everytime they can, you will be robbed!

we stayed at this hotel with our 3 children in the Family room. they asked us to go to our room without them but we refused and finally they brought them back.the room itself was ok, but not clean, especially the sheets which were changed and changed.but there were apparently no sheets without rips or stains - so we just put up with ripped sheets!
the photos on the website are of the Ajanta (which look quite reasonable), not the Hotel Delhi Centre and you will find out why. the hotel is cheap and cheerful, but this is not even that good.

i was on a business trip to Delhi and fortunately I had the privilege to book the hotel of my choice. luckily my destiny took me me to this hotel and it's not an three star hotel pls don't get misguided and secondly its the place you are destined to deserve the worst possible respect"
Hello,Escort girl entered by the back door with her client, customer of the hotel. although they were discreet, they weren't hiding. this hotel is probably not to recommend for family.

my daughter and I had booked in advance 5 nights at this hotel. the hotel is operated by the Ajanta Hotel and is located behind the ajantoa hotel. breakfast is also served at the Hotel. it advertised being adjacent the train station.

the room was smaller than expected and not especially clean. the staff was friendly, spoke good English, and was helpful. we were disappointed that the "free wifi' that was supposed to be included was non-existent.
staff at this hotel make it a great place to stay. trip to delhi would not have been nearly as good if we hadn't had staff to guide us. the room met my expectations and the breakfast was good.

I stayed at this hotel 2 nights, I think the location is great to go to Delhi station, metro, Connaught place. I felt the price is a bit expensive with total.and this area - Pahar Ganji, Main bazar are very busy so if not, you will enjoy your stay.
brand new hotel,picked us up from the airport gave us a nice hot meal at 3 am at night. hotel staff spent enuf time to answer my questions and have recomended them to my organisation.
this is a super choice for the budget traveller, close to Connaught Place and Old Delhi. much better than many other cheap places opposite the railway station.

for the price I paid, I got exactly what I wanted - clean, comfortable and welcoming place to stay in Delhi! the staff was extremely helpful and go out of their way to serve all your needs. the room was good size, freshly painted with clean sheets etc.
the pictures on the website are misleading. the airport pickup was a plus. we were disappointed with this hotel.we should have researched it better.

we booked this hotel from the airport through lastminute.com and reluctant to leave the taxi upon arrival (basically a very busy commercial street!). greeted by friendly doorman who took us to reception and from there on the experience was great.
the hotel is very comfortable compared to the hotels in that locality, seriously. stayed in express 66 for the first time in delhi for 3 nights got one night free and also paid $45 per night though.

we were so unhappy with this hotel, when we saw mouse in our room we all are scared and all jerk staff start smiling. Slept there one night because we had no choice. Coughed most of the night due to the smoke-embedded room. eyes were on fire for a full 24 hours after checking out. even the guy at the front desk thought it was horrible.

we reached Delhi by Rajdhani express in the evening from a hectic tour in calcutta. we contacted the hotel people on telephone,and booked one executive room, and booked an executive suite, we arrived by cab and we were offered welcome drink (Coke). the staff was very humble and polite and always ready to help.

we reached delhi at about 10.30 pm. we were exausted as we came out of te airport the pickup cab was waiting for us as promised by the Hotel - it took 35 min to reach the hotel from the airport a guy was standing there to welcome us with the refreshing drink. the executive room was in every way very comfotable at VERY LOW PRICE according to my budget.we ordered for Indian food and it came in approx. 25 min.
I travelled to delhi for business purpose and was looking for some hotel near to pahar ganj & found Express 66.

good service friendly staff at front office, rooms were clean and were informed that these were recently renovated. looked better than the ones on the website quite surprising. use of jazzy wallpaper's and wooden paneling not bad....

the 3 night stay was our final leg of a month travelling around india. it is located on the main road home to the timber and timber industry which is in use 24 hours so if you are light sleeper like me then not ideal. there is no restaurant and you have to order breakfast (which was included in our package) and any other food via room service is then brought to your room.

hotel suites for local to stay between railway travel - new Delhi railway station is in 500 meters. you cant open windows both because of dust, smog and noise. WiFi doesn't work. we even ate there, no stomach problems.

we stayed at Express66 for 3 nights. the hotel was clean and represented excellent value for money in Delhi. rooms differed from photos that we had seen but rooms are as they appear on the website. hotel isn't on best street but at least it's not in the heart of busy/noisy Paharganj. breakfast included breakfast but there is no restaurant so this had to be taken in a room which is not ideal. Overall we would recommend this hotel.
the hotel rooms are spacious & elegantly designed. the best part is that everything in the room was in perfecty working condition which we didn't find in any other hotel in India.

the hotel entry looked like an ugly storage buiding with nothing nice. when we entered the room many details were wrong firstly we tried to swich on the TV it didn t work (no conectors). when i told to the staff they send one guy whom after looking the conctor he went away and never came back with solution.
the hotel is in a very shabby part of the town. it is based on its high review on TripAdvisor and its relatively low price - it's run by frauds!
the hotel location is not very good, but the rooms are news, comfortable and clean. the staff is very friendly and helpful. I have a great time in Express 66.
my family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Express 66. we reached Delhi very late at night on march 19th, and the hotel pickup service was at the airport on time, awaiting our arrival.
I stayed in Express66 not once but twice and have reservation for the third time. the rooms and bathrooms are very clean and the manager and rest of staff are helpful and their service is excellent.
the hotel is new and it is quite small (there are only three floors with a few rooms per floor). the rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are new.
the Florence Delhi is a small chain of moderately priced, small and friendly hotels. the staff worked very hard to please. The hotel was clean and comfortable, certainly sa 3+ star.

hotel Florence offers picks up facility to our guest @ reasonable price. the staff received us at the airport and we were in hotel within 35 minutes.Room services were also round the clock and I felt that all staff members have very jolly and friendly nature.

the breakfast on the first day of our stay consisted of scrambled eggs and toasts with jam though we expected buffet. only 4 rooms are occupied, so there is no reason to cook for a buffet, and when we asked for at least some vegetables, we were offered to pay additionally. there was no hot water at 11 o'clock at night.
the hotel Florence is a comfortable place in "Budget' style, conveniently located close to Delhi’s most famous shopping hub called Karol bagh.

Florence is situated in the busy areas of Karol Bagh. ideally positioned2) Very very very clean3) Good Service4) Bang in Middle of the shopping areas5) Good Food in Florence as well as the locality around6) Good Rates Only Drawback : Repetitive Breakfast, the same everyday.

we stayed at hotel Florence just the final night before flying back home after 2 weeks of travelling around Rajasthan. the hotel was clean and the staff very friendly, but the whole décor was rather old and stuffy...Delhi overall is very expensive compared to the rest of India, so the double room at Rs3000 was probably not bad for Delhi standards, as the room rate included a Welcome Drink and breakfast.Breakfast buffet was ok – not very big and “very Indian”, but ultimately you could also get non

the rooms are small, but well appointed and well maintained, with Mini Bars and excellent restaurant on the top floor. in a city where quality and price do not always carry the relationship that one would expect, the Hotel Florence is 'a very safe choice'

a 'deluxe" room with window was of decent size and cleanliness. but the view was horrifying - there were hundreds of tiny beetle-like bugs crawling around outside on the other side of the window. there was also an inconsistent supply of hot water.
the place is inconveniently located and an unattractive neighbourhood. it is both far from the train stations and Delhi's tourist spots. During night time it looks like a slum.

the deluxe room, where I stayed for two nights, was a bit small but not cramped. it was passably clean but the smell of moth balls that were placed in different parts of the room was an assault to the senses. I also appreciated that they immediately replied to my email asking about room availability and then reservation.

Incredible India staff were very helpful and went out of the way to help us. this hotel is ok, not great, but something decent for those on budget. location is in the shopping areas, althought most of Delhi is like a shopping area...

the hotel is nice and new in the centre of Karol Bagh with auto rickshaws and shops all around making it easy to get around Delhi from this great centre. staff were great and will stay again next time we go.Breakfast included and choices were excellent... loved the chai (ginger tea).

stayed for 2 nights on way back to Mussoorie ans. room was clean, spacious and with all basic amenities. good value for money. location is ideally suited for shopping but rather conjested and noisy; though very safe.
this is my 8th year at this hotel upgraded to a good quality. the food was excellant brilliantly cooked the bosses eat there so that should say it all so please GO there rajan &

stayed in the Good Palace for 1 night before my tour and 2 nights after tour. was pleasantly suprised, they have helpful staff who at first may seem a bit standoffish but will do anything for you if needed, and they also have great room service (some of the best food I tasted in India), and their rooms are neat and nice. i would have given it an above average rating due to good value for money but they were refurbishing the lobby during my stay and it was chaotic so it wouldnt of
our room at Hotel Good Palace was clean and decent, the walls and furniture were well maintained and the TV was functional with a basic selection of local channels.

the hotel is located in a noisy part of the city (central sales area) the rooms were small and poorly insulated. there was no hot water in the morning after 7:30 AM and the brakfast was at best. the staff tried to be helpful.
used as part of and Intrepid Tours basic trip. it was a basic hotel with dirty, languid staff, few amenities - our air conditioner wasn ot connected and we had breakfast there and had no problems.

really nice place close to metro station, helpful staff, clean and tasteful rooms. we felt really lucky to have found this place. a nice location - near the metro stations, nice staff staff and clean rooms!

this hotel is a great base for exploring Delhi and Northern India. it's only 40 rupie taxi to the train station and is located 3 blocks west of the hotel, with loads of restaurants and shops. the owner Mr.Madan will book tours and help you book train and flights. he does it at cost using Indian online travel companies.
we stayed a night and wanted to extend for 2 more nights but the hotel staff was very greedy and the rooms are old. we moved to other hotel.

rickshaw driver didn't know where the hotel was, well Delhi has millions of hotels. hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating, even though on the ground floor the entrance was sandwiched inbetween shops, do not let that deter you. once inside it is a quiet atmosphere (ok, as quiet as Delhi can get!).
taxi/rickshaws tell youthey know where it is but don't. filthy street even by Delhi’sstandards. Grim breakfast. flashy showers - ifthey worked properly!
the rooms are pretty big and clean and better than a lot of hotels we've been to in european countries. the staff was always helpful, and the owner let us use the computer as much as we needed.

they like only white europeans and can discriminate you beouse of your low potential to pay for tours, your cloor they can trouble you being bad to you and will give you a very bad room like dungeonon. you can be slammed for being 'bad' and letting you go if you don't want to spend the money on tours.

after we checked out they kept our bags for us whilst we went sight seeing and gave us a room after to freshen up before our over night train journey to Jaiselmer. two weeks later on our return we arrived in Delhi around midday but our flight wasn't till 1am. the after check out care was fantastic, they really went the extra mile.

Grand Park Inn is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in india. the rooms are simple but large and clean. The room service and hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. i have tried other hotels in Delhi but keep returning to grand park inn.

the hotel is located in the outskirts of the Karol Bargh market close to metro and shopping. the staff had pointer to a few restaurants and ended up having some of our best Indian food we had on the trip. it felt safe at all times to walk around the neighborhood.they arranged pick up as well as transportation back to the airport for very resonable price... the owner let us use his computer for our needs!
the location was initially daunting- but after afew days in India I realised this was the norm - the Karol Bagh area is actually quite good, not touristy so you don't get too much bother.

the resturant is on the right hand side of the hotel and is called Sandoz. it's a receommendation to us and we are so glad we went. get the malai kofta and dal makhini. there were ants in the room, but they stayed to thier section far away from the bed.
the hotel did not pick us up from the airport. the rooms were very basic and at cheaper price we stayed in better rooms in Karol Bagh as wechecked out after one day. not a good choice.

staff were extremely helpful and looked out for us as we were unprepared for the craziness of the city of Delhi. the rooms were spotless, the beds were very comfortable and we had no complaints whatsoever. by the end of our trip to Delhi we felt that it was safe place to stay and a refuge away from madness on the streets!!!

we needed somewhere cheap, basic with a good airport pickup all of which were satisfied. the room was basic, but had free bottled water clean sheets, towels and bathroom.the staff were very friendly and helpful even when we had to wake them up at 4.30am to check out!
air condition was not working, doors make sound while closing, salt stains in bathroom wall, life seems old too, and surrounding area is bad, economy hotel. good for few hours stay at cheap price.
the staff really looked after me well. the hot water was not reliable but was there 70% of the time. air conditioning likewise! Staff could not be more helpful.
hotel was very clean, hotel staff pleasant and helpfull and the travel desk within the hotel is great! location is OK, although not many rickshaw drivers knew it.

hotel Grand Park Inn is one of the best places to stay in Delhi. the hotel's owner, Mr. Madan Pai, arranged for Vikash to drive me to and from the wedding parties...and also to interesting sites around Delhi on the days when I had no activities planned. i can honestly say that I felt very sad to be leaving this hotel and its staff...now THAT'S a first!!

our daughter and i stayed at the hotel Grand Park Inn during our stay in central Delhi. hotel staff and management were exptremely courteous and helpful, despite being in the centre of the 'automotive" trade' we found the pick up from the airport and train station very reliable and safe, with clean bathrooms, air conditioning that works clean and the food and room service were prompt and delicious.
the hotel is surrounded by auto shops primarily for motorcyles. the metro is not that far away but getting across the busy road to access it is an adrenaline rush... not for the faint hearted!
the manager makes everything possible to satisfy his guests. pick up & drop off service from/to the airport is also reliable.

the driver was always punctual courteous and very patient! his driving skills were exceptional along with his intimate knowledge of the city. I would have no hesitation in recommending anyone who wants to experience the real Delhi its wonderful people and high level of friendly service to stay in this gem of a hotel.
the facilities are great as it is very close to the karol bagh market and an auto rickshaw ride away from Connought place.

the hotel is convenient for the metro station, auto rickshaws and buses to travle round Delhi. the owner/manager (?) Madan was so welcoming, full of restaurant recommendations (good ones), helpful hints and couldn't do enough to help us.would recommend the Grand Park Inn to anyone wanting to stay somewhere that's not a global chain, has some Indian characteristics and wants good friendly service.

I can recommend this Hotel to international tourists without hesitation. i have stayed at the Grand Park Inn for the past 5 years and have been impressed by the clean and neat and comfortable rooms as well as the efficient staff and the GM, Mr Madan Pai who has his finger on the pulse.
the lunch and the complementary break fast were very tasty. it had most of the things that you look in a hotel. the breakfast was excellent - it was the best hotel in the world.

i had stayed in many hotels in delhi, but grand park, is extremely nice and comfortable hotel, staff is great very freindly abd specially owners are there themselves to check all our requirements, very clean place to live in....harryry live.

the hotel was easy to find, as well, because of its proximity to the gigantic Hanuman statue down the road. the value was good, and as much as was provided, nothing extra was asked. I will definitely return on my next stay in Delhi.

the staff were the same boys as last year and they all rememberd us. the servis and clenliness is second to none, and the organisation was excelent. we intend going to Delhi again next year - and because of the way we are treated by everyone concerned, we will be staying at the Grand Park Inn yet again.
it was average hotel but I am still satisfied with my stay. the only thing I did not like much was its location which is a very busy and congested lane.

this was between Average and Very Good (so really just Good) ac was not good though noisy and ineffective. hotel organised taxi for us for the day (recommended) but we got annoyed when he kept bringing us to places (shops) where 'he'd get commission if we bought something'

excellent customer service. clean and centrally located. complimentary breakfast with choice of continental or Indian menu. Friendly staff. Provision for left baggage for returning guests away on short excursions. email response within one day.
location is not so good and price is too much. unnecessary huge rooms but not at all professional behaviour...and staff are terriblly poor knowledged.Stay here, if you do not have a better option.
all-in-all value for money. the room i stayed was clean and the food served was good. food was tasting OK.

the complimentary breakfast is a simple parantha type of thing, but tasty nonetheless. if you are looking for an overnight stay without the frills of an excellent hotel, this isn't the bad place at all.
itCheap is a good place to crash out in the night. clean rooms are clean, clean and value for money.

a true gem of Delhi and to Mr Madan Pai and Team: I salute you! from Prinitha Dowlath and family, south africa. the 'room boys' prayed each day for their mother's recovery, and they stayed at the Grand park inn on 2 prev trips and enjoyed the service excellence and clean rooms. he also topped up my fathers mobile phone with airtime from his personal funds.

we visited india for two weeks and the Grand Park Inn was our base. the trips we booked with Mr. Madan Pai were A-1 - the inn is clean and clean. we came as strangers; we left as friends. Thank you much for everything, Mr pai!
the hotel is well situated for the metro & local market area 5 mins walk away.Rooms (1800 rupees double)are spacious and immaculate and all staff smiley and helful.
the location of the hotel was not ideal for lone female travellers. the area is made up of car repair companies - therefore there are very few females to be seen within the region.
we were able to explore all over Delhi from our base in Karol Bagh. we had to cross over a busy intersection near the Hanuman temple to get to the metro station.

we had booked this hotel initialy to start our tour in india but it happened so that arrangement was cancelled and all due to terrorism that happened in that time in mumabi. when contacted the management they were so considerate and without any fuss it was dealth with sympathy and we eventualy stayed their upon return leg of the tour.

the manager and staff at the Grand Park Inn were polite, helpful and friendly. the driver, malkit Singh, was always there on time to pick us up at a airport - and was very attentive to our needs and safety 'in the wake of the heart attack'

the hotel was spotless & the room very pretty luxurious for Delhi standards, specially for this price range. the location was pretty good, close to 'city centre' - Connaught Place, although you will need to cross some dangerous roads to get to the metro...but that was all part of the fun of dodging traffic in India!

the first night I spent in the annexed lower-priced hotel next door - this did not make me very happy, but then the next day I could change and I liked it! the room was very big, the TV worked well and the fridge even had a generator. the hotel staff was friendly (all young males), but sometimes struggled with their English.

this was our first hotel in Delhi, and we found everything apart from the breakfast and location to be very good. the location is fairly near to a metro but crossing the busy roads is required, which for some, may be tricky outside of the toursity areas where it's free for all.

the hotel is in a strange part of Delhi - lots of motor shops, motor bikes etc. the markets are wonderful, people very kind and friendly everywhere it seemed and at no time did we feel threatened when in Delhi.

we wanted a very clean and decent hotel during our Delhi-Agra trip. we had to call up hotel, Grand Park Inn.Got really good response for our call.we were glad to see the clean bathroom.Food was good.Felt homely, calm and safe.Room interiors were above average. management need to train the staff on communication skills.
the Grand Park Inn is a good clean hotel with great staff. the hotel is quite near the centre of Delhi and is very good value for money.

it was almost impossible to choose a reasonable place to stay in Delhi. but this hotel was quite good after all.location - not far from CPmanager – competent (very unusual)rooms, quite big, newly renovated and literally spotless, highest mark for cleanliness!breakfast area, too small, people have to wait, rather poorroom service, very good ( if you close your eyes on some bit of cheating)
we stayed 3 nights, but our experience was terrible. a lot of noise and the staff sometimes was insistent. the sheets weren't clean. our sheets were not clean, and we were able to stay 4 nights.

the Grand Park Inn is a very reasonably priced hotel in Delhi. but its location is less-than-nice, despite its proximity to the subway and the city's subway system. the management is awful. my key complaints: no driver from the airport although scheduled; (b) after day 2 (of 3), they move me to sister hotel; and (c) they give me room in the new hotel that has no out-facing window.

the room rate is cheap by Delhi standards, and the hotel is clean. if you get shifted to other hotels, please do not use elevators for your safety. the area around the Grand Park Inn is not good. we got conned by a nearby optician store (Punjab Opticians) that the grand park inn owner (Mr. Madan Pai) recommended.

we were very impressed with our room at hotel Grand Park Inn. the bathroom had a bath and there wasn't much hot water and you had to call the reception to turn it on and that took 10 mins to heat up. but that was fine and we got used to that.

the Grand Park Inn was our in our first destination New Delhi and also our fourth stop, en route to Kolkata. the hotel is really central located (just go out and take a taxi, it only takes you about 10 minutes to Connaught Place) the rooms were sparkling clean and service is immaculate, including some personal tourplanning. we will definitely stay there again.

we had a great stay in this hotel. find the room and hotels is well maintained. room is large & clean, and the bathroom is clean and with good hot water supply. sounds insulations can improve as we can hear dogs barking throughout the night.

the hotel was originally set to stay at the Hotel Ananda. we had complimentary airport pickup - the driver was there on time and very pleasant. this was helpful having just arrived in India. the rooms here were decent, ok size and generally clean.

we were originally booked to stay in the Ananda Hotel and moved to this more expensive hotel. the rooftop restaurant was ok, although we stayed for 3 nights and it was not serviced once - despite our reservation.

we booked in for 3 nights but started searching for a new hotel after the first day. the rooms we stayed in were ok and the bedding clean enough but there was this overwhelming bad smell that I could not take.

my stay in this hotel is not good because hotel are not clean and bad service. Very dirty smell in the hotel because outside of the hotels is a big dustbin where all the waste integrated but no manage it!

this was my second stay at Grand Peepal. I visited Delhi in May also and the service was excellent then too. the front desk staff was very attentive to my needs and safety, especially as a single woman traveling alone.

I booked this Hotel through a Travel Agent (Incredible Heritage Tours) my stay here was for great. the staff was helpfull and the reception always warm welcoming!!!I was here on bussiness but also Travelled 'abit' I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ALL TRAVELLER AND ALSO THE BUSSINESS PEOPLE.
this hotel is small but located near a big shopping area so I could buy foods, water, fruits and juices, etc very easily. shops and restaurants were accessible.

new reception due to be ready by next January. the rooms were excellent, large, clean and well equipped. however we were in rooms which have been upgraded and, as far as we could find out approximately half of the room still require upgrading. bar area was okay but dirty from dust from construction work (probably would be closed by EHS in UK).

the hotel is located in Connaught place which is the heart of Delhi. the rooms are very big & spacious but not well maintained. it is situated in the central district of the Delhi. a good location is close to the city centre.

rooms look old with stained walls; albeit large; should be maintained properly; may not stay their the next time they stay. not worth the rent charged; food not very good; room looks old and old, if it's worth a rent charge.
hotel Janpath location is good and close to connaught Place.Service is slow. front desk response is average..staff are slow and friendly.
the hotel was on the dirtiest list of india. it was the worst rip off of my life. paid 160 USD for one night at what was supposed to be a 4 star hotel.
the hotel is okay but we liked the restaurant more because of its good food and live ghajals program. it's good to be there with family and friends and enjoy the party.

the staff were doing their Diwali worship in the lobby and we had to wait over 20 minutes just to check-in and get us to our room before they were done. the rooms were too narrow and uncomfortable, the wooden tiles on the floor were creaky and the AC was turned on full blast turning the room into an ice chest - the hotel staff shouted across the corridor to each other (terrible when the sound echoes ). to top is all, they have the nerve to call the Janpath a 4

a trip to Delhi to watch the 1st ODI between India-England in march 2006. Upon reaching Delhi I was transferred to hotel Janpath for my stay. the hotel was awesome and I have never experienced such incredible service before. Dinner was the best I had over there, and the accomodation was simply satisfactory.
i loved the way of their welcome to the guest......the facilities were good.......there is slight problem of room adjustment but it can't be mind. overall its a good experience.

the hotel is located off of Janpath in a dilapidated looking side alley. the building from the outside read "MAJOR DIVE'; all over it...dirty and unruly' the rooms I was shown had NO windows and while it seemed like it might be clean, my 200Rs budget hotel at Cozy Hotel in Pahar Ghanj was looking more chic, clean and safe by the minute.

food is good in the Sagar Rathna restaurant which provides South Indian fare but the Gulnar restaurant offers a variety of cuisines is just about okay and priced at slightly higher rates. the rooms are quite spacious but have minimal facilities and the cupboard is also small. do not expect fast billing before 12 noon and do give notice atleast 1 1/2 hours before. hotel staff are not very friendly and seem quite cold.

we both agreed we had stayed in far better hotels in major european capitals for less than a quarter the price we paid here. the staff were unhelpful and the food below average, the rooms ill equipped. many rooms appear to be derelict and abandoned, or being refurbished.

hotel staff showed us a room on the 4th floor. the hotel was clean and presentable, the lobby was small, not grand at all but clean, and the elevators were the old English lift type andworked well. directlyto my left was part of hotel or not, I wasn'tsure that was in the midst of construction.
HI This is Alam. Me and my Friend stayed in this hotel in the month of October and we found hotel is good 4 star.

I booked into the Janpath for a couple of weeks because I was going to be in Delhi for work. it had nothing: no email access, no grotty bar, restaurant I didn't really try, terrible dysfunctional TV with about 2 channels and poor reception, and faulty electrics that constantly threw out sparks. the laundry service was efficient and well-done, too. and the location is obviously very good.

the "suite' consisted of carpet that looked original and contained more dirt than my garden. the windows didn't close properly, sucking the mildly cool air from the air conditioner right out. bathroom walls had mold, including the shower which only provided ice cold water.

the Janpath would be lucky to receive two stars in any other country. the location is good, but the prices are ridiculous and the rooms are very basic. three nights cost me nearly six hundred Australian dollars. do not stay at this hotel!

we were told that we could not our first choice of hotel because it was fully booked. the agent told us that she had booked the 4 star hotel which was better than our second choice, so you can imagine our horror when we booked in at the Janpath.
the hotel janpath is a government run hotel, part of the ashok group. the price was about $150 with taxes which seems to be about average for this class of hotel.

when we made reservations we were told this hotel was a 4 star. the rooms were dirty. no hot water at anytime. bathroom had mold everywhere. staff was rude. I didn't mind paying I just wanted to get my things and get out of there.

we paid way too much for the stay we got - 4700rs/night. the room, though large, was very worn, the bed was inadequate sized, and the bathroom was as clean as can be expected from this kind of hotel, not well-maintained. we had several maintenance issues while there, but the staff was quick and effective in responding.

the charges for food were like 4-5* hotels. they charged 45Rs for a cup of tea and more than 200rs/person for useless breakfast. the staff was rude, but after we had the breakfast, they said it is not.
the hotel was an absolute disgrace, there was no cleansiness we stayed 1 night. they insist on payment upfront which should of got the alarm bells ringing. DO NOT STAY HERE.

a deperate hotel - only to be used in the crisis. not recommended to stay more than one night! no hot water at all despite the fact that the staff came up twice to fix it. be very careful before you pay the bills!

pathetic, despicable, bad can't find enought negative adjectives for this hotel. rooms are like they have never been cleaned, bathrooms are as like everyone in the hotel uses one single bathroom. service very very bad. no water to drink... just plain out lousy.

my experience was terrible. I called the day before to confirm our booking with Janpath. we were rudely told that there was no reservation. he was challenging me that it was not a reservation, and then his tone changed. the room was dark and noisey and for the first time we both decided to forgoe on the bath/shower.

we had 4 rooms with inoperable showers/tubs. the water backed up the drain under the sink and flooded the bathrooms. there was only 1 room that they would change and changed again and again. The hotel wanted payment the same day we checked in. they insisted we pool our money for all the rooms and pay at one time since they refused to change money.
i was the only non-Indian on the bus, and it surely sucked. do not stay at this hotel. you don't want to waste $70/night for this crap.
delhi is really hard to get a decent hotel that isn't ridiculously expensive. it's decent and clean with good size room, bed, tv and shower/bathroom.
room 303 is sometimes very loud as the Kitchen of the rooftop restaurant is right above it, otherwise the area was quiet during nighttime.
my client wanted to visit me but can't use my laptop here, no internet access. the telephone operator was rude and rude with him while helping him with directions. a backpacker area.

we chose this hotel for our over-night stay in Delhi. the place is good value for the money. it definitely needs a little polish here and there... but our bathroom was spotless! the staff was very friendly and did their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible.

the hotel is down a bustlig side street. it is clean and the rooms are well apointed, nice double bed, TV and clean bathroom. AC and room fan available. I did not find any cockroaches - always reassuring!the staff are extremely freindly. Happy to help sort things out and are always on hand for assistance.
the room was not the biggest I had stayed in but was clean, nicely decorated, and had everything I was promised. the food was traditional Indian food, not westernised, but excelent quality.

stayed at lal's Haveli at the start and end of my recent trip to India. the rooftop restaurant provides great food at cheap prices. don't be put off by the area. give this place a chance and I am sure you will find the same wonderful hospitality.
the staff are lovely and helpful. Would recommend but dont expect luxury when you pay peanuts. no internet or wi fi in the hotel - it is around the corner.
the staff are polite and willing to serve. as the area has many hotels, it will be difficult to find a better value.

the area is great to wander around and so close to Connaught Place and I recieved an airport pick up with a nice driver who spoke good English. staff are courteous and friendly and the food on the roof top terrace is amazing!
the receptionist was very curt and said you can come and see the difference. they badly need to train their staff for a decent behaviorhelloneoo@yahoo.com.

amazing locationnice and clean new roomsvery good value for moneycourteous staffwould give it 5 outta 5. great location nice and nice rooms. nice clean rooms, nice & clean room nice nice room. a great value compared to the price. the staff would give the room 5outts if it's worth the money.
this hotel was much more than I expected for the price! I arranged a late night pickup and they were there and waiting. the room was large and very clean, the staff was plentiful and courteous.

rickshaws are available anywhere in the city anytime of day. the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, they even let me keep my luggage there free for a week as I left and travelled west into Rajhastan. there were two other great things about this hotel: first, there was an internet cafe right behind it for 20 rupees/hour. second, almost right across from it were an awesome sweets shop called Bikaner Sweets (very clean and western in setup).

this is my first time to New Delhi. before coming to Delhi I was looking several 3 stars hotel through internet and got some places that can give enjoy time during stay in Delhi. I decided one hotel named Le Roi Hotel and check in the hotel that very clean, and nice service from the front office until the room boy.

we visited hotel le Roi with friends in november 2009. we felt very nice and comfortable, we enjoyed our stay very much. I can recommend this hotel to every one who stays in Delhi. if you stay in the Delhi, you can stay here.

we stayed in le Roi late October 2009 and had a fantastic stay. the hotel is very clean and spacious the room does have little greatness and all in all it is an excellent apartment. what gives it such great review is the service you receive. I can quite honestly say I have never received such excellent service before.

i was on a business trip earlier this month and got the chance to stay in Hotel Le Roi. I was very glad with the level of service and Facillities this hotel provides - and would ensure that for my next visit which is due in January,I will again put up in this Hotel.thanks Guys for excellent service.

colossal city of new Delhi was great experience to find retreat and refreshing in le Roi Hotel. atmosphere is so nice. staff was very friendly and professional. very clean hotel. hope to be back next year..

I was on my business trip to Mauritius and India[ New Delhi ] in November 1st week. my all travel arrangement done by Trip Advisor. it was very comport,very clean & tidy, best room service with respect.
this hotel is situated in a very comfortable location,It is Less than 5 minutes walking distance from New Delhi Railway Station.Hotel rooms Speaks of Quality and Elegance.

le Roi is a brand new hotel in the middle of the crowded touristic Paharganj area. it is quiet, modern, has the best soft beds we have had in India and perfect warm shower. the rooms are very very good.

the hotel is very modern and hip, all the amenities a foreign traveler could want and expect. only problem I faced was slight connection error from my room to the internet. the excellent customer friendly staff worked out my internet connectivity issue & has gone above and beyond to accommodate some of my last minute travel planning.

it is average hotel. the roomservice is poor as they do not listen to us for older of food. i came to this hotel on recommendation of TRIPADVISER but on thecontrary it was not that good, the location is very crowded. hotel is a nice hotel with good staff and good location.
new hotel " le roi' is a very good hotel with exccelent accomodation, good services and an exquissite cusine. i highly recommend you to go there if you stop in new delhi and go to the u.s.
hotel le roi has a very central location. the pool will be soon finished in this hotel so if you come there you'll have it probably!

the hotel itself stands out for the others in the area being larger although still relatively small. the staff are excellent and show much eagerness to assist you with any problem. The rooms see no fall in standards from the entrance and are very modern with plenty of marble and dark wood with a slight euro/oriental theme.

the staff ordered food for us from outside and charged us 3 times the price. when it came time for a shower, one EACH night we had to ask staff to turn on the hot water so we could have hot shower. our bed sheets changed twice because they were blood stained and it seemed like the sheets were never changed from the previous occupants.
hotel legend is a budget property with not much else to offer. it was super cheap ($39 AUD per night) but the reviews were good compared to other properties we stayed in during this recent trip.
hotel legend international looked impressive on their website but was a fairly average hotel. the location was fine - walking distance to restaurants but rickshaw ride to Chandi Chowk, fort etc.

stayed here on three occasions during the summer with my girlfriend and extended family who were in India for a wedding. the metro also stops here so it's good for getting around the city. there is no shortage of travel guys in Delhi so shop around!
our first night in india arrived at 4am after a bus crew couldnt locate hotel. friendly staff,especially on the rooftop resturant, very pleasant rooms and great location and value.

teh bathrooms tend to get hot during the day so remember to close it as you leave. there are two computers available for free internet access, one wasn't working when I was there and they actually let me use theirs in their little office! one night we had bought too many beers and shared some with some of the service guys- they thought we were fantastic!

the room was cheap--20£ per night--and overall a really good budget hotel. DOWNSIDES-there were always loiterers in the lobby and on the stairs...I didnt understand that. Also, there were loiters in hte halls,outside our room...ready for our beck and call.

i booked the hotel from england, before travelling to delhi, as all previous reviews had been pretty positive. booked two trible bed rooms, which have one super kink bed and a single bed, and were ensuite. the whole stay cost me around £100, that includes airport pickup and drop off at the railway station.
the rooms were quite small, but they are no smaller than those in hotels in other cities elsewhere in the world. the staff were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel.
'Very hard sale' by the in-hous travel agent was annoying and worth avoiding at all costs. for what we paid, it really wasn't value for money.

this hotel was comfortable and very easy on my budget. it is located a short walk from the new Delhi train station and Metro stop - the street is lively so you may hear some noise but I was not disturbed by it. the online booking process was easy and accurate.

new Delhi train station is 5 mins walk away, and they have an excellent facility for travellers to book train tickets. the hotel gives home to a rather sleazy looking fellow who will, almost as soon as you get in, try to sell you all sorts of tours, viewing experiences and assorted malarky.

we rang and told them to pick us at domestic terminal but the driver didn't show up. the travel agent tried to charge us Rs650 for the non-existent pickup - after some arguing on two occasions we didn’t pay him. room was clean enough but there was no hot water and toilet did not flush, it just sprayed water from it's pipework across the bathroom floor. good thing about the hotel is it is only a 5 minute walk to new Delhi train station.

the man organising trips/travel at the front was a bit pushy but otherwise the staff were ok, not overly friendly but not rude. the room itself was very comfortable and spacious, air con and bathroom were good.Would happily stay again.Also free internet in the lobby.

hotel legend is one of the most popular "budget' properties in the neighborhood. the rooms were pretty much as expected although ours had no windows, and service was acceptable. we had some items stolen from our luggage there, which included a small amount of cash, I miss the money clip more than the dollars. if you eat in your room, the other option is on the rooftop which has the atmosphere of an industrial air conditioner.

this was my first experience of a hotel in india. the hotel was as advertised and had hot water as I was to discover many places said they did but actually didn't, it was reasonably clean and it even had toilet paper. staff were friendly, we were able to use the Internet in the lobby whenever we wanted.

this hotel is really noisy (both the city and the staff are extremely noisy) and it feels a bit overpriced. it's also 5 minutes away from the train station, so the location is great, especially if you're getting an early flight.

the travel guy in the lobby is definitely shady and will change his quoted price every time you talk with him. but if you bring up a price that you got at some other travel agency, he'll definitely move on his prices. breakfast is okay, but dinner is fantastic. I chalked it up to it being India and didn't let it bother me.
the Paharganj market district is one of Indias must see attractions. the hotel is satisfactory in every way, clean rooms and good service. a good budget hotel.

this hotel is so close to the shops of Paharganj, all the services are nearby. the rail station and Connaught Place are just a short rickshaw ride away from the hotel - it's clean, inexpensive, and the service is great. we'd recommend it to anyone!

the hotel is located in one of the worse locations in New Delhi! there was no hot water, limited amounts of toilet paper, the TV channels kept going and the noise from outside was so bad even ear plugs could not block it out. I would not recommend the breakfast, also the guy who sells the tours was very shady, kept changing prices?

the staff english was quite limited, and even upon arrival we were asked if we had any laundry. we even had a bellboy stationed outside our room and thought he didn't understand the word of danish, privacy was limited.Roomservice came to the immidiatly (after all, sat just outside) but they usually forced their way into the room, which was very annoying.
stayed at the hotel in the first week of March with my wife and 3 yr old daughter. good clean rooms, decent food, average hospitality.

we booked to stay at the hotel legend for 3 nights in february. no-one from hotel was at airport and we could not get through on the phone. we eventually got a taxi and when we arrived at 2am we got another gentleman who just said they were full and to come back tomorrow with no apology or explanation as too why our booking had fallen through.

the staff were helpful although sometimes pestered a little and although there is no restaurant as such the food is very good. the rooms are clean and spacious and have comfortable beds, tv and some have fridge.
compared to others in this price range (1200-1500 Rs) the rooms are well furnished (very good mattresses), clean and safe (sturdy doors with good locks).

the Legend Hotel was booked for our first few nights in intimidating India. it's a little higher than our usual budget, but having an comfortable place to get over jet lag was worth it. the street is still pretty busy but the interior of the hotel was very nice.

the international legend is a good choice because for 3000 rs you can find better place in that area. the hotel is very close to railway station but the area looks like Berlin after WWII. many people, very dirty streets.
hotel booked through email. rate of 2250rs incl tax and breakfast for a super deluxe. the room itself dont quite feel like super-deluxe, but the window was tiny and gave no view at all.
the room was pretty clean and the staff were very helpful - there was always someone available to help out. on both visits we had to ask for the air con and hot water to be switched on.
the hotel is very clean, the staff are very polite and nothing is too much trouble. the main point is that it is quiet, despite being in the middle of mad Delhi!

I and my wife stayed at hotel Legend, New Delhi for 3 nights in september. the room given to us was on 3rd floor and was clean and comfortable.the interiors of the hotel are real good (specially their 1st floor lobby)
the hotel price in Delhi is very expensive according to their level. the only problem is Wifi, there is no wifi, I have to go to the lobby to use Internet.
i'd tried to book hotel ajanta close to hotel legend, but it was booked up. had room on the top floor, clean, spacious and quiet.

the hotel is not very clean. staff is ok. Near airport. dining room. but I would suggest finding a 3 star hotel. an Indian friend made the reservation for our departure next am. Wished he would have gone for better place.

this hotel is very practically situated near the airports, so if you have an early flight (domestic or international), you won't have too much trouble. the rooms are quite spacious and fairly well equipped, and can be quite noisy at night due to the traffic on the highway just outside the hotel.
I booked this hotel through Makemytrip. it was a nice hotel, and specially recommended for people travelling through airlines - it is close to both airports (Domestic & International).

a total of 4 reviews, 2 of them mentioned filthy sheets/stains. it was the true reason why I chose this hotel, which was so close to the dehli airport, that we only had to stay in the hotel for several hours.
hot water in bathroom sink began to work, but not in shower so we had to transfer water to shower to take ladle shower. this is a terrible hotel--you would be better off at some hostels.
the hotel is pretty good located if you have an early morning flight. the rooms are well-sized, the beds ok, but staying their in the winter is extremely cold and draughty (no heater).

the hotel is on a highway that runs along the airport, but is about an 8-minute ride from/to the terminal. the first room didn't have the hot water it was supposed to have, and staff promptly upgraded me from Deluxe to Suite, for no extra charge.

the room was big, clean by Indian standards, and there was hot water in the shower. a taxi to central New Delhi should only cost about 200 rupees from here - if you are arriving or departing from the airport at an inconvenient hour. the reception staff were friendly and welcoming even during the night when we arrived, but beware of pre-paid taxi fares.

three agressive bell boys insisted on helping with our two bags upon jet-lagged arrival and all wanting tips. had trouble with AC. Breakfast adequate. Desk staff helpful. Don't stay here unless you have to. Not 'a good experience'

the hotel is situated on a good location, not far from anything if you have driver. the staff was very helpful and friendly! we also got to know hotel owner mr. Naresh (Pintoo) when we wanted to book train tickets for Agra. he advises and organizes 13 day trip through Rajasthan with car, driver, hotels, and guides in some of the cities.
the hotel Madonna is clean the staff is somewhat efficiant and they all want to make your stay as happy as possible. it is highly recommended for a comfortable and easy stay in New Dehli!
