direct communication with the owner wich can tell you a lot about india. if wanted he can arrange for fixed prices day trips and you'll be treated like his guest all the way.

my wife and I stayed at the hotel Madonna on three separate occasions while traveling between other cities in India. we really liked the night manager, Tripathi and our taxi driver, Kashmira. they were fantastic and generous and made our stay a very nice one.
Found staff and owner, Mr Naresh, to be very helpful and really enjoyed the tour organised by the hotel to Agra and Jaipur. will definitely recommend.

stayed for 2 nights whilst we did the taj and delhi sightseeingthe hotel arranged for our pick up at airport everything went very smoothlywe did tours thro the hotel and they were worth every penny driver was excellentonly problem not many places to eat around.

Mr. Naresh provided us excellent services, being very professional and a nice human being making us feel like at home. he was able to provide us great services and was very helpful and made us look like home.
this hotel was a good clean hotel right in good location to the main attractions of Dehli. the staff were brilliant and very helpful and polite.
the hotel car and driver (complimentary) was waiting for us at the airport complete with sign. Naresh also arranged the same driver for our tours of Delhi, and Agra over the next two days.

when we arrived they told us to go here so we got cab and arrived at the hotel. they said were out of triples sp we will upgrade you to a suite, so the room was so-so, with hot showers, refrigerator and refrigerator. at night there were street noise and one mourning outside our hotel there was an parade at 6 p.m.

the hotel was comfortable and clean and provided everything we needed including a brilliant sightseeing tour of dehli and then the key highlights of Rajasthan. the staff were the best and had an warm personnality.again this was awesome so much so we stayed there once we returned from our Rajasthan tour.
the hotel is ideally situated to travel in and around Delhi as well as a good departure point that does not get too involved in the hustle and bustle of the traffic congestions.

the hotel was clean and quiet, but what we liked most about the place was the staff, who were not only helpful but genuinely friendly. the owner, Mr. Naresh Bhattia, was also able to provide advice and services for travel in his part of the country, which for us meant Agra, Jaipur and Pushkar.
the hotel was nice and clean. the services were excellent. people were very helpful, when you need something the were always there.the only thing need to be upgraded is the shower.

the hotel Madonna is in my experience a good choice, with very helpful and friendly staff. this is the second time I have stayed here, and the manager even has spare GSM card for emergency guest use, if the connection fail (which it did not do during my six day stay).

we booked our stay at Hotel Madonna through Expedia, prior to consulting a print travel guide on India. the hotel staff were unable to get their computer running Windows 95 to work--they just kept checking the cables and turning it off and on. there are much better places to stay in Delhi.

the hotel madonna has been a customer since last three years. it was the first time that I visted india I was not familiar with india. i was along with my wife and were in India for her treatment purpose. the owner was alwayse asking if we need his help in travel inside India.

we stayed in hotel Madonna for the major part of our stay in India. in between, we made a trip to Jaipur and Agra organised by the hotel. hotel looks very good, nice clean rooms and good facilities. breakfast at any time, and close to the metro and central places in Delhi.

we were warmly greeted at the airport,by hotel driver no charge.,Taken directly to hotel. escorted by the bellman [Sanjay] to my room which was immaculate and very clean with all western amenities including A.C. staff was very accomodating any requests I had were fufilled,even when I left hotel I was offered a hotel business card, Staff was always concerned and wanted to make sure I always knew the way back.

we had contacted the hotel a few days before, that we would need to be picked up from the train station at 10.30pm. hotel told us to get any taxi and they would cover the cost of the taxi - but the manager who was very rude tried to argue with taxi driver and try to pay us the same day when wanting to check out. by now all we wanted to do was go to bed. when we finally got to the room it was horrible!!! Large ants all over the floor, dirty bathroom, no towels and rubbish

a colleague recommended me hotel Madonna and was very happy with the choice. the hotel arranged the accommodation, airport transfer, and tour programme with personal driver, tour guide and travel guide.
rooms were dirty, staff was unfriendly. rooms weren't clean and dirty. room was dirty and clean. staff were un friendly.
the rooms have carpet which is filthy and carpet anywhere in India is a bad idea. staff were friendly enough, breakfast staff had very limited english and the breakfast was very average.
was picked up at the airport and taken to the hotel...delightful!!Check-in was quick and easy. the owner was in thelobby..a nice gentleman. he made arrangements fora car to take us to Agra.

hotel Madonna in Delhi was very convenient to all Delhi landmarks. hotel staff were great, literally waited on us hand and foot and arranged all our trips, which included Agra and Delhi sights. the owner send us two boxes of biscuits each, that was six boxes for three people, i was impressed!

arrived in middle of night by taxi, very expensive rider, operator did not have reservation, put us up in room, dirtY, smelly, slept on top of bed. had help with luggage, but wouldn't leave until tipped well! supplies were limited to a little toilet paper, no soap, one wet towel.checked out early, they do not take credit cards...what we were told, only cash...I paid $60 and friend paid $100 only bills we had on hand.
the staying was nice; it was a clean place. but especially, Naresh, the owner, made our days in Delhi 'a safe, really nice trip'

the Madonna hotel was reserved for us by a travel agent, reputedly an 3* hotel. we arrived late at night (2am) and there were thankfully people awake. two guys brought our bags up, and stayed in the room until they tipped.

i've stayed in 8 hotels here at the budget level, and TripAdvisor was useless. the madonna staff was always trying to discourage you from talking to others about your travel needs. a sweage smell and the constant din from the street are the two things to be wary of in delhi hotel room.

stay at the hotel Madonna, ideal location to see the real Delhi. clean and safe hotel by Delhi standards and the food was acceptable. a tip of less than 100 rupees is probably more than enough for carrying your bags to the room.

a decent Delhi hotel near the metro (5-10 minute walk) so accessible to much of the city. the staff was helpful but not friendly. also not particularly attentive. breakfasts were good and the one dinner I had was very good.

the rooms were very comfortable and service excellent. we were also able to avail ourselves of the excellent service of Naresh Bhatia in organising a driver toshow us the sights of Delhi and tour of Agra and Rajasthan for 12 days.

our first and final 2 nights were spent in Delhi were we stayed at the hotel Madonna. despite being warned it would be difficult to find good hotels in the country, we struggled for an option of hotels within our price range. at about 2am we were warmly welcomed by the night manager and 2 people assisted with our bags.

we recently stayed at this hotel for 4 seperate nights. the hotel room itself seemed clean and bug free, although the sheets were very stained. both toilet paper and towels were both in shortsupply, with just one handtowel supplied (on one occassion this clearly hadn't been changed as it was dirty and wet!)
the hotel in general is clean, the restaurant underground does have an odor and the helpers are very nice. the location is not too bad, 4 blocks away from subway/metro station.

a very good hotel in Delhi, with clean rooms,excellent service, friendly and helpful staff. the hotel manager, Mr. Bathia was so friendly top arrange for usn an wo9nderful trip to Agra Pushkar and Jaipur, offering us for the best price hoytels of good standards and also helping us with the transport along all my stay.

hotel Madonna is out of the way and the neighborhood is truly India - loud all the time, with plenty of honking to keep you awake at night. compared to the place we stayed in Bombay (thicker walls), this was like sleeping in a rock concert. the bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom was fairly grungy.
the owner, Mr. Pintoo, helped me to reach every place I wanted to visit. the hotel is located near the metro, so very usefull to see the city. I'm going back in a few months, can't wait!

this hotle is locted colesed to the market place and suitable to go for site seeing. it's very clean and the staff are so kind to guests.thank you so much for evey thing, India will be our second home after Ethiopia.

Delhi is a pretty hard place to get accomodations under $100 that are reasonable. hotel Madonna is not so bad, at $81 including taxes and breakfast, and the manager was very good at making reasonably-priced car and travel arrangements for us. the area is also nice, as there aren't many tourists around to attract touts & beggars.

the people were nice enough, but I got the sense that they would try to deceive me. at check-out time, they tried to overcharge me, and they quickly rectified it. the breakfast is included - but nothing special. The dining room is subterranean and smelly.

the tripadvisor reviews for this hotel seemed okay so we booked this for 4 nights via internet. the hotel was 500R+ cheaper than poorer sounding alternatives in Connaught Place. also Karol Bagh market area, wih indian and western restaurants, is only 10 minutes walk, as is the metro station that provides a pleasant alternative to bargaining fares with rickshaw drivers.

the hotel was good but the restaurant was of poor standard every time you entered it smelt really bad; hygine was not of top of the list. tour organisers were good and we enjoyed the tour. our room was clean but basic. if you visit delhi be aware of profit making scandles your guide and taxi driver are usually in to make some money. we came across this when our guide would not let us go where we wanted to go and forcing us to buy things that we did not want
the location is by Karol Bagh station, which is convenient to get to various places (Old Delhi, Connaught Pl., etc.). room was very clean, but if you can you should try and get a room in the back.
there is a lack of mid-range hotels in India, there seems to be only $20-$25 hotels. the Madonna is under the same ownership as one 100m away which is not part of the Intl group.

the bathroom suite was black and the bath itself was peeling and a safety hazard. the toilet had one of those'sanitized for you convenience" labels on it which was joke as it was not clean.the shower curtain was filthy.Breakfast was OK.with regards to the new wing mentioned by the previous reviewer, I don't think this is being marketed as part of the Mehar as its looks from the photos in the different league.I would chose not to stay

the new hotel wing is just adjacent to the Mehar Castle, in Karol Bagh. the hotel is all new, with relatively generous, classy, ensuite rooms, tiled flooring and modern style furniture with latest appliances (a/c, TV, ceiling fan, fridge, safety lockers, etc.)

the cold shower is not something i would complain about since I didn't get it at 8 of the 9 hotels I stayed at. it's not the safest area to start out in, but you can get good bargains, and it’s close to the metro. the phone in the room is on a rotary dial system.
hotel provides good hospitality.we were provided with a family room which had two double beds. the room was perfect for my wife and my two children.
my wife and I stayed in Room # 208 (Double Deluxe Room at INR 1690/night, as advertised on their web site) the room is located within 5 minutes' walk to Karol bagh metro station.
I have stayed in many hotels in india, metro Heights was the best of the hotel especially in karol bagh area. the staff is friendly,the rooms were clean and well decoated with a big L.C.D.

the staff who actually did the work were lovely. but the management were dreadful and couldn't have cared less when we arrived back after travelling for 23 hours to find that, even though we were pre-paid, they'd put someone else in our room and we had nowjere to stay!

metro Heights had to offer us in delhi near the metro sation. we reached Metro Heights at middle of the night and had our confirmed bookin so were checked in and found a decent accommodation in what we had paid ($70 usd)

we were greeted at the reception nicely and were checked in. staright went to the bath room and had nice hot water shower(i was not sure i would get hot bath) the food took some time to come as we was ttold that it is cooked fresh.Food was good set up and decent enough considering it was in the package as complimentary.MOST imp. Part of our stay was that the hotel was clean and safe for family.

we stayed at the metro Heights as part of an organised tour. but the hotel wasn't the worst in india, but that is not a lot. the room itself was reasonably clean (including the bathroom), and there was enough hot(tish) water, although the bathtub was cracked so that only showering was possible.

hotel Metro Heights was fine but not great value for money. staff were largely unhelpful and the included breakfast left a lot to be desired. cost approximately RS 2600 which I would say was daylight robbery for the level of service provided.
the hotel offers room for 75 usd, but books through agents for only 20. staff-sideentrance is open at all times, so no security on all floors.
there are many hotels in Karol Bagh so just go to one of the others and check out the rooms. avoid this place if possible.

the two new rooms were bad compared to 111. one room had the smell of sewage. the front desk refused to provide air conditioning. we chose not to support this behavior by staying here again, and we moved next door to the Hotel Singh Sahib.
hotel staff are unfriendly, and un co-operative, especially towards females. only stay here if you must or it is part of you tour package.

staff on the counter delivered service that was akin to that of Faulty Towers. they asked for clean towels which arrived after 90 minutes and an additional request for an extra bed in the room took two hours. to get the attention of the staff was an exercise in patience where we had to wait for them to stop watching the telly in lobby or stop chatting to their friends who would often drop by for social visit.

metro Heights is sort of best-you-can-get in the lower price range (up to $ 75) in Delhi. breakfast consist of hot Indian dishes, toast and coffee/tea, a number of Dutch travel groups use the hotel, I think because they can't find anything better in that price bracket too.

the hotel Metro Heights, in Karolbagh, was our base in Delhi during our 3 week trip to India. it's within walking distance of the shopping areas, which is a bonus if you are into shopping. the rooms are okay.

the hotel is decently priced and closer to the main shopping strip in Karol Bagh. the suites are around $75 including breakfast and are quite large - the service has been better than other hotels and when the internet access was not working, they called someone in on a Sunday to check it out.i would stay here again again.

we chose this place to be near the train station as we flew in at midnight and needed to catch a 7am train. the room was small but he A/c worked and the twin beds were clean and not too hard. only problem was that we couldn't find the hallway lightswitch and it was dark trying to leave the hotel!

if you're thinking of staying at this hotel, please don't. the hotel itself was down an alleyway, but I guess a lot of Delhi hotels are. The room was good size - but even though the sheets and pillowcases had been cleaned, they certainly didn’t look it. i'm not sure what to expect from the mohan international, it's an understatement, and just underlines how little the Mohan International thinks of their guests.

we stayed at the hotel mohan international this month for one night. the room was very basic and clean, but it was clean and stains on the sheets were very weird. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to women travellers (as we were), as there were times when we felt quite uncomfortable.

the guy who worked the front desk was horrendous when he asked me why I didn't order room service. when I tried to book a taxi to the airport, the driver charged me double what we paid on our way in. the hotel is very noisy, and the free "breakfast' was pretty disgusting.

the underside of the basin was covered in rust. there are no bedsheets to sleep under, just these rugs - not sure if they're washed regularlytoo. If you get a ground floor room don't expect to wake until late! noiseof buzzers (for people calling from their room) and voices through thelate evening and early the next morning make it very difficult. and they give the hard sell on getting you to visit their travel agent.

the hotel is very basic and the cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. we paid 15 UK pounds per night as we wanted our first few nights accomodation sorted out before we arrived but with hindsight there are many similar hotels in the area which are much cheaper if you just walk in off the street.

airport pickup didn't show up, but 2 hours late. the manager kept stalking me on the hotelroom phone about tours he wanted to sell, they staff were almost agressively pushy about arranging city-tours.

there are atleast 50 other similar hotels around this one and you don't need to book this online. if you are looking for this price range, simply get off the train at the main station, walk around, ask to look at room and bed sheets before you select one, BUT DON"t GO WITH HOTEL MOHAN. its dirty, noisy, expensive, and not worth the hassle. front desk is not helpful. I got this hotel from another site and based on the listing, I figured it

hotel is located at the MAIN TRAIN STATION area which is a full 8 minutes by TAXI and quite dangerous area even in the daytime. hotel club (20 euros night) charges OUTRAGEOUS for Delhi for this type of hotel and shameful considering the condition. the cleanliness factor was overlooked as the sheets were SMEARED with dark substance I chose not to closely investigate and requested new sheets.

the hotel was clean, the loos flushed and the shower/fan and a/c worked. on arrival we felt we were stuck down an alleyway in an grotty part of town, it turns out most of Delhi looks like this, but it takes 'a bit of getting used to to'
i wish we had paid a little more and stayed somewhere better. the room was horrible, the bathroom was filthy, we arrived to find cigarette butts in the toilet, sheets where dirty, cockroaches, etc.
dirty bathroom, fan was so loud that we cant sleep, dirty bed-clothes. driver didn't want to show us where the hotel is without a big tip.

hotel Namaskar has just 2 pluses: first - its really cheap (480 rupee per room for four people)second is great location. was really hot, fans are not enough, our room didnt have windows, bathrooms are owful. next time in new delhi we will choose sth different.
the airport pickup worked perfectly for the price of quite expensive 700Rps (and the driver wanted a big tip) the rooms were budget, no hot water, accordingly not perfectly clean rooms.

I stayed at the hotel Namaskar when I first arrived in India on the 25th January. it was my first experience of Indian driving! on arriving in the bazaar, the car had to park a bit away due to the road being dug up, but the driver carried my bags to his hotel for me. the staff were very friendly and the young Nepalese boys were great, and counter staff could not have been more helpful.
I would pay extra Rs150 for a room with private bathroom, hot showers, new, clean & comfortable at Hotel Gush or Rak International (neighbours)

rickshaw operator knocked on the door and told the hotel that the room was booked. the owner came in and let me have room 2 hours early, but he said the usual charge for early check-in was 1/2 what I was quoted by the guys when I arrived in a hotel room. if you get the larger room with the water heater, you will pay 400 rupees for it until noon.
we booked the hotel for its price and reccomendation of guidebooks. the area of Paharganj is not the best in Delhi, so if you want anything remotely fancy don't stay here.

the hotel is located in the Paharganj, in an alley just off the main market street. it is walking distance to the metro (Rama Krishna Ashram Marg station) and one metro stop away from Connaught Place. the windows were blacked out, but I could hear the street noise and the heavily polluted street air made its way into the room.
this hotel Namaskar is the first on top of the budget hotel list. the problem of accomodation being recommended by Lonely Planet is that the hotel will tend to be over booked or over popular.
rooms are cheap, relatively clean but very basic. the staff and especially the two brothers are extremely helpful and can arrange for tours at very reasonable prices both in Delhi and wider India.
the people of the hotel can take you from the airport, even during the night, for 400 rupies (8 euros) they can book a taxi for you, and many other things.

hotel is average. location is midst of Karol bagh the populated area of Old Delhi. close to many places though. we stayed here as we needed to visit US Consulate for an interview. room was very good though no balcony. AC was good. Had a problem with the bathroom lock. Got locked out from inside. Bathroom has new jacuuzi but it was not that effective and was malfunctioning.

i went to Delhi for a tour with my family consisting of 3 members. we had booked rooms in an other hotel but we reached late at nite coz of the big traffic block in delhi. the other hotels people said that the room was not available at the hotel and that they have arranged room in the nearby hotel. it was very small and very conjusted.we could hardly move around...the bed spread, linens etc were so untidy and he think it hadn
my voucher for the room was deemed meaningless. a reservation at the hotel might be honored if no one else takes your room before you arrive.
a hotel like this should be less than US$10, not more. it's not like the pictures at all, but the rate for the hotel should not be more.

i booked my hotel from the website and made the payment of ther. the hotel website is [--] and it is 'value for money' and ppl say that that it's value for cash but he will say it was more than value of money one difficulty it experienced was that tv cabel was not working for 2 hour or so but later corrected it so a recamend each and everyone to visit this hotel and the site is'

'you *would* like a package tour to the Taj Mahal in Agra,' he says. the hotel has free wireless internet and is based in the u.s. but it's not legal tender if they're ripped - and this bill was ancient, but intact--not actually ripping. i'm 90% sure this guy brought the bill back because it was old, and of course since I didn't have any other small bills of the same denomination, I did give him
I got hotel booked from my indian partners & this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. everything from the service to the rooms was just terrible. check In system was horrible!
stayed there for a week. Great service. Awesome staff! Rooms are 5 star standard. Definitely you will get value for money to stay here.

we stayed only one night and our room was close to the reception. all the noise from the hall way and reception could clearly be heard all night. also there were some cat fights under the window providing more noise. try to get a room far away from reception and/or wear earplugs.Eevrything else worked OK.

Connaught Place itself is undergoing extensive restoration, so there is quite a bit of mess in the area. only trouble with the hotel is that is no lounge area for friends to meet, but you can use the restaurant for this purpose without difficulty.

Greeting was pleasant, room was small but clean and well appointed. location was so central for that part of Delhi with plenty of shops, clubs and restaurants within a few minutes walk. there was some noise, perhaps from the cinema, but it wasn't unbearable.
the staff were very attentive and our room was exceptionally clean. the hotel was also kind enough to store one of our bags for a week while we visited some cities in Rajastan.

our booking confirmation from hotels.com came through and my husband's credit card was charged the full amount. the hotel was booked for 2 nights and was refunded nearly three weeks after the incident, despite a lack of room available for us to stay in. if you book this hotel through this site you too may end up in our predicament, having to pay for your room that you are unable to staying in and with weeks of trouble trying to recover the money in vain!

the rooms inside are great, with a modern and clean decor, flat panel TV, and bathroom. the location is perfectly central, there are loads of shops, restaurants and ATMs when you step out of the hotel. all staff, from reception to housekeeping, are very courteous and helpful.

i visited Delhi as a tourist with my spouse and young kids. I chose this hotel based on other reviews. the location is perfect and rooms were very clean and comfortable. bathroom was immaculate. most site seeing locations are closer to this place and central park, Metro station is right there. restaurant is also fabulous. Overall very nice experience and would recommend with high ratings. Free wireless internet service.

the hotel is very central. the staff were extremely helpful, even to the extent of accompnaying us to find an ATM which worked. a ATM was working and the ATM worked and was able to get an sam - if it worked, it was an expensive hotel. it is worth it for the restaurant and its central position.

the hotel is very small and with no street frontage to speak of, taxi drivers may not know where it is. rooms are well appointed and confortable, although a bit on the small side. the AC can be aggressive and in our room we were forced to turn it off during the night so as to avoid being too cold. internet worked fine and was reasonably fast.

the hotel was modern and very clean and it was a good escape from the hot temps outside. staff was friendly and helpful and we met the owner one night who was also very pleasant and accommodating. breakfast is included and there were both western (eggs, pancakes) options and Indian options. there isn't much to see in Connaught Place, but many restaurants in walking distance.

the receptionist made it come in less than 5 minutes 8after I've waited half an hour in vain. the staff was very friendly and tried to help in every way - from access to internet, to phoning at the agency where I booked an ac-cab for sight seeing tour that didn't show up.
stayed in india three weeks visiting Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, west Bengal and Mumbay. the staff of the hotel is extremely friendly and efficient, making you feel at home (if not even better!).

the car and driver was over priced and had barely working A/C. the staff at the hotel also told us differing info on how much things were going to cost and Monday through Friday the electricity goes on and off every so often.
we stayed two nights at Hotel Palace Height. the hotel is expensive for the size of the room & bathroom we had.

the hotel is small, but very well kept, and clean. the wireless internet used to be problem. but they have fixed it. The food in Zaffran is excellent... the breakfast is to order... and always prepared well. They cater to a lot of foreign tourists.

we landed in Delhi and stayed the night before leaving elsewhere. our first night was awesome. the room was small, but adequate. it was nicely decorated and clean. no complaints. when we returned, the staff apologized,but that was about it. It was hard to believe this was the same hotel.It wasn't cheap either. we paid $183.00 Cdn through Expedia, not good value for the money.

the service here was excellent, particularly in the restaurant. the rooms are very modern and the bathroom had a good shower. breakfast is included with the rate and has good choice and decent buffet.
the hotel is better than an 'average 3*' rating but not good enough. the service was good and the rooms are clean, if a little on the small side.

the hotel was the cheapest (£98 per room per night inc breakfast), the nicest and the best placed hotel of the lot! the staff were great and very helpful. the room was lovely, clean and well equipped.

palace Heights is located on the inner circle of connaught place. it is a small property with 15-18 rooms only and is situated in the second floor of the city centre. the staff at the entrance are friendly and ever welcoming.
the room we stayed in was clean and with all the amenities you would expect. the location is great for getting a feel for Dehli although I would warn you not to stray too far off the beaten track.

the well located Hotel Palace Heights is a Delhi oasis. The rooms are exceptionally clean and well thought out, and they are well deocrated and all the things that you would expect from an excellent hotel have been considered such as good room service and wireless and various complimentary touches. the staff are exceptional and the service was excellent and attentive in all respects.
the hotel is small but great, in a very central location in Delhi. the restaurant was also great - I highly recommend it.

the hotel staff are very helpful and their english is excellent. we had arrived in india with only 3 of our 21 nights with a hotel booking, and the reception staff recommended an agent - Perfect Holidays, he organised the next 8 nights for us including internal flights, accommodation and driver. the room was very clean as was the bathroom with all the usual trimmings.

this is definitely one hotel I would recommend people stay at, everytime you visit delhi. they have an excellent restaurant attached, and althou living in the UAE gives you access to great indian food - it is truly authentic. the staff, right from their manager to the various service attendants are so polite, its ridiculous.

airconditioning functioned well, safe, upon arrival complementary fruit basket (1 apple, 1 orange, 2 bananas and 2 chocolate biscuits) the food was absolutely delicious, delicately spiced, and not too hot.

the hotel is on the first floor (there is a lift) which means the rooms are quiet, and its location on Connaught Square is excellent. from the doorman downstairs who loaded our luggage into the lift and whisked us up to reception, to the smiling receptionist and waiters in the restaurant - nothing was too much trouble. every member of staff was eager to please. I can highly recommend the Palace Heights as great value for money.

the hotel is an example of successful adaptive re-used building. the location is just perfect, in the center of CP and just a minute walk to fabIndia.I loved the room - minimalist, simple and very clean. from receptionist to restaurant, from housekeeper to general manager! they are doing their best to help me and make sure my stay is incredible.
the hotel is located in a good part of New Delhi. hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly, rooms are very clean and modern. the restaurant is excellent.

the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, with good recommendations for restaurants in the area. the included fruits, water and breakfast help you get your day off to a good start easily with no hassle.

the hotel was a real haven away from the bustle of Connaught Place and the food in the Zaffran restaurant was really good and service was also excellent. my husband and I stayed at the Palace Heights at our start of our Indian holiday in November. we had arranged an airport pick up with them which sadly wasn't there when we landed. on arrival they got us an welcome drink and told us our room would be ready in 20 minutes.

hotel has been renovated recently and now offers business-style, clean and tidy rooms with spacious beds and a fine bathroom. from the hotel, you have easy access to various shops (incl. Western shops with sometimes attractive proces) at Connaught Place, restuarants included.
stayed at the hotel for a business trip, the rooms were lovely and the staff extremely helpful. will definitely be staying there for my next trip to Delhi! Highly recommended.
we stayed here for two nights after arriving in Delhi from the us. we went ahead and arranged for transport to the hotel (RS. 800) to avoid having to deal with prepaid taxis upon arrival.

the hotel was very clean and done in a very fashionable style, but most importantly comfortable to stay in. the in-house restaurant was an absolute treat. in india, many places advertise about their wireless but it really is pathetic.

the hotel is located in the heart of the city (Connaught Place), it is definately cheaper than other hotels around the area when we were looking. the room we had was clean, well equipped, comfortable, and close to most everything.

the Palace Heights is probably one of the best hotels in Delhi in the moderate price range. the hotel is the most expensive and the price is compared to the cheapest hotel in india. it is close to a hill hill in sadir..

good points:- No noise from street- Central location- Cheap / good value- Good facilities in room (plasma TV, large bathroom, minibar)- EXCELLENT restaurant with 24 hour room service. staff who rectified issues immediately - reception didn't apologise but immediately sent cleaner, Expensive mini bar – but what do you expect!

breakfast was brilliant as they had continental as well as Indian Poori Bhaji which was delicious! as my wife was indisposed for 3 days they made hot chapatis to take into the room and my son enjoyed his cereals.

this small hotel in the centre of new Delhi, is close to everything but may be the best choice for an affordable yet clean and beautiful stay. it was recently renovated and although the rooms are small, it has aircondition (but no heating.. even though the temperature on January is quite low.)

Exceptional service and friendly staff had us staying at this quiet hotel twice this summer. the hotel's Saffron Restaurant is also a treat.Staying there was truly heaven. Our thanks to the wonderful staff who made our stay in Delhi memorable.

the hotel restaurant is worth a visit. the staff is extraordinarily friendly, and the rooms are clean with comfortable beds and have good modern amenities (plasma TV every room with international news channels for those of us who still like to stay in touch).
the room itself is has a flat screen TV, snacks of fruit and bottled water at no extra charge. the linens were very nice and very clean. The pillows were lovely.
the hotel is a contemporary one with all the style, elegance & modern amenities. the food in the restaurant- Zaffran was really blessings to the tastebuds.

the hotel claim to have 40 rooms, actually they only have 15. and the lies continue. if you have a good internet subscription for your phone, it will also work within their hotel. the room is so small, you feel clostrophobic. And the aircondition only has icy cold or really hot.

the hotel is located on the second floor of a period building overlooking Connaught Place. the room is clean, functional and'modern', with mock wooden floors and minimalist furniture, decorations and bathroom. Linen was spotless and towels plentiful, and chocolate biscuits for an evening snack along with complimentary bottled water. we stayed there in transit (arrived midnight, departed 0700 the next morning) and it was fine, as it would be if you were on business and in meetings all day.

we stayed 4 nights in this nice hotel very welll located, clean, staff is very nice and helpfull at the reception and in the hotel restaurant The Saffran. the beds are very confortable and give you every day 2 bottles of water and fruits and on arrival they serve you juice.
just great location in Connaught Place. great rooms, nice furnished and modern decoration, flat screen tv and nice bathrooms. i'll be back.

I went to india on April the 3rd and stayed at Palace Heights in the last night in India on the 10th. the hotel is a very nice hotel, good rooms, not very large but OK, with LCD TV and they offer each day mineral water and fruit basket. The bathroom was very good too, and the staff very friendly.
the restaraunt, Zaffron, is the best thing about this hotel. the menu is great and the prices are about $15 per meal.
this is considered to be the finest location in New Delhi.Rooms, Staff, Service, Reception: ExcellentBreakfast: Complimentry and excellent choice of menu.Very good decor and so peaceful.

excellent management & staff:- this place has an unassuming front and is fairly new. small with 14 rooms, but excellently managed. well staffed and no pressure to tip whatsoever. asked for hair dryer, iron, extra towels etc. and all supplied within minutes. Hence found rooms not made on return in evening.

the manager confirmed via email that we would have the room for six nights before we paid our deposit. on arrival they told us we will only have it for three nights. a different people manning the hotel reception gave conflicting reasons why this is so. however their reasons were not convincing as from the booking screen on their computer we noticed that two other guest were booked into our reservation. they tried to move us to another related hotel out of the city center which we refuse to due to their prior breech of trust.

the hotel claims someone was there, and we just didn't see him. the taxi driver tells them that it's behind the Odeon Cinema (there is more than one cinema in Connaught, though) the room is very small and unassuming, somewhat difficult to spot from the street, despite being well-lit and staffed by a security guard and two other employees - e.g., bellman and restaurant maitre 'd, I think).
stayed 1 night, extremely helpful staff, clean modern room, good restaurant, a sanctuary in the middle of delhi, very near excellent metro system stationi have only positives to say about this hotel.

this hotel is lovely. its clean tidy and very well positioned. it bangs in the heart of everything. I would rate it as 4 star!!!The staff are friendly and alway willing to help you.there is also a lovey restaurante.

this is a really good hotel to arrive to in delhiIts. the staff were very nice even though there were too many knocks on the door for one thing or another. it was clean and comfortable but the towels were old and grey!

the hotel Palace Heights is certaintly excellent value for a stay in central Delhi. the rooms *are* small so I would not book for an extended stay - but they are as modern and stylish as you will find anywhere, for any weekend or overnight you couldn't ask for more. I booked direct via email and although I had change my original booking to 1 night (from 2) in email this was not acknowledged so ensure you are clear from the outset.

the Palace Heights looked ok and the photos on the hotel website were good. it said that it had recently been re-furbished. the refurbishment is in preparation for the 2010 Commonwealth Games. took the plunge and booked. my husband and I were travelling with another couple and none of us were strangers to India.

hotel Palace Heights in new Delhi has been renovated relatively recently. we stayed there on two seperate occasions during our trip to india - and were pleased with both experiences! the rooms are very modern and sleek, and most importantly, clean and comfortable. it seems in Delhi that there are few options in the mid-range budget, or ridiculously cheap and disgusting.

we stayed here for 1 night on the 13th December after 2 nights at the Hotel Ajanta. this hotel worked out at approx £80 bed & breakfast for the two of us.Room was small but had everything you needed, reminded me of a Marriott hotel back home.

our double room cost 5500Rs + 12.5% tax including breakfast. the room was excellent - comfortable, extremely clean, a nice ambience! service at the hotel was reasonable without being fabulous. reliable hot water but in our room it was very difficult to find comfortable temperature (ie. temp was either very hot or cold).

the staff were lovely and the level of service was amazing. the room was small but very nicely furnished although there were no views. we ate lightly in their restaurant on our last night in india the food was good and I felt that the Hotel Palace Heights is aspiring to great things.

this is a very small and charming hotel situated very centrally in the buzz of Connaught Place, about 45 mins drive from the airport. the staff were very friendly, courteous and attentive throughout my 2 night stay.
Palace heights is an excellent hotel at a great location close to the metro from where you can explore the whole city. rooms are clean and everything works. very nice and helpful staff.

this hotel is located in CP in Delhi. Simply VOW... I think its a boutique hotel.Its truely amazing. Room rent was around Rs 4500/= for single room and experience was fantastic.Room was very small but stylishly done.

stayed here with friends as a hub in and out of New Delhi. the hotel arranged car service to/from the int'l airport and the Taj Mahal the next morning. they took care of everything and were happy to assist.

the frinedly and pleasant staff fulfilled all our requests, and they arranged drivers, guides and guides who took us to the Taj M. the wokers at the hotel even gave us early morning warm Nescafe mocha drinks.

my boyfriend, two friends, and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. prior to our trip I was emailing with a number of hotels in this neighborhood near the train station. Vishal from the Pearl Plaza was by far the most responsive.
we stayed at this hotel a few times. the linens are not spotless, definitely had not been changed but this is normal for Indian hotels/hostals (unless you go to upscale places)

email communication with the hotel was very fast (we made a reservation in advance) - very good price for double AC room (no breakfast, but breakfast could be booked extra for 80 Rs. p.P.) the airport is quite far away from the city (ca 30min drive)

the staff were rude and pushy, barging into our rooms at odd times of the day and evening. we had to wait for about an hour at the front desk whilst they checked various booking details - they seemed determined to find a reason not to let us stay. the rooms were dirty, pokey and noisy.
this place is ok but don't expect it to be perfect. Location is good. it's quite close to the metro and is very close by a nice shopping street.
we were there as part of a Gecko's tour. the room was dirty, the bathtub was stained and they use moth balls in the sinks which end up smelling up the entire room.

stayed at the hotel twice during my first trip to india and found it to be good. the location is good, close to shopping and the metro station and restaurants are not far away if you ask hotel staff. as for the rooms, they were clean and comfortable. yes, there is a wet bathroom - which is common in any part of Asia.

the hotel was booked by a travel agent and for the price they charged, I expected much better. the floor was dirty, bathrooms were wet..i was disgusted. Dont know about food and restarant quality as I decided not to eat there after I saw the rooms. also the area is very noisy and crowded.
the exterior doesn't bode well and it is definitely budget but we found the staff delightful and helpful. Room was OK, not dirty. it had TV, fridge and large bathroom.
staff is not so friendly, but supportive. Room boys don't speak English, we had a bad time with them due to lack of communication.

the worst hotel I've ever seen is india a lot and for half of the money they charge, you can get much better. don't go to this hotel people they will try to rip you off after you’ve seen how dirty and cheap the rooms are.they have one suite and they put these photos on the net.Absolute misguidance.when I stayed there I called my travel agent immediatly to find me another hotel.

the hotel only seems to get Australian, American and British guests. the area was absoloutely awful. we couldn't even find somewhere to buy a bottle of water. We felt very scared, always being followed, and were not happy here at all.
it was perfect. nice room, cheap price, and especially the staffs. we will definitely stay in this Hotel Prince International again again.

no prob got a taxi to the hotel which was all dark with people sleeping in reception area on arrival and one snoring very loudly in the back room. our bed was damp which in Feb is not great as it is cold so went down to reception and still staff all asleep so we picked our way over them and outside where it's dead no rickshaws anywhere. nobody moves around here until 10am. after half hour of wasting our time he arrived and convinced us we would be better booking our tickets with him
nice staff, and good internet connection. Would stay here again. would stay there again if you're looking for a new hotel.
the hotel is very close to the Karol Bagh Market, but it was quiet and quiet. the staff's attitudes immediately put me at ease as soon as I stepped inside the lobby.

stayed at the hotel on two ends of a trip to Nepal and India in august to early September. the staff was most accomodating and helpful and the breakfast was very good, but some were in no way pushy about it. I found the room clean and comfortable and felt very safe there.

I visited their hotel and chose super deluxe, I went to shop in Paharganj. when i back and saw that my expensive camera was lost, the manager called the police but they denied to Call and miss behaved with me that he was putting false allegation. I lost the trust completely.

the hotel itself is fairly grotty and basic. it's difficult to find decent budget accommodation in Delhi but I really recommend paying just a bit more and you'll find the quality greatly improves. we chose it for the location near the station and the advertised pool. both of which turned out to be extremely dirty and horrible. Didn't feel at all safe.
the rooftop restaurant was surprisingly good, and a quiet retreat. the hotel arranged pick up from the airport for us at 3am which was an relief.
the hotel is central and the staff are helpful. we used the onsite travel service to organise a car and driver for an weeks trip to Agra and Jaipur - very good service and excellent drvier.

we chose hotel Prince Polonia for its close proximity to the new Delhi train station, its affordable rates and the good reviews it got from Lonely Planet authors and other travellers. the reviews were the decisive factor because the other hotels we were considering had multiple comments about travellers getting ripped off while checking out.

the first time we stayed there around 18 months ago we had a good stay. the rooms were clean, the location central and the food palatable. if you're going to stay here make sure you spend more and get better room. Ignore the miserable manager who'll do his best to spoil your stay and instead talk to the nice older man (his father and owner?)

the staff was helpful, they let us check in early since the room was ready. it was a little pricy compared to the rest of the hotels in the area, but the hotel was clean and clean - and on the quiet street.

the first night on April 27, 2008 I arrived and they did not have the room I requested, even though I booked it a week in advance. they tried to charge me the more expensive rate, but this was ok. the main problem came on my second night, June 1, 2008. this time it was me, my wife and three kids and my sister in law.

the rooftop restaurant is lovely, breakfast is included in the price and there is a choice of indian or continental. the hotel is located near the main bazaar and the train station, you can get rickshaw to connaught place - beware though they will take you to emporiums unless you give them an exact location.

the staff were mostly helpful, except for one missing wake-up call. could help book train ticket, which is much appreciated since it managed to get me one from Agra back to Delhi even the booking site I checked said it's full.

there are much cheaper plays to stay in Parharganj - but you'd have to be on a very tight budget or desperate to want to keep in some of them. my wife and I stayed here in December 2007 and paid 1390rps (about 35 USD) for an AC room with shower room and balcony overlooking street. breakfast included.
this hotel was just fine, no problems, room was clean& bright, staff were courteous. it's a good idea to have somewhere like this booked before arriving in delhii, u.s.

the hotel has a roof-top restaurant staffed by ethnic Nepalese who answer to the cool reception dude with the moustache & gold jewelry. you know they are paid in crumbs so tip well as are cheerful and friendly, unlike the reception staff who are friends with mosquitos there.
i loved this hotel. it was perfect. nice room, cheap price, and especially the staffs. they were all very nice and very helpful. the hotel is just the best hotel for the backpackers and for everyone.
we only saw one room in this hotel since it was the last one available. the bathroom was dirty which prompted us to move down the road to Hotel Vivek (check the review!)

stayed at hotel rak international twice recently whilst in delhi and liked it very much. it's basic as are most budget hotels in the area but i love paharganj and its bussle, and my room was quiet and clean.

the front desk service was terrible and the hotel's proximity to the metro makes for easy travel around Delhi...and a lovely breakfast included in the price. the only good thing about this hotel is its proximity and its location is near the city centre, which makes it easy to get to Delhi. i would strongly recommend anyone not to stay here.
a homely & clean environment with prompt service was great. staff was kind and helpful; the area is quite centrally located with easy transportations.
our stay was fine there. Their tour assistance was good. we appreciate these guidance given for our trip. our tour guide was helpful and helpful.
the Boss has travelledto 30 countries so far. Everybody was great. the hotel was a great place to stay. we stayed in two hotels in Delhi before picking up this hotel.
Raunak Hotel is definitely one of the best hotels we have stayed at in new delhi, india. the rooms are simple but large and clean and the travel desk within the hotel is great. location is OK.

the hotel is good positioned, the staff is very friendly. housekeeping, manager is really helpful; all staff members are really nice and helping. even there travel desk was very helpful for, they organized our trips. a trip was organized and organized by our travels. our trip organized. the trip arranged by the travel staff..

I stayed at the Raunak hotel in new delhi. the rooms are modern and sleek. The flat screen TV is great although they could have invested in some satellite TV to give us more channels. I mentioned this and they gave me extra with no charge.

we are an old age couple and our third time to india. hotel is good. Wi-fi, lobby and restaurant are few of the good things in the hotel. a construction site nearby was the only turn down. Orver all fine.

we were told we had to stay at a different hotel which actually was better, bigger room. the restaurant in the Raunak was fairly but at the other two hotels owned by the same man the food was dreadful.I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Best point is the location and informative staff. the hotel is worth staying. stay at best point - the best place to stay. if you don’t want to spend more and want value for your money this hotel has the perfect hotel for you..

we booked the hotel dirctlily via email. they did not charge any money for advance booking, as decided and promised we were picked up from the airpot, the reception boy welcomes us with a smile. the bed is really comfortable, matress are so soft and good. breakfast were served nicely ( I liked parta).

we booked from malasiya directly with the hotel on our friend’s recommendation. they sent a good taxi for pick up and same nice taxi to show us Agra and Jaipore. Rooms are clean, laundry is sparking white. staff is polite and helpful. we had an comfortable trip in india becouse of them.

we booked five rooms in hotel Raunak International in delhi. when they came to know marriage anniversary, they organized our party for us and presented us with a beautiful chocolate cake. we were feeling great.
despite being in a shopping, restaurant and pub area our room was cozy and quiet. the staff was very attentive and pleasant, always quick to open the door and greet our arrival and departure.
our pickup, check in and checkout was swift every body knows what they have to do. I liked this kindness and dedication towards making improvements. You will be taken care.

wewere females between 20-25 years of age and were so safe in thishotel. large rooms, free internet on my laptop, flat screen TV's in lobby andin room, DVD was provided to us free of cost. a good holiday was planned to Agra & Jaipur by the manager and he gave us his own car.

the raunak hotel is very good location close to karol bagh metro station. staff was always very friendly & helpful and the rooms were clean, good and a nice restaurant provides the best curry. we loved this hotel.
stayed with my family for 3 day. clean rooms, good food, nicebreakfast, friendly staff, location was also good car recommend tofriends coming Delhi.

i went to Delhi for my business trip and happened to stay in hotelRaunak international. I found the hotel at par with the star hotels in the city. nice ambiance, good interior, soothing music, latestfacilities, friendly and courteous staff - putting all these togethermade my stay very comfortable.
a bunch of flowers was sent to our room. next day the hotel organized trip to Taj Mahal, symbol oflove. we were touched by the gesture.

the entire check-in process took over 40 minutes. the reception staff was constantly interrupted, anwering the telephone, calling out to other staff etc and we were completely sidelined. this is incorrect it is 10 minutes.

Nice feature elegantly appointed room sand suites in a variety of decor with quality amenities. the spacious accommodations, exceptional service, and the outstanding Good place in hotel make this hotel an unparallel Royal Experience!

counter staff is efficient, centrally located, near other parts ofimportant in Delhi for a travelles on holiday. if thiskind of satellite room is in other part of the worth and, I am save the rentwould be higher.
I stayed for 3 days and found it worth recommending. a comfortable room, clean laundry, staff is lovely, helps you for your every query. intelligent management, things run perfectly.

we were doubting on the service because the rates are very less. but when we got world class service and beautiful rooms, we are surprised. everything we could think of was available and very well placed. we will come again and please give us room no. 403 because we have sweet memories in that room. good wishes and try to please all foreigners like this.
stayed with a shoestring group. good room, great service and helpful staff. nice breakfast and dinner happy and will come again.

i went to delhi in mid september with our dancing troop to participate in our inter university feast. we stayed there at hotel raunak arranged by the organisers only.the hotel was really fantastic and we all had a great time staying there.everything related to it was great.staffs were so cordial and provided brilliant service.
friends, Hotel Raunak provides service in true sence. i wish all the very best 4 the hotel managment...keep up the good work..
we stayed in this hotel for 3 days. we enjoyed very much. the staff is friendly and very helpful. hotel is very clean and tidy. i liked the food.home service was Excellent.

the staff at Raunak are always warm an welcoming when I go there to stay. the rooms are all newly done up and are clean and tidy with wifi access for internet and a 24 hour restaurant. this hotel is best value for money.

hotel is centrally located so makes it easier to move around the delhi city. we really enjoyed our stay in the hotel, the staff was very helpful and provided good service. the rooms are clean and very good. i would recommend this hotel.

i was confirem at Raunak Plaza but upon arrival ended up staying at this hotel owned by same owner. this is form on Con by booking traveller in to higher rated hotel then making them stay at lower rate hotel. management should be ashamed of themselves.
the hotel is very good location and very clean. the service, foods and the rooms are of excellent quality. I enjoy delhi sightseeing with my wife.
the raunak hotel is conveniently located on karol bagh near new Delhi railway station. the staff is prompt and efficient and the rooms are comfortable and well maintained.

the hotel was ok, although no hot water and shower glass panel sitting in the bath wasn't ideal. the manager was really helpful when we arrived and arranged train tickets for us for the very next day (the train station was closed) room service kept knocking on our door as he kept trying to insist that we had to pay for our breakfast, even though it was complimentary. it appeared that none of the staff actually communicated with one another at all.
the staff were very helpful.this hotel is ok, Room was clean, spacious and with all basic amenities. very good value for money.
i recomeded to my friend for nice experience in this hotel. the hotel arrange Tajmahal tour and delhi sightseeing also very good.

my opinion is when I came to delhi I stay in Raunak hotel again. I would like good behavior and good service of the hotel staffs, food are very nice. Guard properly takes care of my car whole day. so I am very happy.

we have got excellent service in low cost.all are enjoy the moment in a great joy. so at the end we must visit this place again when we got leisure time so thanks to all the staff and owner of this hotel for their service.

this budget hotel is located close to the karol bagh metro station. staff was friendly and well trained. room was well maintained and finely clean, and have all the modern amenities. food was very tasty. location was convenient and convenient. a close location to shopping market and st luddington is the best hotel in the city..

hotel raunak international Delhi is located in the midst of the big market and shopping place at Karol Bagh in delhi. the hotel is very nice and clean with very good decorations and all comforts like LCD TV and 24 hours room service.

I was there with my family and one more couple. the place is calm and most of the rooms have beautiful view. 5 reasons you should stay here: 1) Reasonable priced.2) Clean, value-for-money rooms3) Rooms are cleaned daily4) Nice and friendly staff5) Independent balcony with "a view'.6) Located in peaceful surroundings.7) The famous Birla temple is just 15 minutes walk away.8) They are nice people and make you feel “special”
the room was not cleaned and was dirty.the bathroom sink was broken and leaking. we had to check out at 6.30 in the morning.
I go to delhi with my life partner, we stay in raunak hotel. we were happy with hotels service and cleanness....................
location was good and peaceful in the crowded city delhi, close to shopping area karol bagh. rooms were modern and clean. staff were coperative freindly.
we all planned to stay in Raunak Hotel, Karol Bagh. the stay was very good. all staff was great. they are very helpful. The market was nearby.

it was so great experience with Raunak Hotel, last month i stayed with my husband for three days. there were excellent services, staff welcome us with smile - there was no word to express my thanks to pushpa bhamu who tells me about major temple and historical place in delhi like red fort, qutab minar and akshardham what he has never seen, she arrange a car for us.
that a place to hangout with freinds... rooms are clean. location is good.... facilities were fantastice......
the staff were very cooperative and stood up with me 24 in to 7 whenever i want, food was too delecious. my friends were also shared the same experience - and he wishes them all the best.
the hotel is located in a very excellent position in the center of the india's capital. our room was good - clean and well decorated. the staff at the Home Stay were very attentive.
staff was very good specially front office staff staff. the hotel is bussiness hotel at low price and the services were very nice. staff were excellent staff and staff are very helpful staff.

nice hotel with comfortable rooms, taxi service also promt.kids enjoyed the stay with the lovely staff taking care of them. they organised a small party when they came to know about my birthday.definetly stay here again again.
hotel staff is always thr 4 u n ready to fulfil ur demands. room service was quite good... aahh!! Above all the food was very tasty..

hey it was great time staying at this hotel RAUNAK...the food is great..and the service is best...i could easily say that i gt the value for my money value! the hotel was a great place to stay at the raa hotel in luu s. he was the best stay stay in the city of ireland and the food was excellent.

excellent service by the manager and all the staff Hotel quiet, safe and near the metro stationPoints to be improved.* good infrastructure but rooms need not be refursbished sometimes* provide hot water after 10:00pm * provide taxi pick up without failure ( payed the service if not offered is not enough)

stayed with my husband and booked taj mahal tour with the hotel. they gave such less price and great service, good car, driver and good room in their agra hotel. staff was perfect and wanted nothing less than 100% customer satisfaction.my husband was happy about my selecting this hotel!
hotel Raunak is within easy metro/ricksahw ride of all the main attractions and has comfostable basic rooms and a nice food. the staff are lovely and are very eager to help with anything you need.
i stayed here for india art summit in pragati maidaan. hotel was easily approachable from the hotel via metro.wi-fi in room was a great relief.

this is one of the best five star hotel in india. it keeps on improving in everything and staffs are excellent in relating to customers, the food, i really fell in love with it not to talk about the environment, well cleaned and good location.
very good hotel, we enjoyed it very much. the service was top notch, the hotel was very comfortable and the place was nice - one of the best hotels we stayed during our travel around India.
nice hotel, good location, clean rooms and bathroom. pick up service is prompt.food taste is also good. good job, keep it up!

this hotel offers great travel packages for those who want to travel outside of Delhi to Agra or Jaipur at very good rates. the staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again for my next stay in Delhi.

the hotel has free Wi-Fi in every room and the speed was enough for surfing newspapers with my laptop. but for YouTube and Skype I had to move up to the also free business-centre on the top floor where the speeds was faster.this hotel is good value for the money.

the hotel staff is very friendly and the room service was very quick. my visits to jaipur and Agra were made easy and taken care by the tour services provided by a tour service - and it is close to the metro station.
the service of the staff is exceptional and they go out of their way to cater to your needs. you also get a bathtub and LCD TV at an affordable price.

hi, I am Kishan Singhania. I was looking for a hotel in Delhi. when i entered the hotel the lobby was very beautiful and the staff welcomed me warmly. the room service is very good and everything was just wonderful. it made me very relaxing. and advised all my friends that just go and enjoy.

hotel Rounak is the best areound all Indai which are having any kind facilities for day and night the waiters are in service for full timeTher rooms for rest are leisurement the yard of Rounianak hotel is interesting The value of stay there is cheapest then other hotelsshortly all facilities are avilable there there. the hotel has all the facilities in the i s - it is not the most expensive compared to the rest of the indii. if you stay stay
my room was very comfy. i like their matteress room service too good and quick. they provide good food at reasonable price. nonveg was osum. best part for this hotel is its location.

hotel staff had helped me very much to guide about delhii because i was totaaly straneg for thsi city.keep it up hotel mangaemnt and staff......and it has nice location..for shopping nd all.....i really like a lot.....it has clean envirement...nd nice friendly staff....nd it is nice place to live...i went here for the trree days.....I have stayed there for some time now...it

i m very glad to see this hotel in delhi, it brings full stop in search for celebrating the any occasion with friends, family etc,. this seems that dreams come true,,Vioma dream dream, is the perfect place for all - if you ever dream of a lifetime. it is perfect for every traveller and tourist, and it's the best place to celebrate the every occasion in the world.
Rounak is the best hotel in new delhi with best location and for best value. hotel staff is very good and very helpfull. food is tasty with real taste of india. this is smart choice for smart people.
my visit to Delhi was for a hiring event for my organisation and I was put to stay in this awesome place where very good people with very high values work. this was my very best hotel stay so far.

the receptionist asked us to pay RS 2000. we were taken aback as we stayed in the room for less than ten minutes.the security guard blocked my friend's car from moving.luckily,the staff at GINGER were so much better and kind.
the owner of the hotel is friendly and helpful.i loved my stay in india and specially in this hotel as it is very clean and serves good exotic indian food.
the rooms themselves were tidy and clean. staff was very helpful and friendly. we booked tour through them to agra and jaipur and it everything was arranged perfectly.

raunak hotel all employment were very intelligent and helpful.rooms were clean,they cleaned it every day,restaurant was good with indian spicy food, i could have many choices,the atmosphere there is relaxing and it was with good prices.

india is historical Place and good for enjoyment, sightseeing and shopping. after i found raunak international hotel my coming to india and my trip is more enjoyable and easy for me. followings are positive points of the hotel1: Save and secure location.

hotel stay in a seriously bad environment with construction, dusty and noise pollution. when i arrive the hotel, they got only 2 guests in the room and they never clean it. the bedsheet got stain on it and it's really dirty. teh floor never wipe with water - the whole curtain fell down! they charge me 1 night for RS 1,800 even if he didn't stay, it was nightmare and disgusting. you will never ever see anything worst than this before!

the staff lied about our train tickets being confirmed then finally said there was no reservation possible so they could force us into renting their car tour to Agra. the price for local sightseeing is also apparently dependent on how much they think they can get out of you.
I had a great time staying at this hotel. Started my travels through india with ease and I would definitely recommend it to my friends!
the staff was friendly and extremely helpful and accommodating. staff really extended themselves to make sure I had everything I needed. Comfortable clean beds too!
we stayed in this hotel for 3 days. we enjoyed very much. the staff is friendly and very helpful. a very good place to stay. A home, away from home.
the best hotel in Delhi!! very clean, hot water, TV in English. the food and the service was very good! i recomended Raunak International if yoyu need excelent hote and good price!

the hotel is located in Karol Bagh close to the metro station (Rs.8 to Counaught Place), Rs.16 to Central Secretariat. it is clean with friendly staff and an owner (Mr Singh) that really takes care of a personal interest in the needs of his guests.

hotel manager offered us a new room at the raunak international hotel 2 streets further. the room was very nice, not small and clean, especially the managers assistant helped us with booking travelling plans, shopping and other useful hints.
the owner is very friendly and hospitable. we were pleseantly surprised when he offered us showers. the hotel has got the internet hot spot!

we stayed in this hotel for two days and this place is werth for the amount u paid. clean place, with all 3 star aminities, and the food they served also good. the staff is friendly. nice place to stay, if we are going to delhi again we will definitely stay here. GOOD PLACE.
the staff spoke very bad English and had great difficulty understanding me. when they called them they claimed "the car broke down on the way'
friends made reservations. would have checked with them on what hotel they made reservation for. in the future in India - will insist on 4 star hotels. have stayed in 3 stars in Europe and in Russia.

arrived at hotel late pm after 6 hour drive from Agra. room average, air-con and TV worked but strong air freshener smell which turned out to be the insect repellent device in the bathroom too. we went to the restaurant and looked at the a la carte menu but the maitre d' was very persistent that we and all other guests had the Indian buffet already prepared.
silver is smaller but much better than silver. service and food was good but location very good - service was excellent but not much. make sure you see all types of rooms.

my frnds booked this place for me as i hv been living in Petersburg since last 5 yrs. the breakfast buffet was grand and offered me many options. overall a nice place.the market around is pretty good, the staff bell boy and rest too were ever smiling... keep it up people...nice and quiet place in the lively market...

most of our guests arrived from punjab and canada, so we all booked this hotel for 2 nights and their banquet for the functn. they made excellent arrangements for everything at the function and even changed the colour theme of the decoration a night before to match my dress and expected the staff to show reluctance, but they all took it very sportingly.
i visited delhi in march 2009 n stayed in hotel regent continental for 4 days before going ahead to jaipur. it was a good experience for the first timmer to india,the people are also very nice.

we reached quite late night in Delhi. it was our first visit and we were in quite tension. booked this hotel through internet. i would like to share the experience of my delhi stay which part of jaipur trip.

i visited this hotel in march 2009 as some of my colleagues were comming in from the us. a friend of mine recomemded me this karol bagh hotel called regent continental. on my instructions the hotel made arrangements to pick my guests from airport.

stayed here on our tour of northen india, by far the worst hotel. rooms were very small and dated. service and food were poor and breakfast was worrying as food was kept,well, warm. overall we were disappionted with both rooms and location.

staff shouting and talking loudly and dogs barking incessantly outside. rooms disgusting, dirty tables and dirty cutlery - but receptionists refused to give back passports until we paid what we wanted.would never ever go back there!!!
this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. the hotel is situated in a rundown, dirty and overcrowded area in what can only be described as virtually an alley way.
the hotel is well maintained with clean hygenic rooms. Located in the centre of Karol Bagh close to the Delhi metro station which makes moving about easier and fast.

the hotel is located in a very narrow street in Karol Bagh area of Delhi. it gives likes of yWCAs and YMCA International House in Delhi run for its money as it can be cheaper and room quality and service is much better!

our room was on the 1st floor. very bad,smelling room.After complaining we were upgraded to the 2nd floor. we stayed there for 4 nights.Breakfast is not very nice.Staff dont speak English but helpful.Dont eat dinner in hotel.Will not go back.

the hotel is quite noisy because of marble flooring in corridoors and distant phone ringing every night. the roaches were not disturbing and only a few were seen in every room. there is gap under the room door so every sound can be heard inside the rooms. other guests vere talking loudly when returning in the middle of the night.
checkin had to wait for 45 minutes just to complete Formalities. no room allotment planning despite 3 rooms were booked.
stayed at the Regent Contenental for 4 nights in January 2008. the hotel is definately the worst hotel in the world - the white house or Wongdhen House in Tibetan Village.

the photos you see published in no way represent the squalor immiediately outside the front door or the mouldly noisy rooms you find inside. staff either choose to speak no english or are just quite surly when you ask a question they will lie to your face trying to get you in their cafe, shop, whatever.

my new agent tried to book this place again for me telling me that my other choice was a far inferior choice. the agent's office is within blocks of both. I stayed at the Clark. it was great and cheaper. next time I will try to find another place, but certainly not the Regent Continental.

the hotel was horrendously noisy well past midnight till 1 am or later. from our room, we could hear the loud slamming of doors, the clatter of kitchenware being cleaned, hotel staff talking loudly, furniture being dragged across the marble floor. this made it quite impossible to sleep. we also encountered problems with the shower, whereby we couldn't coax out a trickle of hot water.

the website claims they have 24hr internet, a money safe, tea and coffee maker, business conference centre?. the staff are basically 14-16 year old boys who go around in groups of 2-4 who stand around waiting for tips.
visitors may advise visitors to take 'their" taxi service' the Taxi Service is run by a separate unit (In the lobby) and the hotel staff do not coordinate with this unit in satisfactory manner.
the stafF were very helpful and friendly with great service. the rooms are spacious with airt con-but this is very noisey. in a decent location, very bustling! would not go again.

check in staff were rude and the reception area was worse than my dog kennel. the coridoors were dark and dingy. it was truely appaling. sleep in a cardboard box on the street instead of staying here, it will be cleaner!!!!!

this hotel is overbooking people and then transfering them to smaller, 0 star hotels in the vicinity (they have special arrangements with them) if you'd like to have a chat with me about the experience, please drop me an email at travel@astralize.com.

we were two young women traveling together, if we needed to be walked anywhere he would send a chaperon with us, drivers were always good, cars mostly clean. the hotel was good value at about £20 per room. Would deffinately go back, felt very safe.

my wife and I stayed here last month for 4 nights. the rooms are not great, the bathrooms are awful, but we spent minimal time in our room and only slept in the room to sleep. there are much better options in New Delhi, however, they are way more expensive - they definately is not a 3 star hotel if you stay there again!

we had booked the hotel on recommendation by a Delhi travel agent against our will. we stayed there twice in tiny rooms with small windows opening to the next wall. you can not leave them open, as around there all outlefts from AC in other rooms. one room was in the reach of strolling cats.

we stayed in this hotel twice during one trip to india and both rooms were very dark (no windows) and small. the bathrooms very very dirty. we also had to share the one room with numerous cockroaches. would not recommend the hotel to anyone.
stayed here for 5 nights in early september. the location is average, hidden down a back alley but not too far from the excellent metro system.

staff member tried to downgrade us from double regent suite to classic deluxe room. they showed us the classic room which had a cat living in it. we demanded the original room at the set price and they gave it to us without further quibble. room service was awful as they brought things we didn't order. the room itself was large and clean with hot water on tap and television with good reception.
staff at reception were poor - promises made to do things were not fulfilled. pressure was put on us to use expensive hotel taxis instead of reliable local transport.

the hotel staff went out of their way to be accommodating and all were so kind and friendly. there is a travel desk in the lobby and Mr. Ahmed will do everything from make your plane or train reservations to arrange tours or just get an car and driver to take you shopping. this was my first trip to Delhi but if I have an opportunity to return it will definitely be to the same place.

staff at the front desk fixed the room within an hour. the hotel's tarvel desk was fantastic and was made every day by the house keeping staffs. very friendly staff, who would always be there to attend to your needs. would love to stay there again.

transport to where ever organized efficiently and on time. if requiring any services please ask the staff as they can point you in any direction, whether it be leather, fabric or fabric they will help you.
I book this hotel through Expedia, my credit card was deducted yet no confirmation from Hotel. Wrote many email to expedia & hotel, no reply from anyone. any one can advice what to do next?
the rooms are clean and they offer a pick up service from the airport which helps to avoid any early stress.would reccomend to anybody who wants to know more about india.
non professional staff, dusts in the room, a filthy place to stay. i can’t recommend to anybody who can pay at least 25$ per night. book at your risk.
taking well care about guest coming, carrying luggage, not begging for tip,Breakfast could become better with some fruit as well. Mr.Chauhan at the frontdesk is ok helpfull, organizing whats needed.
hotel.com booked 1330rs a night, inclusive of tax. the basement restaurant served breakfast: boiled eggs, toast with butter and jam, cornflakes, tea and coffee. there was also chapati.
this hotel was a good fit for my son and I. we arrived at 2:30 am after being picked up at the airport. clean and large, quiet room.
