the hotel has excellent staff who takes good care of you and they make sure that you get everything on time. the karol bagh market is just 2 mins walk from hotel's hotel - just a few minutes away from the metro station and the restaurant is opposite to it. i stayed at hotel royal Holidays for three nights and found it very nice.

the staff was not professional and they even tried to cheat us many times. when they didn't get us as many tips as they wanted, they tried cancel our connection way to the Agra. it was scary and very unpleasant. so we left this place before our check-out date.

this hotel is good hotelbath,toilet,bed clean clean good sleeping very safety hotel staff very honest i recomend to all japanase tourist student or family visit here very cheap and cheap hotel my name is Kenichi Hisae. the hotel has a good price - it is the best hotel in the world. this is great hotel s l! u stayed in this room is very nice and clean and the staff are very helpful. it was the perfect place to stay
the company of the one that I mention is, ABYSS TOURS AND My representative is Mr ARIF. I can recommend this to everyone, because they are trust worthy and generous.

I stayed in this hotel in the month of June with my wife well i booked online and use there free pickup services. the hotel was very pleased for everythingi wouldl receomnd thsi hotel for any type of tourist tourist type.
I agree with bad responses. Besides deceive with payment. Have reserved and have paid for other hotel. do not contact?siativ.com and a travel agent who works with this hotel.

the hotel staff there was very kind - especially the front desk and housekeeping staff. we just asked for anything we needed, towels, extra pillows, toilet paper, and the prices were reasonable (600-700 rupees for 2).

we really enjoyed our stay here the welcome and airport pick up made a really smooth and pleasant transition when very jet lagged. room was clean and comfortable, the rooms was quiet,breakfast was delicious! arif was great helped us find our way round and deal with any difficulties.
expedia airport pick-up was included and the rooms should be two'super deluxe doubles' the hotel had been notifyed about flight number and arrival time.

a couple of weeks before I went to Delhi I read some negative reviews and was very concerned. when my family and I arrived there late in the night I was pleasantly surprised by the location and cleanliness of the hotel. the staff were very courteous and the room was clean and sufficiently equipeed.

the room was dark and gloomy as it had no windows and the wardrobe doors were jammed closed so we could not use it. the worst was when late night after being out for dinner and returning to go to bed we pulled back the bed covers to find there was no top sheet, we just had a thick blanket (which I really couldn't be sure is washed in between visitors) the most basic accommodation we stayed at had at least fresh sheets and towels, this place is massively overpriced and I would

hotel was clean enough but the room was very expensive for what it was. the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful on the whole, however ignore any help they offer in hiring a taxi/rickshaw as you'll find one much cheaper yourself by simply walking down the road.

rooms are ok but as with everything in Delhi well overpriced for what you get. breakfast is terrible but there is toast... Rooms are good with showers that produce a dribble... Biggest let down for us was the unhelpful nature of the staff... how do we get to Conaught Place... Dont worry ill get you scab... How much? About 100Rs... Only because we met some fellow travellers did they tell us about the metro 2 minutes away and only 8R to

we booked one night in this hotel, but when we arrived they said another guest had missed their flight, and they would have to put us up in another hotel. the area was fine, handy for anywhere you might want and near the metro if you don't want to risk your skin in an auto.
hotel Royal Holidays is a clean and very confortable hotel. rooms include tv and fridge which are handy. overall, we are very hapy with the hotel as the staff put our comfort first.

chaep accomodation with hostel standards is more like hostel than hotel. hotel is close to metro station and very nice market so keep their business card with you because taxi drivers don't know this place at all.

booked this hotel through expedia after reading favorable reviews here, had to stay a night in delhi on my way to nepal. called the hotel day before to confirm reservation, and gave them my flight information for free airport pickup which was promised. they said 'no problem we'll be there'

this hotel is a fake, we booked here because it was 7th on the ranking. the staff is completely useless, with no manners at all, and since you step into the hotel no matter about your long flight they start trying to con you with all sort of crap deals...the air con, when you look at it you turn it off as you think you are going to die if you breath that air coming through that dirt and mud equipment.

was in Delhi just a week ago. stayed at Royal Holidays Hotel in Karol Bagh, New Delhi - was recommended by tour company if i went back to Delhi again. was met with eager, smiling faces and immediate attention was given to all my requests.

hotel royal holidays is a good place to stay in delhi. but tour operator connecting with hotel trying to waste time of tourist by showing expensive tour plans. room is good but they have to clean room daily.

this is a decent hotel in the Karol Bagh area of Delhi. it is central to just about anything you'd want to do in Delhi, and the metro is also just two blocks away. the room itself was dirty by my standards so I didn't take my shoes off while in my room, but I got the impression that most hotels are probably like this. and for some reason they do not put top sheet on your bed - there was no way I was going to cover up with the gross bedspread next to my skin
we stayed in this hotel on our way out of Delhi. the hotel is located in a quiet section of the city and is worth $1-$2 auto rickshaw ride from everywhere.

the hotel reception was welcoming always during our stay. we went to a tourist Information office down the street which was recomended by hotel staff,they helped us organise our transportation and train tickets from place to place on basic prices.
if you like with window, better ask for it - but might be better without window. we booked via Expedia. there was a guy at the reception named Sajad who gave us free taxi ride to the airport. thanks!

this is my second time in India in last year I have booked hotel Suncity from Expedia. this time I went tripadviser website and have seen review of Hotel Royal Holidays first I was thinking this all review is fake but when I booked through expedia one night he promised me we will pickup us from the international airport on our arrival driver was waiting for us.

our boyfriend and I stayed at hotel royal Holidays a total of 4 nights (2 at the beginning of our trip and 2 near the end) the rooms are clean with huge beds, private bathroom with shower and television, including towels and sheets. they have internet available for guests in lobby (extra charge but very cheap)
we are two girls from sweden that has stayed in the royal holidays hotel in new delhi. the room is comfortable and the service is really nice. The reception has helped us with what we need.

very good hotel reasonable price good location safe for single women travellers have no problem to recomended Staff is very friendly also i use there free pickup services again no complainss. staff is friendly and friendly. a great hotel - excellent location close to all the sa..

we enjoyed the hotel and stayed for about 3 days in two separate stages. the staff and front counter staff were very helpful and were able to help with a range of requests. also this hotel proviode complimentray airport pickup.
Dear TrevelersMy stay was very comfort & peace even though located in the central market Karol Bagh. Room was excellent, clean and furnished, also enjoyed the restroom area with cosmetic mirror.

this hotel is always my choice when ever I have to stay very close to the airport. the rooms are so well managed and so good is the food there. if you are looking for a budget hotel, do visit this place. this is worth everything and you will also get good amount of corporate discounts.
the hotel is located in a very noisy area.- My room was very dirty (floor, walls, bathroom). the breakfast was based on British and Indian styles, but the worse of both.
I booked thru IRCTC website and got an allinclusive rate. nice clean rooms. tad expensive but it was a nice hotel! i booked through the site and get an cheapest rate.
hotel Shanti palace is the right choice for meeting close to airport. its has nice big rooms and tasty restaurent, Though its a bit expensive but its worth to sat there.

this hotel overlooks a busy flyover route into Delhi. the area around the hotel is particularly grotty and nondescript should you be thinking of taking an evening stroll. we would not recommend staying here for any other reason than to be close to the airport.

Shanti Palace is located less than 5 minutes from the airport with optional driver pick-up service for about 600 rupees one way (not including a tip) the room was completely granite including the floors, bathroom and counter tops.

we stayed in the Shanti Palace for 2 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. our room seems to have been recently renovated and was extremely clean and well appointed. the buffet was acceptable at $155 per night, we thought we received good value for our money.
staff do not understand English. staff don't know how to smile and welcome guests. hotel needs to have more site seeing leaflets on display.
we paid around 300 rupies for transport to airport. a room not facing the highway (noise) can be found in the hotel's deluxe suite.

the views out of the window may not be a worry for business travellers. I surly cannot agree with the comment regarding the rudeness of staff, who in my opinion were very courteous. i would have wished for few more choices in the breakfast menu.

to register for a room, you must sign an registration book that is straight out of the 18th century. first and foremost, the hotel is outdated. if your over 6.0feet/1.80m, then you're probably too big for the beds.
hotel seems to have been recently refurbished. rooms are small but clean. price on their website was Rs4600, we were charged Rs6600. Poor value for money. Reasonably close to airport..

the hotel is in the middle of nowhere, next to the airport (about 3-4 kms, 2-3 miles) the staff is extremely rude and over-price each andevery item they can - e.g., hotel-airport ride (they charged us8USD, the street price was about USD4)
we were three women that shared a good size room for three nights. the hotel was safe and very clean and it was not as expenssive as 3 or 4 star hotels that were poorly reviewed.
the staff was untrained and sounded a bit fishy. the rooms were small and bathroom even smaller. this place is only recommended for individual stay for 1-2 days in Delhi.

the hotel is located in a nearby side lane thats not too posh. the metro station is about 15 minute walk or rs 20 by auto. food : The room service did take sometime but the food was of good quality. there is NO complimentary breakfast in this hotel.

the hotel was our very first stop after flying in and probably the least welcoming hotel I've ever stayed in. the staff were rude and always yelled at each other, with the noise echoing right up the stairwell.

the hotel is on the top floor and shares a wall with the kitchen. it's marginally quieter on other floors, but the rooms are still dirty and uncomfortable. if you're going to stay in an expensive budget hotel, at least make it somewhere more conveniently located than this dump.

location of the hotel is pretty near the sky train station. the room is quite small. there is no chair inside the rooms. window does not open. air ventilation is bad. luckily the ceiling fan was working ok. we had to wait about 10 mins. to get the hot shower. at the time we stayed, there was no restaurant in the mangement. it is being renovated.
the hotel is a midrange hotel ( paid Rs. 2200) the room was clean and spacious enough to accomodate our family of two adults and one child on the bed.
the Singh Sahib hotel is right next door to the hotel Metro Heights. it's ten times better to stay here and not ruin my vacation at the metro Heights.
the air conditioning only worked in the rooms, and was incredibly noisy and smelly. cable TV, yummy room service, but the porters hang around until they get a tip!!

the room itself was fine, comfortable and spacious although dark. a notice on the door said hot water had to be requested in advance, but we ignored this and had no problems. the fruit juice tasted as if it was coloured water.

stayed here in Jan 2008 and was overall a pretty average experience.Room was reasonably clean with hot water in shower but it was freezing cold(about 2c)with no heating in the room at all.lolBreakfest is fairly average also.Overall not the best value for money.
hotel had been organised by tour company so we had no choice. rooms were dull and dark - as was most of the hotel. staff start working at approx 4am and continously shout up corridors at each other.
stayed for 7 days, very cold outside 10 degress and inside 18, could not pay with creditcards??? only cash, bad exchangeraterate! very noisy at the room from the other guest and staff.

this hotel was good - not amazing, not bad either. the rooms were clean, bathrooms adequate, breakfast edible and hotel staff were helpful. room service was fast and efficient. for a 3 star hotel in Delhi I feel it is good value for money.
the hotel is clean and quiet and the staff are professional. I stayed in another hotel in Karol Bagh and had a terrible experience so I would recommend Singh Sons.
Singh Sons is tucked down as side street in a quiter part of Karol Bagh. the lobby is airy, cool and clean, with lots of marble, and the staff welcoming.

the rooms themselves are fine by Indian standards - the hot water problems and electricity issues described by other travelers are typical for the country. the front desk staff, however, is rude at best, and the attitude of the staff is not fine at any standard.

the breakfast buffet-attempt stops are lousy. Toast and flakes, Indian ommelette and banana's. it has the speed of a snail at stiff rate, and as the printer is also used for copying, your PC will hang up half way your email.
the hotel is in the Karol Bagh suburb of new Delhi. there are quite a few mid-range tourist type hotels in this area, with Singh Sons being the smartest looking of the 5 or 6 I spotted.
the hotel was in general fairly dingy and uninspiring.At best adequate. Avoid if possible. the water pump for thehotel was directly outside are room and burst into life in the middle of the night.

the length of the beds is shorter than normal and if you are over 5ft 8 your feet will hang over the end. the hotel is unfriendly and slow to respond. hotel porters watch while you struggle with your bags and wait to be asked to help. we all received an unasked for early morning call for breakfast!

traveller reviews of this hotel praising its cleanliness etc are accurate however it is indeed absolutely spartan and if travelling in the late fall and winter the rooms can be cold. hot water is just warm and must be requested 10 minutes prior to use. Bedding is threadbare. Packing your own toilet paper is key as the hotel provides very little. Avoid rooms on the main street side as it's extremely noisy. Staff and restaurant food are OK.
the hotel was not 5* or even 4* in terms of presentation, amenities etc, but for being located in the peripheral of the city centre allows for good access to transport, eateries etc.

we booked the hotel through an agent for one room for 3 persons. the reception people are not trust-worthy, they cheat if you are unaware of what is happening. they claim four star facilties and rates are expensive for the facility they have. should be avioded.
the hotel is located in karol bagh, delhi. most accessible to market just opposite hotel. helpful staff & definitely a good experience.

the guys behind the counter told me that the 'credit card machine isn't working' after offering to get me a taxi to go to an ATM, I insisted on using my credit card, which of course, worked perfectly fine.

in india it's difficult to find a mid range hotel. the hotel is nice, en suite bathroom with hot water and western flushing toilet, A/C and clean rooms. there is internet in the lobby and the staff are helpful.

you shouldn't come to Delhi expecting a US experience, because it won’t happen. this must be considered when an rating is given, as it will not happen, and you should not want it to. 'this is India, it's an third-world-country,' says teen travel group.

we made an email booking for this hotel one month before our arrival in Delhi. we exchanged with Mr. Tajinder Singh at least 4 (four!) emails because we wanted to be sure the booking was ok and they had the availability of rooms. of course, when we arrived at the hotel, no book was made on hotel books and no room was available.

we arrived in the early hours of the morning and the pick up was excellent and welcome. the bathroom was big and there was a shower and western toilet but no bath. we stayed for 3 nights.Negatives: basic breakfast, our room was on the road so you could hear the noise, cold/warm showers.Location: nice restaurannt near by called alpha spice.

stayed there as part of an Intrepid "comfort' tour to Agra. the hotel was reasonably clean and quiet. It's located in the Channa market section of Karol Bagh, about 1/2 mile from the subway. Seemed safe to walk around.

Singh Sons is a nice new hotel with marble everywhere (including all the lobbies and the stairs) the rooms are small and basic but very clean, as are the bathrooms which have Western style toilet seats. the breakfast is quite nice - with pastries and eggs/omelettes in addition to tea/juices.

the tour group I took had our accomodations at hotel Singh Sons. everyone of us hated the hotel and disliked people there. I read the other review that said it was 10 months old - I'm shocked as it seemed much older. i had both the deluxe" sweet and a normal room.
hotel also arranges airport pickup around 300Rs.Good family run hotel. built 10 months ago...just be careful not to book any tours with tourist operators laundering around the hotel.

we booked this hotel at the last minute as our initial plans on lodging got messed up. the hotel is located in the commercial area and is fully surrounded by Shops and the Hotel staff was kind enough to accommodate all 4 of us in a Deluxe A/c Room for Rs. 3,500/- per night. we felt that this Hotel was value for money.

the rooms offered to us were also not of high standard. their travel desk, though manned by a couple of courteous staff, do have the odd disrespectable staff who managed to cause some aggravation. they need more training on customer service.

the pictures showed a different image than what i was faced with when booking the hotel room online. the room was shabby, with cracked walls and missing soft finish patches and the Bathroom was also stinking - definitely not worth Rs 1800 +!
review of hotel Southern from one of the review sites. the rooms were good and provided the complientary transfer from the airport.

i liked the hotel and highly recommed it to the fellow travrellers. yeh the tour department and the restaurants are a must try in case you are planning an weekend trip to Agra to see the great TAJ MAHALhern Travels. we highly recommend this place to our fellow travelers.
very close to airport, centre of city with lots of options for shopping. rooms and service is nice but only issue was that food was south indian so more preferred to them.
hotel Southern is a safe and secure place to stay. at least 50 to 70 guests of mine have stayed in this hotel from time to time throughout the year. they never had regrets.

we have reached this hotel on 12 Apr 09, they have arranged complimentray Pickup from airport. the location is very good, nearer to Karol Bagh Market, there is a biggest shopping mall in this area, Totally Its extremely good expirence in New delhi.
pakka friendly staffs from reception to bell boys. one can go even alone and stay even if ur a lady. very much safety in all aspects.

we were collected from the airport as agreed and taken to the railway station at 4.00am. they arranged a city tour, car and driver for 8 hrs Rs.750. all in all I think good value for money at £40.00 per night for double room. not the place to stay for more one or two nights.
offering the ultimate hospitality, courtsey, great food, homely atmosphere, comfort, elegant furnishings. my stay was really worth!!!

the hotel was centrally located and is ideal for tourists who proceed to pilgrimage circuits such as Char Dham etc. but please check out regarding the clause of free drop to Railway station as it is given in quotes.
the hotel is spread over two buildings. only the top two floors of the building had hotel rooms - the restaurant, reception etc was all in the main building.
if I am not given a better room at the same price then I would be going somewhere else where. after the first night service was much better and my family and i enjoyed our stay.

make sure you get booking confirmation via email, as you may have problems we had at check-in. have good travel agency next door so can book New Delhi tours or other trips around Delhi, and trains nationally.Rooms are good value, providing you book the super deluxe and above tariffs...

internet pictures are from another era so don't be fooled by those. once you get to your room, they are OK, but getting there is through a scary neighborhood - you leave the reception area to go down an unsecured alley. staff is not very helpful, particularly the middle aged guy at the front desk.

the hotel offers complimentary pick-up for their more expensive rooms. he called for the car after seeing us and it took about an hour and a half of waiting to get in the vehicle - significant problem when traveling with small children. overall, I would not recommend this for families with kids if you are coming from the U.S.

our room was shabby and cramped, nothing like the pictures on the website. the sheets didn't look clean and there was dirt in all of the corners. Random people were hanging around, walking up and down the hall all night and talking loudly. Worst was the foot-wide hole in the wall that opened into an airshaft.
hotel southern is very indian, verry nise and very clin hotel. in southern you are at home. be sure! you arn in the best area in new delhi when you live in south.bakur from tbilisi.georgia27.02.0707.

local cab to hotel picked up after two hours. local indian taxi driver start laughing at me what kind of hotel i picked-up. area, where hotel is, is quite grabby even according new Delhi standards. rooms are disgusting. outside hotel it is a mess. it was not possible to brave this hotel.

the complimentary airport pickup is a bonus, specially if its your first time in India, and they did show up...eventually! Definately spend the extra money for an executive suite, good sized room and nice bathroom.

the hotel in reality is absolutely nothing like what it's website portrays. caveat Emptor takes me out into the street and up the most filthy alleyway which leads to where my room is. the room was completely infested with cockroaches. Everywhere - running around the bed, the bathroom...I was simply too tired to consider changing hotels, so I decided to brave it out.
the size of the room was small Was initially shown a standard room and was disgustedThe breakfast menu was limiting Kaamat resturant is okay The desk service and butlers etc are quite good.
hotel Southern is near (five minute walking) from the new Delhi metro system. the hotel offers a complimentary pick up from railway stations (and sometimes airports)
the hotel has a great service, very clean and very good locatation. you don't need to move around for prepare your routes in Delhi if you are thinking to travel to Delhi this is excellence choice.
the staff offered to pick me up from the airport and didn’t show. when we did arrive, the room had cockroaches and was hung up in my ear. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

a professionally and elegantly furnished luxury hotel in new Delhi India with an aesthetical ambiance. the luxurious hotel southern is located in the heart of the city of new hampshire, sydney and the u.s.
hii am srinivasan from Tamil Nadu made every arrangements to pickup us from railway station that we haven't had any problem.

the property was very convenient and my stay was smooth. room was clean and service was perfect. morning breakfast was hygienic and tasteful. Thought i took the dinner & it was decent one. I will definitely visit this hotel whenever I planned to come back again.
this was my first visit to india. one of my friend suggested me to take a stay in this hotel through internet. hotel arranged complimentary airport pickup for me.
the property was very convenient and my stay was smooth. room was clean and service was perfect. breakfast was hygienic and tasteful.
I enjoyed my stay at Sri Nanak in Delhi. many thanks to owners Sandeep & Karan who took personal care of us.

the hotel is located in an ideal central area accessible from anywhere in the city any hour. it was a perfect hotel for the business traveler and is ideally located for business travellers - anywhere anywhere if you want to experience the Royal feeling!
the front office was also very cordial and well staffed. the restaurant was not very good. house keeping made sure small things are refilled everyday!

the hotel was just around the corner from bustling activity, shops, traffic and typical Delhi hustle and bustle. the staff was eager to help and very warm and friendly. The room was very spacious; the only drawback is that the shower is not in a separate stall so water sprays over the floor of the bathroom.

a perfect hotel for the business traveler and located in an ideal central area accessible from anywhere in the city any hour. overall set up is excellent and counter staff courteous and helpful. so much so that at times you feel you are unnecessarily taking advantage of their nature just because you want to experience the Royal feeling which the staff wants you to enjoy - it was the perfect stay.
this hotel is situated in a market. good area to stay in as it is an indian area and hassle free. Good shopping close by. small hotel but friendly. staff were helpful.

the hotel is cheap, located in an area with lots of garages and car trading activities. sheets and towels were partly dirty - so this was not a cosy place to stay. the personell is very friendly tough, we were instantly given another room when asking.

room was fabulous with all the facilities. staff were active with good smile on their face. breakfast was excellent in taste. hotel is centrally located in the main city. it is worth the money charged.

this hotel is centrally located in the main city. our room was well organised with all the amenities. staff members were willing to help us anytime. breakfast was tasty and it was served very well by the waiter of the restaurant.

this hotel is centrally located in the main city. staff members were willing to help us anytime. also breakfast was tasty and it was served very well by the waiter of the restaurant. if you want to stay stay a stay in this charming hotel, check out our staff at our friendly staff.
our room was wonderful, the room service managed the things well. the food quality too was up to the mark. this is definitely a good choice.

the bed is placed on a carpet which has not been cleaned in the last one year. the hotel staff must rank as the most unfriendly and rude that I have encountered.they insisted i pay in cash or pay 2% more if I payed by card.
average hotel in the busy Carol Bagh area.not much to describe about except that you cant find another 3 star hotel for this value. the restaurant is not that great and the food too was just OK.

I was at this hotel with my parents from febr 3, 09 - Feb 7, 09. we had travelled from Fiji Islands. the hotel is right in the middle of Karol Bagh and accessible to the main shopping areas. we really enjoyed our stay here. it is located in karol bagh, close to all the shopping area. i was staying here for the first time in my family..
Sri Nanak is definitely one of the best 3 star properties in Delhi. the hotel room & the food was excellent. It was a perfect stay.

we received a warm welcome from the hotel management. the room was spacious and well furnished. in fact, we are thankful because they upgraded our room without any extra cost. there was bath tub, and separate shower panels which we enjoyed the most. we were also given complimentary soft beverages and free laundry service.

Sri Nanak Continental is situated in a rather shabby neighbourhood in New Delhi. we stayed in four different hotels on our trip, and the hotel was by far the worst. the room was old and noisy, so it wasn't possible to leave it on when removing the key to go out, making it as hot as outside (+40 c). the staff tried to scam us when we asked for an hotel taxi to the local market and they wanted Rs. 1500 (!!).

the main room seemed clean enough, but the bathroom was a disaster. towels and towels were clean, and toilets were cleaned - but they weren't replaced unless we asked for it.air Condition machines were noisy but worked ok.Staff: Rather unfriendly and not too service-minded. they also seemed very helpless when it came to things that are not in their daily routine.

we were hosted in hotel Sri Nanak Continental and from my point of view this hotel has a weak organization. we had the next problems due poor organization1.- i requested pick up service in the airport, and taxi never arrives, finally we decided to go by ourself to hotel.- the air conditioner is very noisy, almost impossible to sleep, but with an temperature in summer of 40°C obviously is necessary3.- Room cleaning can be drastically improved.4.-

my husband booked this hotel because it was shown as a top value hotel on Trip advisor! the location is not that great. but that was not our main problem. when we arrived at the hotel, the staff were very rude and extremely lazy. hey took about half hour to check us in and the service was really really bad. finally we were taken to the room. the bathroom was the worst. it smelt of cigarettes and I wasn't sure if they had actually cleaned the bathrooms before arriving. five minutes after we checked into
the hotel & services were very helpful to me as I was the first time visitor to Delhi. they had a very good trip assistance and loyal drivers with cab took me to Haridwar+ Rishikesh+ Tajmahal.

the room was very small and unpleasent. Very DIRTY. Unable to sleep due to a loud noise from the street till 4 am. no hot water at bathroom. breakfast is included, but on checkout we charged 600 rhp for breakfast. the train station is about 10 minutes walk, in an unpleasant area.
the hotel is on a busy narrow street filled with mopeds, fruit stands, and liveliness. if you are 2 or more, you'd probably be ok.
the train station is very near and in the middle of a vibrant area. the service was very good, Bunty the taxi driver was great and very helpful.

the travel desk & staff were also very prompt. I booked this hotel via a travel agent and it turned out to be an extremely decent choice. they had nice, clean rooms with all facilities. rooftof restaurant serves delicious chicken items.

the room was tiny with old style A.C. unit which allowed all the outside noise to come through, making it impossible to sleep. if you arrive early, like we did, they will charge you for an extra night.

the hotel has a travel desk in which we went for the same day tour * delhi local tour which all went perfect. i would like to recommend this hotel to all travelers as I like sharing my opinion so that others can benefit.

the hotel arranged nice luxury car to pickup my family as I was coming from Singapore late night. hotel Sri Nanak was nice, clean & comfortable as my daughter is very particular about the cleanliness of the bathroom but she was happy as there was shower panel in bathroom with 6 nozzles as never expected in such kind of hotels.
the room was very noisy for 2 reasons:1. A/C was rumbling like it was about the explode. Had to switch it off eventually because I got really worried. free wireless internet was good.
staff was nice, though, and the breakfasts were good. the "aloo parata was the best we had in India.

" We stayed for 7 nights in this hotel. I must say they are really hard woking people! The staff were really helpful at all times - the manager was flexible with the late checkout time, we were ready to pay the charge
we enjoyed this hotel very much. its a nice family run hotel by Sandeep & Karan, which is close to connaught places in the heart of Delhi.

the price of 2590 rupees is simply too high for this kind of accommodation. you can get a similar room at Cottage Yes Please for 900/night (and I would have done so, except yes Please was full at that time).

we had very nice time at this hotel,Rooms, staff, internet, clealiness all was very good, we very much enjoyed our stay. the staff was excellent, the hotel was a great place to stay. we enjoyed the stay and the breakfast was great.
the prices of all mid-range hotels are somehow inflated. most taxi drivers will have to ask a couple of times (and may not be able to read the hotel sign or the address on your reservation).

the milk powder sachets were 8 months past the 'best before' date and it is recommended not to drink them after this date. the staff were polite and have good manners and the reception desk were very helpful in providing me with maps, information re shops and other matters.
the hotel was the worst hotel we stayed in india. the staff was not friendly at all - the hotels were not the best in the world! the resturant is fine even if the service was very slow.
the hotel is tucked into a narrow street which was not really car-friendly. the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were clean but the bathroom shower curtains could be better.

the hotel asks for INR 700 for a taxi to the airport, which is quite unreasonable. air-conditioned radio taxi would cost at the most 450. of course, there are much better alternatives. however, in short, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking something in this price class.

it would be unreasonable and irrational to expect everything at its best. hotel rooms are adequately clean and toilet/bathroom = above average3. Maharaja suit could be a nice option for families travelling with young kids and tight budget.

the Sri Nanak is a cozy place in an busy Delhi location. the two rooms we had were both comfortable and clean, but one room was definitely more recently renovated in than the other. on christmas day, we were treated to free simple dinner in the restaurant upstairs.
the hotel is located in the heart of the city, Karol Bagh. the staff was very co-operative and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my relatives and friends.

the hotel was great, the services were just too great. the Owner sandeep was excellent too, he had a dinner with us and that was complimentary. The Manager were very helpful in providing information about the city which was quite handy!

the hotel offered to pick me up from the airport, for 800 Rupees. it took the driver a long time to find the room, which was small, basically furnished and reasonably clean. the staff are very helpful.A good value hotel for Delhi.

Sri Nanak hotel is clean and provides a more than average service for the Indian standards of 3 star. the staff at the reception were outstanding and they helped me organize my days in such an way that I managed to perfectly combine busines and tourism.

this hotel was our first trip to india and we were charged 700 rupees for a "complimentary'' pickup from the airport. the location is awful, but perhaps the rest of Delhi is like that - we only went from airport to hotel and back! there was also some problem with the online reservation payment gateway and if I hadn't checked the total would have paid about twice what I was supposed to to.

the hotel is very close - if the gurdwara is on your LHS, turn R for 1 block, & vise versa. the dining room on the top floor is not very attractive, although an Indian family had a birthday party there 'good sign'

the family that owns the hotel was very helpful and even gave us a deal because we stayed for so long time. the power went off about once every day, but luckily, it had an electric generator that kicked on and kept the air conditioning and lights running. they do what they can to make their guests happy and comfortable.

our partner and we arrived early in the morning. we had given them details of our flight by email a few days before - but nobody picked us up! the staff was very polite, helpful and friendly.Anyway, we believe that for the location and the quality of the suite we stayed, it was overpriced! I would recommend travellers to stay in Paharganj area, which is very close to metro station, much cheaper and more interesting!

the hotel was picked based on tripadvisor reviews. the restaurant on top had very average food. The hotel rooms were extremely average. it was noisy. I must have woken up 3 or 4 times in the night/early morning.

the hotel Sri Nanak Continental is not in New Delhi but in Old Delhi. the location “mistake” was not a mistake but it has now been corrected. India is known for its entrepreneurship and rather than take offense on what appears to be borderline dishonesty it is better to take in your stride and get the problem fixed.

I booked this hotel through internet. we were there for our first business trip. Upon arrival, I was surprised that the check in was still traditional way of recording but with security camera in place. the food is fantastic and the staff is always smiling. The room is clean too.

the staff were helpful, although did raise your suspicions sometime. on the plus side they did help me with train ticket bookings and taxi service. another plus is that they pick you up from the airport, which is a real help since you will inevitably get ripped off by local taxi driver.

the hotel staff was friendly, supportive and helped us acclimate from the USA to India. we stayed in several hotels, and this had the best service, good food, clean accomodations and excellent management and staff.

I picked this hotel based on the reviews and the price, but of all the hotels I stayed at during my month long India trip, I thought this one was the one that I like least. the bed was not comfortable and although the linens looked clean, the bathroom was an average hotel in India bathroom (no bathtub, shower with bucket and a sink and toilet).

this is one of the few places that seems to have plenty of rooms on short notice. it's because they will take your reservation and then move you on to a different hotel of their choice, even if you personally emailed with them to confirm the reservation made via 'a website'

hotel kindly arranged a pick up from the airport, got in at approx 0130 am. the hotel is located in an extremely busy market place and it's the only place where I had to walk back to Delhi due to gridlocked traffic. anyone who doesn't like barking dogs or call to prayer early morning should avoid.Staff were indifferent, the last place no-one wanted to discuss the India-Pakistan cricket game underway.

it took me a long time to decide upon Hotel Sri Nanak Continental as my destination upon arrival in new Delhi. the hotel is ideally located in the middle of the city, but the metro is 10 minutes walk from the airport - and is very close to the subway and metro.

we had to stay at the Sri nanak Continental in Delhi for 10 days. booked the most expensive 3 rooms they had, which was not clean or tidy, but refunded the 3rd night. the staff were helpful at all times, The restaurant is actually a cafe and the food was good.

a good deal of hotels in Delhi is possible, especially if you are not overtired from travel. the hotel's excellent web site, fairly reasonable prices, and offers of amenities, also offers courtesy pick-up from the airport, particularly given the location of the international airport. despite the high prices and negative reviews of many low-middle range hotels, we were attracted to this hotel.

the hotel is decent, if you've been to Delhi you know how hard can it be to find a decent midrange hotel. the rooms are clean but old although some are updated, the breakfast is average compared with other hotels in India - despite the fact that it offers the service of driver, we decided to hire an excellent driver to take us to Jaipur to avoid the crowed trains and it was the best idea.

hotel Sri Nanak offers suites (with 4 beds) suitable for our 6 person family. despite the name, it was spacious and of a basic 3-star level, furnishings were not particularly new nor did the room seem that clean. the staff was friendly and eager to help out.

nice clean and comfortable hotel had nice staff and great reservations department who arranged a good and affordable trip for usPROS: Nice amenities; conscientious staff; free WiFi and internet access w/ computerCONS.

I've stayed at a terrible place called Hotel Classic in Channa Market for 2 nights. but I didn't want to step on the disgusting floor over there - but it's not the same as the other reviewers. the front desk staff were great, the hotel owner himself, Mr. Nanak was there, an extremely likeable and chatty fellow.

the hotel is within walking distance of the metro and the Ajmil Kahn Road bazzar. the food was fine, if a little over priced compared to other places we stayed in India. you can certainly stay in cheaper places (R/- 2126 incl. taxes), but the overall experience had us revisit the two subsequent times we were passing through Delhi.

the staff are so responsible, always pick-up from the airport and train stations on time, and are very helpful and respectful. the restaurant is healthy and has great food! there is an excellent balcony on the roof with plants to enjoy views of the eagles circling around Delhi. this hotel has gone out of its way to provide all comforts and thoughfulness towards its' guests.
after reading the positive reviews about it we finally decided to go for this hotel. Sri Nanak turned out to be a amazing hotel We got more than we expected - the staff was polite, helpful!
we booked the most expensive room at the Sri Nanak and it had no windows and creaky air conditioning. we got another room which was reasonably clean but had a slightly derelict toilet.
have wireless facilties for free.in U.K. u have to pay for them.food is awesome.with nice transport facillties and free breakfast.

this was my first visit to India and I wanted to move to a less expensive, clean hotel. my goal was to see and experience more of the'real India". I used this web site to locate the Sri Nanak hotel, which was clean and clean. the people were incredibly friendly in the neighborhood.
this hotel left everything to be desired. the noise inside and out made it impossible to sleep - as did the hair from the previous guest left on the sheets. staff was unfriendly and not helpful.
taxi/rickshaws tell you they know where it is but don't. filthy street even by delhis standards. grim breakfast. redeeming feature - flashy showers if they worked properly!

we had read several positive reviews before booking our stay at Sri Nanak. on arrival we were greeted by a young man at reception with 'Oh...so you are Mr Quayum?". the bed covers were dirty, complimentary with long black hairs and small dead flies in the folds.

it costs 10 times what another similar kind of hotel will cost you in new Delhi. the hotel is not a bad hotel if you compare it to other Karol Bagh hotels, but unfortunatelly it cost ten times the same price as other similar types of hotels in New Delhi.

the presidential suite was ideal for a family as we had two separate rooms within one room and allowed privacy and peace for my daughter to sleep. the hotel location is fantastic with the Gurudwara, McDonalds and Pizza Hut, ATM and the great shops all in walking distance. food is nice and room service is handy too but you can order takeaway to your room which is an added bonus.

we-a party of 4-booked directly for 5 nights, and requested the presidential suite. the room was large and has a fridge, table and chairs as well as sofa and chaise long...a real bonus is the roof top restaurant-serving breakfast lunch and evening meals. Nice to sit in at night and sup...

I booked this hotel based on online reviews. I knew that it was basic but several reviews indicated good service. staff were pleasant. Internet use was good and free. Rooftop restaurant was extremely average.
I would reccomend it over many other hotels. nice enough place. nothing great on the outside, but rooms were more western than most.

the front desk appeared helpful, but on a number of occasions tried to over charge us for taxis, cars etc. they also misled us regarding the excursions to places like Agra. if you stay at the Sri Nanak, book directly with the hotel as the rate is MUCH lower than offered by third-party booking websites.

we planned to stay at this hotel for three nights, but checked out after the first night. the hotel was very noisy, the bed sheets reeked of petroleum products and the phone did not work - but the shower didn't have a curtain and shower had filthy tablecloths. when we said we were not staying, they advised us that we had to pay for 3 nights as they had not given 24 hours notice of cancellation of our other 2 nights.

the hotel had promised us a welcoming fruit basket which we did not receive. the roads are dirty, busy, noisy and polluted. Having travelled around in delhi, there are other nicer and claner places to stay. on one day our room was not cleaned, we were told that as we had taken the key they didn't clean it even though all hotels have master keys.

the hotel did send a driver to pick us up from Delhi airport. he asked for extra blankets to put under me as it was like sleeping on 'a rock' but no-one seems to have mentioned how hard the beds were though. the staff were very polite and helpful. I think it might be suitable for backpackers or seasoned travellers but not for first time visitors to India.

we were picked up from the airport and stayed in the Maharaja suite which was quite good. the staff were polite and happy and the manager was friendly and takes a lot pf pride in his hotel. we had pre booked and confirmed for the following week-end but was offered an 'alternative " maharaja suite'

average 3 start hotel is situated in a busy commerical area. staff and management go out of their way to make your stay stress free and relaxing as possible! i foned reception at 2 am and manager himself came with us to hospital.internet, massage chair, newspapers, airport pick up and drop off, one whole day sighseeeing tour, half day shopping tour and fruit bowel were all given free of charge together with 5 key ring holders!

our family of four had two rooms booked for the nights of 8, 9, 10 January. our girls room had the most terrible smell in the room and on all the bed linen, and they had to lay some of their clothes on the pillow so as not to breathe in fumes. we did ask for a change, but the alternative was no better. no beds had been swept under for some time!

we chose the presidential suite which is ideal for a family as it can easily sleep up to 5 - 6 people with 2 bathrooms. the hotel had some nice touches including free internet access, daily paper pushed under the door and fresh bowl of fruit served every day.

the wireless internet was very useful and there were no problems with the hot water once we got used to the taps. but this hotel is definitely not a luxury option and the location in Karol Bagh is not great.

the hotel was average, nothing special at all. the area is not the best at night. our particular room had no windows and the mattress was very thin! the staff at the front desk did really care about anything and were always on the phone. don't trust the photo's.

the executive room was clean and quite modern, with a nice bathroom with shower. the hotel is placed quite sentral in new dehli, just short ride from the railway station. try to avoid eating in the resturant, as it was nothing special.

the hot water seemed to be by request and then you needed to wait 30 minutes. it seems hard to find a decent hotel in Delhi. this wasn't bad, but book directly as we booked through expedia and paid over the odds. staff were friendly enough.

the area where the hotel is located offers some of the busiest and most authentic street markets of Delhi. Karol Bagh is a GREAT place for doing shopping, dining, etc. once you get used to the huge amounts of people on the street, the cars, and the noise, then it's not bad at all.
the hotel itself was clean and tidy, the staff helpful and the food was ok. would i stay again - yes he thinks she would.
the staff were excellant and went out of their way to help. the hotel was very clean, the bathroom was fine and certainly better than a lot of places in Delhi at this price, that's for sure.

the whole Delhi experience is a jarring one for westerners. go ahead and cancel your trip to Delhi, or head on over to Mumbai, which is an city that actually has good airport, roads, and enough good hotels to hold everyone. the staff was VERY friendly.

the gurdwara, however, is easy to find, but taxi drivers can't find this place. if you have your laundry done, be sure to iron it, what ever the material is ironed! a couple of polyester shirts came out shiny from too hot an iron, and nothing is dusty or moldy, just worn.
we chose this hotel based on the positive reviews, which I pretty much agree with. the place is very clean, not luxury level, but for the price, it's a bargain.

I got the "presidential suite for about $100USD during late Nov 2006. great for our family of four, and it could easily sleep six with its one king, one full and two twin bunkbeds. Located near Connaught Place. about 40 mins to the airport in Delhi traffic, but it took us exactly 20 minutes at 4:30AM since there was no traffic that early.
the hotel is located in Karol Bagh which is a busy and tight area in the centre of Delhi. it is good for shopping and easy to grab an Auto (3 wheeled taxi) to Connaught Place.
I can only confirm all comments. good choice for people used to stay in similar hotels. Honest experience.Luc, Paris, Luc and Paris.

the neighbourhood can be crazy during market days but metro is near. a rooftop restaurant with good dahl offers good service, friendly staff and friendly service if you're looking for an affordable hotel in the city centre.

I often go to Delhi like every month for my business and will stayed in many differant hotels in Delhi, but this time I booked hotel sunrise. hotel people provide me best service and made me permanent customer and definatly I will stay this hotel. because they fullfil all my requirements and very conveniat place to my office work. Thank you very much.

the hotel is fabulous the rooms are pretty good the staffs are great. they waited for us for the B/ fast till 11:15 am since they close the b/fast by 10:30am the food here is fantastic and they are very co-operative especially the front desk manager was Ms Leena was very help full and cooperative too. the room is very neatly cleaned and the best part is they have location also just 100 m from Karol Bagh Metro, the most happening place of the town.

very good service at hotel Sunrise. helpful and helpful staff. hotel location is excellent market is very near and metro station is also near. very quite place after very long time I sleep nicely because of I in my country work very hard and got vocation for relax so all I got in hotel. reccomand this hotel.

me and my husband book this hotel through a website hotels.com for 5 days. pick-up was free from airport, but we were surprised, because we have read many bad comments about hotel, and they provide us good room and morning we order breakfast it was realy very tasty. I am in Italy now but the taste we cant forget.

it was an horrifying experience sleeping in a room with no ventilation and no natural light, very humid rooms are in this hotel. I could notbreathe properly and found much better hotel in my onward journey.

we stayed at this hotel for a few nights in Nov 09. The room was very small the airconditioner was much too noisy we had to turn it off. the staff were OK as long as you kept tipping them. breakfast was terriable.

detergent gives a foul smell in therooms. I change my room 5 times but the rooms were dark and smelly. but had to manage the night because it was 1o’ clock at night and Ishifted to 'a nearly hotel which was much better'

we werecharged heavily for going to Taj Mahal by taxi as they because afterour life at night when we came to the hotel. we could have done thesame thing from another travel agent at one third of the price - a bunch of touts who are only interested to make extra money.

the hotel and rooms there are faultless. very comfortable, unbelievably clean and beautifully furnished. the service there is exellant and you will not be dissapointed by the hospitality given by all the staff.

this hotel is a complete scam unless you already know India and are Indian yourself. the hotel owner lied to us several times when we asked him travel questions, including telling us that the only way to travel was by train or car, and that we would have to wait 8-10 days for the train ticket (a lie) he offered us car too; as ridiculous price; but instead sketchy pictures of women posing for him in bedrooms came up which quickly hid. some of the staff of his is friendly, but this guy is

I stayed at Sunrise for 17 days last month - over the Diwali period and can recommend it. it is a newly restored small hotel, new bathrooms, furniture and new mattress etc and kept very clean.2- While some of the staff are not highly trained professionals this adds to the charm.
I paid them for THREE days, I stayed there ZERO days and left with NO receipts or bills to prove anything or file case against them. they said 'we don't have any empty rooms but we will do our best'

we have read some good and bad comments on Trip Advisor about hotel Sunrise. they pick-up us from airport early morning because our flight Finn Air was arrive at Delhi airport very early afternoon. we had check-in. They provide us very good room with window with Balcony. so we decide to stay other 4 days. hotel front manager Ms. Leena was very friendly and always smile and ask us Madam are you satisfied with our services. and we smile too and replyhe Lenna we are very happy.

we met ownhis hoter of Sunrise Hotel in Tokyo, Japan with friend of mine. hotel people pick-up us up from airport because it was included in the price. he introduces his hotel us and show us broucher and picture's.
the best aspect of this hotel is the remarkably low price -- around $30 per night. the city is terribly crowded, noisy and dirty, and there are touts every step of the way.

hotel Sunrise is the best hotel in budget price. hotel location is good for shopping. me and my wife stayed in this hotel we feel very comfortable. food was good, Hotel staff was kind and friendly and help us about shopping near by hotel and they helped us for bargaining in the price because we are from Chennai.

i booked this hotel.hotel owner did not seem to run a hotel business, he was intersted in booking my trip in india. the hotel owner promised to upgrade me only if she book trip with him - but the owner also started following me. after reaching there, they pressurised and as the sole travelller in this alien place, she had no option but to accept the tour and pay them. when she refused for the trip, the black tall man with red eyes took me to his travel agency on the corner of

hotel Sunrise is the hotel clean and comfortable. they are take care of the matteress, bedsheet, curtains, wall colours, linen and the cleanliness of a whole hotel. I also took few pictures of Hotel by phone.

it's a worst ever hotel I have stayed with. staff with no professionalism & every time taxi drivers are sitting at reception in dirty clothes looking for there customers. I was badly scared to check-in into this Hotel but had no option in the mid night. whole night staff shuts and screams.

hotel mangement was very friendly and helpful and almost every one in the hotel staff spoke English. hotel owner, Mr. Singh, arranged taxi (with a guide) for us to go to Taj Mahal and surroundings and also for sightseeing in Delhi.

Hotel Sunrise is a good clean and safe hotel for family. friendly and good staff and always ready for help. we have booked Delhi, Agra, Jaipur and Haridwar trip with this Hotel in - package & we realy enjoyed our trip. driver was very good, he showed us all the sight seeing places, some times problem but this is normal when we travel in different city.

the tour guide service associated with the hotel was pretty bad. the driver in Delhi was ok. but then when we got to Agra, the new driver was horrible. he yelled at us and made the trip horrible, so we had to pay for a new tour in anagra.

we made reservations online. when we got there they didn't even have our reservations. the room they gave us was below standard - much different from the description given online, but the receptionist said that we had to change the rooms because it was already reserved for someone else. this was very inconvenient. woke up in the middle of the night by the people from reception and their friends making a lot of noise and talking very loud down the hallway.

the hotel was well worth the money, the rooms are well presented, extremely CLEAN and well fitted out with TV, bar fridge, AC and attached bathrooms. the staff were so friendly and accomodating, in our first room the internet signal was a little low so they actually moved us to the room with better signal straight away! we couldn't of asked for anymore, we will be staying here again when we return to Delhi!

the hotel sunrise from south africa was booked by my Sister to new Delhi. the management helped us arrange or tour in and around Delhi, our car was set and were ready for our tour. 'Oh my god it was a tour out of this world!'

the hotel had RATS in the room and the bed sheets were torn. when I wanted to leave they charged me extra money which was not agreed at the time of check in. they forced me to pay. it was a nightmare and I thought the musclemen will come and beat me up, if I dont pay I was horrified.

the hotel is brand new and it shows. rooms are small but neat and clean. the staff is very courteous and the room service more than adequately makes up for it. budjet travellers are looking for a cozy nook in the centre of the city.

i booked 2 nights at this hotel through expedia, the price included pick up from the airport which was important to me as a single female traveller. the taxi driver was unable to find the hotel and the area was deserted by the time it was 2 o'clock in the morning by this time and we eventually found the travel agent who amazingly was still open.

hotel Sunrise opened four months ago and is an undiscovered budget gem in the heart of bustling Karol Bagh. hotel owners offer a wide range of services in Delhi and around the country, including custom travel packages to suit the wishes and desires of most customers.

we stayed here for 2 nights at a price of INR2800 per room per night inclusive of breakfast and all taxes. hotel manager was very helpful and looked after me and my friend as it was diwali, they advised us not to go out alone as we were likely to hit by fire crackers.food was good and prices were cheap in comparison to other places.
the breakfast room was a dark dreary place and again felt very dirty. we had lunch at the imperial hotel and it was very nice. you are gonna need it.

we stayed here as part of an Intrepid Tour (North India Highlights) the hotel was a good area with lots of shops and was very close to the Metro. the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large, and there was plenty of hot water. we did eat at the restaurant once (on the rooftop) and the food was actually pretty good.

i stayed there twice, 2 differents times, booked by travel agent. rooms are clean, no windows, mini bar, dont drink the water in there, not sealed, they just refilled from tap water. if you can find a hotel, it is better.

we recently returned from india after the marriage of our son in amritsar. our agent had advised us that he had booked this hotel for one night for us - we had to stay one noght in Delhi to catch next days flight to Amritar. a quick call to the agent got them all excited and they offered us room but we needed to sleep on the floor. we refused, then they walked us to 'a neighbouring' of the hotel- it was dilapidated old building not worthy
we stayed here as part of our Intrepid Northern India Highlights tour. it is in a great location, with some excellent shops/restaurants and the metro within walking distance.

on arrival in india our first dissapointment was no airport pickup. the staff indicated the hotel was full already with no place for us, we found a substitute hotel with the help of our cab driver. attempting to resolve the issue for refund of money were met with attempts to blame the incident on us for leaving hotel when requested but not being able to be contacted when they found their mistake.
hotel was good, rooms okay if a little small but hot water and decent bathroom made up for it. hotel accomodation overall was okay and the staff weren't as helpful as they could've been.

we stayed at the Sunstar Grand in early march of 2007 while sightseeing in Delhi. the staff was a little sluggish and seemed very eager to earn some tips, but one has to expect this when dealing with an non-luxury hotel in India, especially in major city.

boiled egges, moldy toast, non descript jam, Sunny delight as juice, that it. it would be better if the hotel went R/O.Restaurant staff were worthless. 4 or 5 staff could'nt get a table cleared for us at breakffast. this also happened to our friends on the second morning so we ended clearing tables ourselves.
nice hotel close to the city. noise level just enough to get some sleep. room and bathroom were very clean, modern and spacious. Staff friendly and helpful. Ideal for short stays.

we stayed in this hotel twice whilst on a group tour of Northern India. the hotel was located at the back and had marble floors, cable TV, tea and coffee making facilities which was good and the decor was kitsch but okay.

the rooms seem to have little soundproofing between them leading to some embarassment about using the bathroom when one's neighbour is in residence. the staff quickly backed down when challenged on these charges and when they heard me say definitively that I would not pay it.

the first time we got a small room (one side of the bed was against the wall so you could only get in it from the other side) the second time the room was bigger, had no window, and windows. in winter is served in an unattractive room in the basement, with white neon lights and sort of shower curtains to divide it in two. we didn't eat much but other people seemed to enjoy their breakfast.the street is relatively quiet and not too noisy.

the room charge was for bed and breakfast, but when checking out the manager was going to charge for breakfast. the charge is not always what the menu says some of our meals were charged at twice the amount than was written on a menu (check, check and check everything). the restaraunt was awful as was the food. I wouldn't recommend this hotel because we had to keep checking all the costs and continued to find prices were always wrong.

we asked the manager for fresh towels the next day that never turned up and the following night we did have sheets but we were better off in our own sleep sheets. would not recommend this hotel unless they make some changes.

the rooms are very comfortable, with great airconditioning and clean sheets and towels. the bathroom was clean and there was always hot water, which wasn't the case in many hotels I've stayed in India.
the service is abysmal (as in I can't believe these people are actually in the hospitality business) bathrooms were okay (I stayed in rooms 105 and 305)

if you try to contact hotel directly the hotel you'll end up in contacting a travel agent who works as an contact point on many nearby hotels. avoid these broker/ middleman to save money by saving money on hotels directly.
rooms were clean.not a great area of town (far from the center) rooms are clean and beds are ok.breakfast is disgrace and service rivals that.acceptable if you just need an clean place to sleep.
the rooms were clean and the ac was not working properly. the area karol baugh where this is situated..was noisy...and crowded.there is an eating place called Raffles.

we had a room at the back on the 4th floor 405. Its perfectly acceptable but we did find our room unlocked on return so make sure you lock away your valuables or use the lockers in the managers office.

the hotel seemed really ok at first glance, the room was clean, but...the receptionist holds me back, saying "my travel agent'' would be here in 2 minutes and wanted to see me about my stay. after a few minutes he felt my mood about his presence and excused himself.it was only three times the normal price (which I would not care so much as it was an adequate, comfortable car), but it wasn't just taxi at all, just any private car (maybe the hotels'

the hotel quoted me 1500 rupees less than the price I paid and said they were available. when I went back they tried to charge me more and on checking out were shouting abuse and all sorts. I would never stay at this hotel ever again and advise anyone NOT to STAY HERE. we are non resident Indians and they are looking to rip us off so I can only imagine what they do to tourists.
the food was great, the service was prompt and the rooms were good. the only downside is the neighborhood, Karol Bagh is quite chaotic and noisy...but then again all of Delhi is that way!!!!!
sunstar Grand and Residency are two different hotels. they must be under the same ownership and close to each other, that's why it gets a bit confusing. I will post my review under Sunstar grand.
great rooftop terrace for breakfast if you get up early (only one shady table for the latecomers) thankfully breakfast is cheerfully delivered to your room.

our room was large, clean, confortable, the bathroom huge with an amazing bathtub... the food was also excellent and service above average. I am going back there in few days and definitely recommend it.

we stayed in hotel Sunstar for 2 days in December and the experience was horrible. the room looked like a dungeom and there is constant noice all night and bugs all over the rooms - and it was only slightly better than the other room. we paid an exhorbitant amount for COX and KINGS travel agency for out Delhi-Agra-Jaipur trip, which was the only hotel available in Delhi.
the service was good, and the tariff is an added attraction, really less. Considering the area (Karol Baug), the price is affordable.

we booked a "SUITE' with king bed for two adults and two children. when we checked out, we were charged for the extra bed. the manager on duty will not remove the charge until I went on the web and showed him the confirmation email mentioning no additional charge for 'roll away bed'
check In was quick late night menu exhaustive and service commendable. the hotel is neat and clean with internet access facility and a travel desk.
hotel is close to all basic necessities and the metro rail station, which is a great boon getting around delhi. good for tourist, business, in city hotel tucked in shopping area of karol bagh.

booked the hotel online after reading tripadvisor reviewsIts cheap and you get what you pay for. i stayed for two saysin january Had a very comfortable stay at this hotel.good room/laundry service Execllent restuarant Excellent service through-out the stay.

the hotel is on a street just off the main street in Karol Bagh and perfect for the metro. we got persuaded into visiting some carpet shops on the way - but it was definitely not ours and if you’re like us to be avoided. the staff are helpful and no problems with anything there.

taxi driver tried to drop me off at swati deluxe, and wouldn't go anywhere when he told him i was at the wrong hotel. the room itself was quite small, but with decent decor, aircon was right over both of the beds like 2 feet next to one, which made it impossible to actually use while in either bed.

the rate we paid got us a room with beds and clean sheets. the shower for the room rate was not clear as such but the water is hot so i guess that compensates for that. if you are only there for one or two nights, you will be back one day but not to the hotel swati.
for around $50 a night you get very good food, helpful service, and above adequate (clean) room facilities. if you can show some self restraint, its definitely worth it!
staff was very accomodating and arranged a cab for us to the airport at 0130 am. restaurant Suruchi was excellent. good vegetarian food and complimentary buffet breakfast.

the hotel arranged a taxi to the airport for me, although the agreed price was about INR 350. it was on time - although there are only one handful in the city, so probably an premium worth paying for convenience's sake.
the hotel has the following address:Hotel Swati15 A / 56, W.E.A., Karol Bagh,Opp. Roopak Stores, Ajmal Khan Road, New Delhi - 110005(India)

air conditioner caught fire on way back in a different room. took 15 to 20 minutes to get any staff to come and send the boy to their room. no fire alarms and no evacuation of course, although they did give us another room! stayed here at the beginning and end of an adventure travel type tour down the Ganges.

our room was the standard room for 2000rps a night. it was spacious with cable tv, fridge, aircon, in-room safe and comfy beds and pillows - and free wi-fi internet to all the rooms. the restaurant serves excellent veg. Thalis and breakfast is included in the price.

great size hotel tucked away in Karol Bagh. good room/laundry serviceExecllent restuarant with regional vegetarian thali's - these are unlimited as well!Breakfast is good buffet choice (the freshly made 'theplas' are a must!)

staff begin work at 5am, opening and closing doors, taking linen from nearby cabinets, talking, dragging chairs and tables etc. - all with much noise. Nearby room had its bathroom just behind our heads, heard every opening of water, shower etc, very annoying.complaints did not help. hotel breakfast at nearby restaurantvery very poor, even didn't have eggs... a good breakfast! staff are not isolated from internal noise, staff start work's st i stayed in the room

the hotel is in the middle of Karol Bagh - close to shops, food outlets, metro station. the nternet Wifi is free (and working), plus a computer near the front desk which helped me serach abt whr to go, eat etc whilst waiting for transport.
we stayed at the Swati Deluxe at both the start and end of an Intrepid tour. we found the location to be very good - close a metro station. the shops around were very interesting to us.

we settled on the Swati Deluxe Hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor. they showed up at the airport as promised for the complimentary pickup. 2) Our room was basic but both the room and the hotel inside was very clean.
the hotel can get its act together for Cleanliness and Service. May not stay again as there are better places. i liked the location. close to the metro station, restaurants. but the staff is nice.
my bill also came about 9,000 lesser than my last stay in Delhi. I will stay here for my future travel as long as they extend the same facilities – discounts etc.
the hotel will charge 22.5% of taxes for the price shown on the pamphlet. Ovearall, it is a below average hotel.
mid-range hotels in India are about on par with economy motels in the States. the hotel is a little difficult to find, so be sure you have specific directions/information to provide to your driver.

our first night in india, the hotel gave us a fruit basket which consisted of an apple. we left it on our TV stand and during the night I could hear gnawing sounds! small 3-occupancy rooms and no working shower heads. buffet breakfast at hotel's restaurant.

the hotel was well located, near restaurants and shopping. staff were not very helpful when we raised our concerns that the room was not being clean and waited around waiting on bakeesh, even after just cleaning it. despite the staff's concerns, we felt like our staff weren't helpful. the rooms was dirty, with hairs all in the rumpled sheets and trash still in a trash can.

myself and three friends stayed in the Swati Deluxe on three seperate occasions during the months of December 06 to January 07. we originally found this hotel through our travel group, Intrepid, though we returned to it when we were travelling independently.

the Swati Deluxe is a very well located hotel, in the market center of Karol Bagh. it's not very expensive, and the rooms are okay, clean at least, with western facilities. don't go to the restaurant just beside the hotel (the hotel will send you to that place for breakfast)
Delhi is expensive anyway. Delhi has very good service, clean rooms, food ok, free breakfast. the only downside is the price but it is cheap anyway.

the hotel is located down a dark and dirty alley off the cycle market in Old Delhi. the rooms are basic, dark, and small, but they are clean, cheap and are ideally situated for visiting the fort, mosque and bazaars of old Delhi.
this place is like only for backpakers" not for family with young teenage children. bad area hotel though though a good place to stay if you stay in the st..

hotel is situated in the old Delhi, meaning if you like to be in a quiet neighborhoud, forget about it. but the rooms are quiet and the hotels are clean and comfortable at the same time. the restaurant is not good, so don't go.service was nice enough (not amazing though).

I visit Delhi every year to help with a charity called 'Butterflieschildrights' and have stayed in several hotels. it is clean, friendly and the food is really good. I have been made to feel so welcome and staff are really caring. you don't need to stay in really posh hotels as there is no guarantee you will get the cleanliness or service you would pay for.
it’s a new hotel but not was built & maintained. furniture is good, rooms are small sized, bathroom tiles are dirty and W/C back is also dirty.

hotel is alive and busy and the alleyway to the hotel a bit daunting. staff and travel bureau were helpful when we arrived in the dark. the rooms are spacious, very clean, the bedding was changed daily.

the attached travel agency was one of the best I have found in a long time. the agent Rameez sorted out all my problems in no time flat and made sure that I was not taken by any taxis or touts. he is fast at getting everything right. Better than I ma with the bookings in one spot...Just wish they had wifi in the rooms..

in the middle of an old quarter of Delhi which is run down is a modern hotel - extremely clean and cheap with lots of helpful staff. the view from the terrace of Red Fort, Jama MAsjid and 'a Jain temple' is delightful and priceless.

nice clean rooms with good bathroom and prompt room service. took away one star on account of the ordinary food served in the restaurant. Otherwise, its just awesome and highly recommended for anyone visiting old Delhi or catching a train from there.
the hotel was clean and the staff very welcoming. the restaurant food is good if you want to venture out in the evening looking for places to stay in Delhi.
stayed for 2 nights with my girl friend and surrounding place is very crowded and noisy. lot of poor people baggers in the area and irritate you to heights.

Kashmir reminded me of the valleys I had seen during my travel through Europe. its fresh mountain air, green open spaces, and abundance of water was a great find. Overall this trip was full of smart decisions!

the hotel has a 24 hr restaurant at good prices. the breakfast is complimentary, if you have Indian breakfast then all is good continental style is quite confused, but does the job.the staff are excellent. The hotel is excellent for the Red Fort, the Mosque, Chandi Chowk and shopping and the Sikh Temple.

it was my first time in india and i decided to go Old Delhi myself and chose this hotel Tara Palce. the hotel was very clean and food was delicious and the location was beautiful with view of Red Fort and Jama Masjid - a great place to stay!

we chose this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor, especially the review on the travel agent Rameez. the hotel was booked in Varinassi, which was too far away from the Ghats, because you were out of town. they tend to make lots of excuses and pass the buck.

the airport pick-up worked flawlessly, which was great since we arrive at 8PM. the location is in the middle of Old Delhi, not on the normal tourist trail,i which can be intimidating for newcomers. it is only blocks from the Chandni Chowk market, a classic old-style Delhi market full of wonderful surprises down the many side alleys.

the area just comes to life and you can see the real Delhi in one place. it is a clean, comfortable well presented hotel with pleasant and helpful staff. Room pleasant but no view, aircon ok and not too noisy.

Nice and cheap hotel. the rooms are clean and you're just in the middle of old town, not so far from metro line. we stayed there 3 nights, avoid the room near the kitchen because they are always at work.

we booked the first night of our tour in india and the pick up at the international airport. they were there to wait for us, which was a good start indeed. the hotel is clean, the staff efficient and helpful.

very clean rooms, comfortable after a crazy day on the streets of old Delhi, very quiet, nice and allways available staff to help you with anything you need. great food, we could say it was one of the best food we ate in India.great value for price.

the hotel is on a alley in the middle of old Delhi, in walking distance to the red fort, the big mosque, and the NDLS and DLI railway stations. the staff is nice and helpfull - the restaurant has excellent food, maybe the best food we ate in India, available 24h p. day!

our experience of this hotel started at the airport. the driver was there to welcome us, he was friendly and informative. The front desk staff were outstanding, they were friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. all our special requests had been arranged prior to arrival.
