the men at the front desk were very helpful and gave us internet for free. on our second day there we met a man named Rameez, that if I can remember works for adventure travel company, we booked ALL our train tickets (which he had available for us the next day!!!) the man was very useful, funny and excellent with English, and will listen to what you wish to do - and honestly gives you an excellent rate, throughout our whole trip!

hotel's website: www.tarapalacedelhi.comMe and my wife stayed three nights at Tara Palace on two seperate occasions in July 2009 as part of a sightseeing trip (golden triangle) the location is good- Cheapest hotel in its class that I could find- Very neat and tidy rooms with good airconditioning- Away from busy streets (See notes below though)- Check-in / out fairly easy.

the hotel is about an hour (or more depending on traffic) away from the airport. we found that hotel Tara Palace had high marks from most readers on this score *and* it was reasonably priced! hotel staff booked us an airconditioned private taxi to take us to agra and back (a full-day trip to see the Taj Mahal in Agra)
the alley leading up to the hotel is totally sketchy, but once you walk it a few times its fine! my room was pretty basic, and the overall service was decent.

we were supposed to stay 3 days and felt so much at ease that we remained till the end of our stay in Delhi. the place isn't luxurious but very comfortable - it is a great place for people who want to be in old Delhi with security and comfort if you are in the old dharhar. you feel at home, all the staff is very friendly and the manager keeps to his word.

this was my first trip to india and was feeling overwhelmed by the population. I booked by hotel reservation well in advance, but was told by my taxi driver that he 'didn't know where Hotel Tara Palace was" despite my having a good address'

I booked 2 nights at Tara Palace based on the recommendations from TripAdvisor and other sites. the hotel was reasonably priced and clean, the staff were polite, spoke good English and got me to my room with a minimum of fuss - this was about 1am by now.

the hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff are fabulous. the front of house team were also first class - you can trust their travel desk to do the best for you and to give advice without expecting a sale.I'll be back, it's high on my list favourites!
the hotel was out of the way, in Old Delhi. the taxi driver drove to this place, and pointed down a dark alley to the entrance. despite the location wasn't fantastic, the service was quite good.
we woke up and walked around Old Delhi for an hour taking in the sights and all the people. the last thing we wanted was a dirty scary hotel - it is back there!

this was our first trip to India and we booked Tara Palace online off of their website. the room was immediately charged in full on my credit card (£35 per night per room) the hotel is situated in the 'old cycle market' where vendors are selling their wares and tires hang from shopkeeper's hooks.

we stayed at the hotel Tara Palace on the first night of our 3 week holiday in india. the staff were helpful and courtious, and our room was large.Due to a cancelled flight we had to alter our booking at short notice, they were very willing to assist, care for our bags and advise us on travel plans.

the hotel is located in a run down area but this is the centre of old delhi. it is in the bustling streets of india and the streets are buzzing with indian daily life all the facilities are clean,the rooms bright with adequate facilities the restaurant is fine the staff helpful.

the location is great for the red Fort and in the midst of Old Delhi. take advantage of the complimentary airport pickup - it's good to have a driver who knows how to find the hotel as it is down an alleyway.
this place was very nice... clean with good serivces, warm shower etc... the price is a bit high. the location is tough in general (old Delhi) but the hotel certainly stands out as an oasis.

the hotel was pretty average and the walls were pretty thin. we were so tired after all that flying that it didn't really matter. the alleyway was a little scary coming in late at night, but was much less so in the day light.

they have the tv blasting 24 hours a day downstairs at reception and you can hear it in the rooms. the other annoying thing is the lift buzzer.I went for breakfast on the first day and they had jugs of water. I said mineral water and pointed at it.

the hotel was a decent cheap hotel in the heart of old Delhi. it was close to the Red Fort and Jama Masjid - the first place we stayed in India! the airport transfer was slow and overpriced and next time we'd definitely skip it and taxi/auto rickshaw.

pre-paid airport pickup was prompt and as promised. the hotel is wonderfully located, if Old Delhi is what you want. it sits at the end of a small alley that looks scary at first but once you get used to the ebb and flo of the area, you see that it is busy but safe.

for our first night in Delhi we chose this hotel after reading reviews and comparing different sites. we were very happy with our choice, good and clean room, very good price,great location in Old Delhi, nice and helpful staff-never tried to sell us anything which is much appreciated in India... lovely breakftast, internet We chose it again later on our journey, I do recomment to stay here- it is a pity that is not recommended on the guides-I had the Rough GuideOf

the staff at the hotel were very nice and willing to help us plan our trip and get us taxi's. the air condtioner didn't work and the glass in our bathroom window was shattered, as well as some missing glass-shards missing which made us nervous about mosquitoes. I would not stay here if I was not traveling with a man based on its location in old delhi.

my weeklong stay at the Tara Palace was just alright. but there were several things that I didn't like about the hotel - airport pickup was great. no problems here.-Hotel was clean. Rooms were made every day and soap/shampoo was replaced most days.
clean hotel, good service depending on who you're talking, but in a sketchy location. not too safe during the night if you wanna go out.
good free breakfast included (proper breakfast, not muffins and juice boxes)Cons:Neighborhood is very, very dirty, and very poor.

the hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff are lovely. it's located in a small alley in the back of Old Delhi which may be overwhelmng for first-time visitor, but the service was inconsistent. 2 hours, one taxi and one rickshaw later I finally located it. note that their booking confirmation forms have no address or phone number on them so write them down separately! if Tara Palace is going to quiz their guests about plans then send them to recommended travel agent, they should make sure the agent is delivering what

this hotel is new with spotlessly clean, spacious rooms and comfortable beds. the staff were exceptionally friendly, they bent over backwards to assist and the restaurant food was OK. there were insufficient blankets on the bed on arrival but more were secured from reception after a phone call.

the rest of our party of 14 arrvived over the next day and all received the same treatment. internet access in the rooms plus cable TV, prompt 24 hour room service. Nearby is busy Chandi Chowk which in day is colourful and you can buy fresh fruit at markets.
Tara Palace was our first hotel in India. the hotel was clean and the staff were always willing to help us when we got into trouble.Drinks on the roof was also a treat.

unless you want to stay in a really expensive hotel in Delhi, it is going to be in the bad neighborhood. the location is good for some sightseeing, but don't expect to wander around past sundown. if your taxi driver insists on calling ahead to 'confirm" your reservations, this scam is common scam. you will pretend to call and then tell you your room is double booked and try to divert you to another hotel where he gets hefty commission.

hotel was clean, with an impressive lobby, although the room was smallish, but had all the facilities there. hotel staff was very friendly and supportive but the thing which was most useful for me was the internet connection the my room as I am a techie so cant live without it.i would like to visit this hotel again soon.

the hotel staff directed all comments to my (male) companion, even when I asked questions. been to India several times before with no problems, was dressed conservatively, never had this sort of intimidation in a hotel.

the stay was very comfortable and most amazing part was where hotel allowed my uncle to dress entire room with flowers. the size of room was quite good and bathroom was really clean and spacious too. i stayed there in Jan'08 for a about 3 days after my marriage and before my Honeymoon in Goa.
over priced - US$144 twin room with an extra bed. staff are friendly. breakfast is not bad. decent food,both western and local.hotel is old. wifi is okay.
hotel Vikram offers all the facilites you want. you could easily tak eosme other luxurious hotel for the tariff that they charge. the place aslo is hoem to unwanted people (read :Prositutes etc.)
very clean but it has no air con in the washroom and it is very hot this time round (36C) it costs me around USD100, include breakfast, so quite good value.

the Vikram Hotel is in 10 min drive to the Lotus Temple. a Travel Agent helped us arrange our trip to Agra and all the sightseeing tours around Delhi. also booked our airline tickets to Kochi, Kerala.
a decent and reasonably priced hotel in Delhi. value for money and the hotel is kept clean and maintained well. the staff are very cooperative and helpful.

hotel Vikram was recommended by the travel agent and visited it before confirming the booking. the rooms are clean, freshly done up and comfortable. Specifically choose a carpeted room especially in winters as the rates are the same.

my friend told me about this hotel, it is value for money in everyway ie food,alchol,room etc so overall you dont end up spending much in the hotel.Quality of food is also vey good infact I had the best Indian food here.staff is very helpful and best part is location its right next to all the bars, shopping and also work places.

the staff was quick with check-in, but the floor lobbies & rooms had old carpet, which smelled stale and bad. the bathroom vent was woefully covered with plastic from the outside, and the food on the menu was one of the hotel’s stronger points. Wouldn't recommend or stay here again again if you're looking for a place to stay in the u.s.

this is one of the hotels with the archetypal Indian doorman, complete with giant moustache and turban. metal detectors were installed at the entrance, but don’t work - this set the standard for what was to come if you first arrive but that novelty wears off. the room was adequate though the immovable shower head was annoyingly weak, and being 6ft tall, I had to bend me knees in order to get under it.
the hotel is located near the hospital I was intending to visit, near Nehru Place. it has a small restaurant, taxis available, and the restaurant is clean. if you stay here, bring ear plugs.
hotels in Delhi are generally expensive due to lack of rooms and high demand. hotel is safe, has AC (if it doesn't fail), clean bathroom and a comfortable bed.

my family (2 Adults and 2 children) stayed at the Vikram in the end of October 2007 for 10 days. the hotel is about a 20 minute taxi ride from the centre of Delhi (depending on traffic conditions) we negotiated Rs 10,000 per night for luxury room including 2 extra beds and breakfast.
there are some interesting walks around the hotel into what I presume to be fairly up market areas with their own common gardens. the market is mightily impressive (if you're into shopping)

we stayed in a superior room between 02 March and 07 March 2007. the room was spacious and stylishly furnished, room service food was good and was also reasonably priced. front-desk staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful.

the hotel is situated in Lajpat Nagar, just off the Ring Road. the lobby is bit on the smaller side but adequate seating is available for it's size. check-in was fast but not very friendly.Room was adequate in size for a hotel in this class. Bed was comfortable and TV had most of the cable channels. Bathroom was good.

in the morning we packed our bags and went searching for something better and ended up at Hotel Vikram in Lajpat Nagar. the hotel has recently been refurbished so the carpets and rooms are new and very nice, and the bathroom was small but nicely done, even better than the Taj Mahal bathrooms.

my wife and I stayed at the Vikram hotel twice during April 2006. the rooms were O.K. (television, air conditioning etc) but hot water was temperamental and twice I had to take a cold shower. buffet breakfast was rather bland and the options limited. check in was efficient but not very friendly. on the plus side the hotel was clean and safe and was conveniently located close to the Locus Temple, Qutb Minar and South Extension Markets.
neighborhood is not nice, not a place to be walking around. service was adequate. even though proximity to major tourist sites is good on the map, it took long time to get to anything.
the staff was quick with check-in, but the floor lobbies & rooms had old carpet, which smelled stale and bad. bed mattresses were old and lumpy. Wouldn't recommend or stay here again.

the hotel Vikram is an ideal refuge after a day of sightseeing. rooms were spotless and comfortable, and furnishings were new and tasteful, shower and bathroom extraordinarily clean and traffic noise minimal.
hotel wELCOME PALACE IS A PATHETIC HOTEL..mR miglani owner of this hotel is a cheat.

my buddy and I were working in Indonesia, and decided to take a weekend trip to see the Taj. when we arrived, weary from our flight and ordeal with customs around 3 am, he accidentally went to hotelwelcomepalace.net, where we ended up here. we had to bargue to get ourselves an extra matress for the floor, after we were situated and had just fallen asleep, they come banging on the door to move us to another room.

our Id was asked at the hotel and then transferred to room after check in which was express and took 5min only.. we were hungry when we checked in and ordered the dinner which served in 15min, & we really enjoyed the food. next day on asking hotel for sightseeing hotel arranged it for 3 days. Delhi Sight Seeing/ agra same day tour and shimla 2 days! hotel had free internet for there all guests staying.Hotel have just opened there Resturant which is upto 12

the first room we were in was very dirty, had holes in the wall, and no windows. after inspecting the room further we found rat droppings on the nightstand and the floor, but later on when it appeared we couldn't handle it anymore. we asked to be switched to a different room, after management made us feel stupid for asking such an ridiculous request.

staff was sooo rude! they also had organised airport transportation for us even though we didn't even talk abt that with them. after one night in the morning one of the staff members is knocking our door and says that we need to change our room that it's booked to some other people.

when we first checked in, we asked for the exact pricing of the rooms and cabs etc... so that we don't get conned later on. we then arranged for a taxi to take us to the train station the next day and wake up at 4:45 because there was no wake-up call! if we ask the manager, he tells us nothing has been written in the books!

the hotel is close to the metro and the shopping area of Karol Bagh. it can close on your limbs... and better you climb up the stairs to your floor... You've been warned... but it's the total opposite...I don't know if the owner ever says anything true in his words... Everything you ask is 'OK' but without any concrete actions... lol, I could write a book about this part... Well, in brief... Cabs scheduled on the eve are nowhere to be found

the hotel was not bad but not very good neither.there is one pc connected to the internet which is an advantage. the rooms were ok for 2 persons. however, having hot shower is a problem. it was pure luck to sometimes have hot water and sometimes not.

we stayed in hotel Welcome palace on the 25th-26th October 2007. we asked the owner to give us a wake up call at 430 on 26th and arrange for the cab @500. the next morning, there was no wake-up call, no bbc waiting for us at the train station. he said the driver is waiting at station, since none of the requests we had made earlier were not satisfied.
the hotel website advertises complimentary breakfast. we ordered it on the first day. Found it terrible. 'Director' apologized and tried to make amends by reducing rental charge.

we booked 3 nights in a double room with ensuit, for 800 rupees per night online. we turned up and were given shoe box, with no AC, no towels, and no loo roll, so we upgraded to 'delux' rooms, ranging from our room being the worst, to 5 bed delux rooms.
the staff was very friendlier,polite & attentive. we were on the First floor say the Executive Floor of the Hotel. Unlike some hotels there was not a hint of stuffiness or formality there.

the hotel is basic and as a one time Peace Corps volunteer, I found it met all my needs. the staff was helpful and friendly and there was room service and breakfast was delivered to the room (included). the main drawback was the location which was not familiar to many rickshaw or taxi drivers, but this lack of knowledge was true for all but the most famous places.

the hotel is acceptable if you are on a budget but I think I would try my luck somewhere else next time. we stayed here for 2 nights in April 2007. Generally the reception area was OK and the staff reasonably helpful. however, the sheets on the bed had already been slept in and there were some fairly unsavoury bugs in the bathroom.
welcome palace is in heart of city, good shoppin place around mc donalds, sravan bahvan all good food joints and food of vry helpful employees.

the Welcome Palace staff made us feel like family each time we arrived, arranged for our transportation with flawless efficency, made sure we found the best restaurants and even took us shopping to their secret favorite shops. the hotel itself is clean and spacious.They provided ample hot water (once we figured out how to turn it on), bottled water to drink and the room service was very good.
if u wanna live in delhi close to the airport and closer to gurgaon then it is a good place to stay.....comfortable rooms.

hotel rooms are very bad. ho heater no proper AC. bathroom is really bad, very small and dirty. they didn't bother to clean it. couldnot even open the window as the passer by can see inside. it ruined our honeymoon trip.

the hotel are built like a echo chamber, every little noise from the rooms or the reception go straight into your room. there was bad smell in our rooms, no windows and very dark inside. we felt ill from staying here, and felt better as soon as we had an possibilty to leave the Hotel. try to find another hotel in Delhi, wich make it possible to cach your departure even if the monsoon have hit Delhi badly.

the westend inn is not as horrific as some other reviews make it out to be, but don't expect a 5 star experience. the hotel staff speaks limited english (be prepared for that in in the US in general) the rooms on the second floor have better wifi reception.

hotel employees kept asking for tips and wouldn't leave the room until i've paid them. taxi driver asked for 300 Rs to get to the airport because he came from there the night before and gave him 200 Rs. the hotel charged an additional $300 Rs on my roommate's bill when checking out for this taxi service.

the reports about airport noise are clearly wrong. the only downside is the location which is isolated from other facilities and involves an adventure in the Delhi traffic. i have recently returned from Delhi where I visited along with some 40 others as part of a cricket tour.
room was spacious, and marble floor gave a sense of luxury. the bathroom was very poor, the walls had patches of mildew and the fittings were covered in limescale.
airport staff pronounced this "Westin'; a true nightmare. the shower was made of three glass walls that joined with about an inch gap between them AND NO CAULK.

travel agent booked us in saying it is a 4 star.1. Check in was pathetic, they always give bad room first. they will change to better room after you complain.2. They will say no payment was made by travel agency; but that was not always the case & makes your checkout longer.there seem to be preferential treatment to foreigners for some odd reason.

we were part of a British group booked into this hotel for two nights while touring Delhi. this is two or three stars in Paris at best (and yet it is far from any tourist sites and shopping) the dining room food was adequate, although some in our group went hungry (not liking the few choices)

the airport counter recommended this hotel and gave me a ride to the place. the party went on till well over 2:00 AM. staff didn't let people know during check-in that they could not ask the people to reduce their noise "since they were in their room'

the front half of the attached building is collapsing, half demolished, looks like an earthquake zone. buffet was disorganized but OK. Yes it's close to airport but nothing else is - there are no non-smoking rooms and they smell of stale cigarettes.

we did not sleep for more than 50% of the nights we spent there. staff is at best strange, usually fully dismal - preferably making as much noise as possible in the process, and speaking really loud, so you have no chance to sleep- sub-optimal food- particularly gloomy court for dinner and breakfast- not-so-clean bathrooms- no customer service and attention,- and the cherry on the pie: our second night, a drilling rig was operating just 10m from our bedroom, at 8pm

the tour company used booked me here for my first night in Delhi. it was the best option to return to Delhi later in the week. i'm looking for alternatives for a trip to the uk later this week if it's an alternative to ireland next week in london.

we booked up at the white house through Colourful Indian holidays. they chose the hotel and we looked it up and it looked fine inside. rooms were air conditioned and spacious and bathrooms well equipped. the restaurant on the roof had quite a good selection so you didn't need to venture out in the evening.

hotel was good for access to Karol Bagh/Connaught Place during the day. but as a lone travelling female did not feel overly safe in the evening, though think this would apply to other hotels in capital anyway. I would rate this hotel as average-good in terms of cleanliness & food.
the trip to national airport was double the usual cost. they said they would exchange money at 39rs/dollar..the then current rate. the rooms had peeling walls and some mold.

the double room was quite generous and, situated to the rear of the building, not overly affected by street noise. however, since the hotel finish was predominately marble, we did suffer from some in-house disturbance where the occupants above insisted on dragging the furniture around the floor for some reason with resulting clangour a mite irritating.

stayed here for a week but went on tour for 3 days. arranged an airport pick up direct with the hotel via email but no-one was there to meet me on arrival at the airport,so had to haggle an e-mail to get me to hotel at 2.00 in the morning. the next morning when I finally checked in to my room,my initial impressions were that it was cleaner and generally in better state of repair than the one the previous night but it left much to be desired.

we had booked 3 rooms for 3 nights (we were 3 couples travelling together) but when we arrived, we were told one of the rooms had been 'cancelled" by us. we ended up sleeping 3 people to a room. the next day we got our tour group to organise another hotel for us.

the bed sheets and pillow covers were full of stain and were of lowest quality. major drawbacks of this hotel what I have noticed are:1. Location is at a market place. Surrounding area is dirty. hotel rooms are stuffy3. Hotel itself is cramped. no space even for taking sa stroll leisurely4. Breakfast is not at all worth for money5. Staffs are not friendly.

we booked directly with the hotel in 2006 for a one night stay in October. we were offered two free pick ups from the airport - we provided credit card details as security. when we arrived, we was asked to pay for the pickup. the bills were different to the agreed rate, the receptionist tried to charge us more. fortunately we had copies of our correspondence with us.
the Hyatt is a welcome respite from the city. it is the best thing to do in the world - the lavendar bubble bath is lovely!
my room was in the 8th floor, big enough, with fine decoration, flat screen TV, coffee maker, mini bar etc. the bathroom, however, was small, in need of renovation.

the staff were alert, attentive and courteous at all hours day and night, even if my appearance was disheveled after the 15hr flight from Chicago! the quality of food was very good at both - the cafe in particular had a wonderful selection of breakfast items and an open kitchen.

we travelled to this hotel with Cox and Kings as part of a package. the hotel is what I would call business class, it offers high level of service, but at the price! the room was nothing special, the service and food was excellent, although very costly. compared to others on the trip it was extremely expensive.
the lobby is huge, three restaurants, a bar, mini-golf course in the back, nice pool, very safe, rooms were huge and very comfortable, staff was very friendly.

the hotel is drab from the outside, and there isn't much to see or do within walking distance. my biggest complaint would have to be the internet. it was painfully slow, the connection would drop far too much.

the Hyatt website allows you to book everything through it, ranging from airport transportation, spa treatments to a restaurant table. check in at executive level very efficient and friendly, and generally the staff couldn't do enough to accommodate you. I had an early flight the next day, but they arranged breakfast to be set out for me in the Club even though breakfast would open not for another hour.
the Hyatt in new Delhi is light years better...Stay there. the lux rooms wash away the hectic Delhi circusThe buffet breakfast is one of the best I have had.

stayed at Hyatt in Delhi for 2 nights in late august 2009. was on a 2 week trip to india and wanted to finish my vacation in the nice hotel. I found this hotel to be absolutely unacceptable for this price.

I have booked through Jet airways website under the Hotel booking section. check inn was at the club level special desk and it was smooth. the breakfast was very basic english breakfast. rooms are clean and soft bed with wider option of pillows.the best part of the hotel is its restaurants and room dining.

the receptionist suggested to take off spa charges as compensation which i refused as there was nothing wrong with the spa. the charges for the room for two night and the bottle of champagne which should have never been charged as Hotel failed to provide the rooms at decent temp to sleep and still charged for it which was flat. a 3 star hotelAshok UmmatCEO Brook Hotels Ltd. has been in the hotel business for 38 years and this stay in so called 5 star hotels takes the biscuit.
the services of Hotel is supreme, one of the best in Delhi for sure. ii, exteriors and interiors are royal with luxurious comfort.

the staff was very helpful, proffesional and courteous. Ambience and decor was perfect. breakfast was out of the world. Indian, Continental, Asian, fresh fruits and juices and salads all comprised of this breakfast/brunch. Servers were very welcoming.
Very Friendly,Cool & Calm.A great atmosphare for business review.Foods and amp; Room were excellent.

the hotel was not as 'cozy' as the meridien. it was more like an "interview' room - and they wanted 1,000 rupees for an hour to sit at what looked like somebody's desk???I won't be coming back, I'd rather try another Meriden!!

we visited there for Dinner & Stayed in one room for one Room also.....It was excellent stay for our Friends andamp; Management is too Co-operative /cleanliness in Hotel is No. 1....... i was a very good stay - it was great for the staff!
this hotel is a perfect location if you have business meetings in the centre of New Delhi. the restaurant is excellent and specially the Italian restaurant has outstanding value for money.
best hotel i have ever been to, nice staff and nice service. quality of food was also very good, such a delicious food he'sn't eaten in my whole life.

the Huge facade is one of the most recognizable structures of Delhi. it is located in a busy business district and is situated in the city's bustling business districts. palatial lobby and extremely efficeint service. Standard Rooms though feel cramped for space. Multiple choice of good restaurents.

the italian restaurant was excellent. good service. excellent staff. a good location. close to the business district and the airport. nice hotel. very well located business hotel with excellent breakfast.
the room temperature was too warm requested for correction about it and didn't bother to follow up as was tired after a long flight.
the hotel is in the real sense a complete hotel. the comfort level was too good and the staff were friendly enough to give you an unforgetable experience.
hotel provides excellent food. staff was very courteous and friendly. i stayed here for a day for business trip to the u.s.

it is a luxurious property, and I was looking for some Luxurious treatment, to unwind after my gruelling Meetings. despite the fact, there was no bathtub in the room, which left the whole bathroom wet.
this is my second stay in 8 days. my club room has a toilet that flushes badly. I pity the cleaner when he goes around doing his work later today.
the restaurants service was excellent and food was made to order for kids and for us. front office, checkin and regency clun staff is wonderful.

breakfast thopugh overpriced but worth that much much. excellent five star hotel with notable ambience. superb five-star hotel. a great location in the heart of the london. breakfast is superb. good value for money.

this was the only five star hotel that my husband and I stayed at while traveling around India. everything is extemely clean and spotless throughout the hotel. breakfast was included with our room. the servers were also very attentative and there was never a wait for seat.
the property location is great and so is the staff and hospitality. the check-in was great since I was on the club floor... and did not take more than a few minutes.
it was a very pleasant stay at Hyatt during my cousin's wedding in 2007. hotel treated us very cordially.

Hyatt, Delhi is a great property and I love staying here. I had stayed in their property at S'pore and Mumbai as well. the rooms are excellent, coffee shop where the B'fast is served in one of the best, Staff are very cordial, they have great membership programme as also.

well hyatt is one of the most expensive and this trip thus wasnt really value for money. the hotel however has a good indian restaurant and the rooms are ofcourse good and that helps in getting up every day morning every morning fresh from the morning morning.
my husband and I stayed at this beautiful hotel our first night in india! it was a lovely hotel, and was closer to the airport than the downtown hotels. would highly recommend it.
Great bed, The Large LCD TV's are smartly placed. 100% recommended. great bed and comfortable room. good modern and comfy room!

wifi service goes on and off while you are being charged. i ordered food at 10:30pm, was told it will be served in 20 mins, it's now 12:24 am and still no food!!I've just cancelled my stay here and moving myself to another hotel in delhi.

the central reservation desk was friendly and informed us of the various rooms and told us they had avalibility. the lady who made our booking sounded shocked the front desk had refused, she even asked us for the persons name. she said she did that for security reasons???????We were unable to sleep for 2 days due to ongoing CONSTRUCTION.

the hotel is still undergoing major refurbishment which means granite blocks are being machined noisily in the reception, covering everything in dust. hotel staff seemed more keen to look after business events than people staying in hotel, so that pool was closed to 'guests' throughout our stay whilst they catered for weddings and the like! drinks were ridiculously expensive £80 or $150 for a medium range bottle of wine and £12 or $22 for an gin and tonic!

the Hyatt is the closest 5 star hotel to the Delhi Airport, approximately 25 minutes with light Delhi traffic, 15 minutes at 2AM. the concierge can arrange for city tours and to have medications delivered from a local [reputable] pharmacy.

the staff would bend over backwards for you. there were renovations going on but we were well informed and the rooms were clean and tidy. we ate in every restaurant in the hotel and would recommend the 'china kitchen'

i got the room for around 200 dollars/nit for the week of indepence day which was reasonably good. the hotel is very close to the airport and has a good japanese steak house and great coffee house. but for those singles this place does not have nits club.
their service was excellent.all the time they were asking for snax, food,tea etc. they gave me all that with good manner.

our company's team of 9 stayed here for a week. we made good use of the lounge and there was an conference room we reserved for one day of our stay. the food at the club lounge was very good and the italian restaurant was really good. when our group arrived they took our passports and appeared efficient.

the hotel does not disclose that it is undergoing renovations anywhere on its website. it also "mistakenly' charged me for an airport transfer when I did not use a car to pick me up, but was told there was no booking!

recently, stayed in Hyatt Delhi (October 2008) after paying Bomb. reservation was done online, but did not have room as per our requirement reserved.--Reception allots me room which already had guest staying. it was very embarrassing to walk into room with guest sleeping.. next room allotted was not as a requirement, we took it as we were very tired. whole process took 45 minutes. room service staff could not take order properly. once I received order was cold and barely edible.i

the hotel is big and usually full so things are going to happen. a lot of the guests are repeat guests so that says that they are for the most part happy about their experience. they do work hard to make things right if it is brought to their attention that you are not satisfied.

the toillet was blocked and we spent two hours waiting for someone to fix the problem. the breakfast was also an issue if you don't like to have indian food: all pastries looked like have been made a week ago. we got very disappointed since the restaurant looks pretty good (LOOKs only)

we stayed 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency in new Delhi. the hotel was renovated with all the mod cons. they are still the same size as the normal rooms (i.e. not that big). the room cards stopped working on the 2nd day and it took two trips to the front desk to sort them out.
we loved this hotel...Was not inexpensive, but loved everything about it. staff was very pleasant & helpful. breakfast was good.

hotel visit delhi was picked up every morning for work so i really dont know if location is a good one in my opinion there was nothing around or walking distance to see or visitevery restaurant visited was al least 20 minutes by carinside the hotel was perfect.

this was my second time at the Hyatt Regency in Delhi - the first time was two years ago. this time I stayed a week and I have to say that everything was nearly perfect, nice room, comfortable bed, good restaurants and good service. the gym is pleasant and although the hotel was packed there were always enough machines.

in Delhi we selected the Hyatt Regency, it's expensive. the gold Passport room was smaller, unclean, dirty and lacked furnishings. food and drinks are good, but room is average, not worth the USD. we were advised by friends to stay in 5 Star Deluxe hotels while in India, good input... your hotel will be your sanctuary.
the Hyatt in New Delhi is a very TIP happy place which bugs me but at the same time I am already their so I want to enjoy my voyage.
this hotel has an excellent standing. The restaurant are good for India. our oom at the top floor was very well furbished and we had a warm welcome.

this was not the best welcome to India. the service was pretty disorganized, and the location was out of the action of india. it meant having to negotiate public transport and taxis, not easy in this place! rooms were okay, but nothing special. i'd choose somewhere else next time.

the food as always is good, the rooms are pleasant (although can be cold) and the complimentary water is much appreciated. the staff are very helpful on the whole, although a little slow in the restuarant.

the hotel made our stay in Delhi a worthwhile experience; check in was easy and the rooms average until we found that our friends were in newer plush rooms on the same floor whilst our rooms were the old style. the room service was excellent; as was the health club with new equipment - elliptical crosstrainers and treadmills with integrated TV monitors.

the hotel is, of course, not really walking distance from anything. the entry and lobby are very nice, check in is easy, staff is excellent. The rooms are great, the bathroom large, and the amenities plentiful. breakfast is delicious and loaded with options. Do NOT miss out on the italian restaurant. I just got back from Italy a couple of months ago.
great club room. nice buffet in the evening and breakfast at the club loungeVery good spa with the best ayurvedic massage I've had in india! the staff is wonderful staff.

the service in the hotel is really great and extremely attentive. my friend and I ate in TK's which is an asian restaurant - we both rated it extremely high. the food and service were perfect. it was far too hot for me to sunbathe by the pool, but I can only assume the swimming service is as good as ever.
the hotel was a club room up on the 6 th floor and it was very good. the food is worth the price one pays to stay here.Strongly recommend.

the hotel is set between the city centre and the international airport. on first arrival I thought the outside was nothing special but the welcoming lobby was first class. the restaurant is excellent and whilst I was there the Hotel was adding a new Chinese restaurant.

the service at the Hyatt is great but, not worth the $300/night price. our room had a door to an adjoining room through which everything could be heard. so, during our last nights stay the person in the other room decided to watch TV at 3am and we were woken up.

our flight was late out of Taiwan and the staff at the airport was really helpful, especially since we had two small children. we went on a tour of Northern India the next day and stayed in the hotel again on our way out from the u.s.

the Hyatt Regency hotel had a smaller % of Indian food in the buffet. some people checking in on the night I left were paying $500 and were complaining loudly and boorishly. my boss and I paid $300/night in peak tourist season. if you like to stick to traditional Western food, there's plenty of it.

my room was quite large with plenty of room around my king bed. when I called the front desk to complain, they sent up a space heater that worked fine. the concierge brought up several packages and helped me pack them. given my extra baggage, I was concerned that I might not be able to check in everything. if it was not for him, the Hyatt representative met me at the airport and walked me through the check-in process.
the staff met my requests just fine. I found my room a bit small, but comfortable and I slept well.reception is large, modern and light and the room is very comfortable.

reviewers haven't stayed at 5 star hotels internationally. the hotel is not within walking distance of shopping, but most foreigners would not want to walk in Delhi anyway. there is a camp of homeless living under tarps across the street, and cows roam the streets.

my wife and we stayed at the Hyatt Regency the night of July 31. we paid a bit over $200 for the room, and the hotel pick-up was efficient. breakfast and lunch in the coffee shop were very good. the staff were friendly and professional, allowing us to retrieve them from the lobby staff who found them and put them into the lost and found.

the rooms are very, very old. they have not updated in the basic components such as electrical plugs and the ac, let alone the furnishing. all this would be ok except that they are charging $200. not worth this at all all. i always stay at Hyatt's as the name usually guarantees 'a standard standard'.
for $300+ you would expect that you'd get the room you reserve (King, non-smoking). instead I got a smoking room and two twin beds pushed together.

hotel manager told him what was going on in his hotel. he and his team took immediate action to ensure that the remainder of our evening in Delhi was as enkoyable as possible and that we would try this place again next time we visited. the manager genuinely seems to want to sort it out.

the hotel is quite close to the centre - the lobby feels like a train station. the staff were all very polite and helpful with all my queries and requests, but bags took long time to get to my room and then get loaded into the taxi on departure.

the buffet breakfast was included in my rate, and was a nice way to start the day. by day three, the waiters new I liked ketchup and tabasco and would have both waiting for me upon my arrival for breakfast. the rooms were small, but were clean and nicely appointed.

this hotel is a joke. out of date product in the mini-bar, rude staff, slow restaurants, expensive drinks, poor transportation, small rooms, ancient bathrooms and basic at that. Wouldn't advise even considering it!!
the hotel was a wonderful break in our travels and I would recommend it. recommend upgrading to the club level for the best experience!

the service is worse than what you get in a 2 star hotel. Not worth the money.Staff in Delhi Hyatt are inefficient and extremely rude! they do not know how to treat their customers. they need to be fully trained to work at the front desk!

the staff were good, expect the driver (night) failed to turn up to pick up from the airport. the hotel has a day driver - quick and street smart- that helped. Near the tube/ metro. Draby place with no frills but reflects the price, you should not pay more than 1200 to 1500 rupees including all taxes.
everything it's ok. Room, bathroom, the staff. Good place and good people. they help you with a smile on their faces.

the airport pickup guy had to wait 2 hours for our late plane - no problem, he was there and we connected easily. the hotel is right within easy walking distance to shopping as well as to the (excellent) subway station. (subway costs 8 roepies one way)
stayed in a budget hotel called Indraprastha at Karol Bagh. the hotel is situated on Tank Road nestled between Ajmal Khan Road and Gurdwara Road. right next to it is the Bengal Sweet Center.

we arrived and checked in at the hotel late after a delicious meal at Bukhara. our first impression was it was dark (poorly lit) and looked old. the check-in staff were efficient and friendly. however, the rooms were damp, old and tired, and not particularly clean either. it is definitely not the usual standards expected from previous stays in Intercontinental hotels worldwide.

the rooms I chose were newly renovated room which was a smoking room. but it was really brand new & so there was no smoke smell whatsoever. the facilities at the hotel are excellent. great pool, good restaurants and the spa/sauna/gym are good. I also have to highly rate the people in the business centre.

I was told there are no other rooms available for room change. the corridors were full of smell and dust because of repair work. we were left without electricity for an hour and when only I went to reception they sent a person to repair it. I did not know that this discount are my priorty club points.Because of this I had to change the hotel and opt for Le Meridien Delhi.

check in was quick and efficent and was taken to our room. the breakfast spread was a mix of cultures, Indian, English, American etc etc, which kept all the family happy! internet access and printing was fairly cheap, and the staff were extremly helpful.
this is an average hotel, definitely not a 5 star. the rooms were ok, but the bath room was bad, needs renovation, the reviews stated.
Nice hotel, good service, four restaurant and night club, wonderful was the barber shop with head massage. relaxing relaxing was a great place to relax.

it's never too full of non-Indian tourists which I always find encouraging. the locals often come to the restaurants to each which i see as a plus point. they are starting renovation process and are promising 'a much better hotel - I just hope it doesn't lose its Delhi charm'

IC-Nehru Place is an excellent business hotel with a convenient location with easy access to domestic airport as well as to Noida. rooms are outdated with stained carpets but they make it up with good amenities and space.

the word 'InterContinental' conjures up images of luxury and service. despite an e-mail request, no airport transfer wasn't waiting for me at Nehru Place, the clerk simply blamed me, without actually looking into the matter. only after providing proof, they sort-of said they were sorry. the duty manager could reluctantly be persuaded to be core courteous.

I booked two rooms in this hotel at the end of June but didn't find hotel as per 5 Star Standard. we were upgraded to Club room category & we got access to Lounge as well but really surprised we did not find Good brand drinks in Lounge.Anyways,I find this as average kind of hotel.

this is a magnificent hotel, right in the heart iof Delhi's CBD Connaught Place/Barakhamba road. rooms are elegantly decorated, refurbished, with transparent bathroom sections, cozy beds and business friendly gadgets.
I stayed this hotel for my business trip, rooms & dinning given good atmosphere and feels like a home.
the staff are excellent, and breakfast is good. the a/c in Blooms Restaurant is set to maximum chill in the evening - and the noise of this travels through the structure from 8 to 7 p.m. 7/7.
good place warm welcome nice rooms,good food.healthy atmosphere.overall great place to stay if you dont know the place well.
staff is very hospitable, good food and very comfortable rooms. guests are provided with a range of dining options, serving delicious east and spicy Indian as well as Chinese delicacies.
it was not only a matter of happiness but also pride infront of the foreigners, to have kept them and getting them to give us business.

very good business hotel at the heart of the new Delhi city. ciaoronak hotel is a great hotel in the city of london. it is very close to the nidir city and the best city centre. very nice hotel with excellent staff and friendly staff.
good value for money if your business is in the Nehru Place of South Delhi area. a good hotel, good price for the money.

in a city where you can pay extortionate prices for the pretty grim here at least is an reliable - indeed, at times, luxurious way of spending. public parts particularly well appointed and the food in the restaurant delicious.

I did my booking with one of Travel Agent for this hotel.Hotel Lobby is good,Restaurants are good.But Rooms are not so good - but breakfast was too good with lots of items.even I didn't like the services of hotel.

the hotel entrance is grand, has all the facilities of a 5 star, rooms have pool views, very quiet, lovely food in the buffet restaurant. ideal for the airport, nearly 30 minutes drive. Definately stay when I visit Delhi again.

the property is a typical city hotel - large and impersonal (which is good when you are on business!) the staff are very courteous and the rooms are spic and span. they are one of the few hotels which provide toileteries including shaving kit and toothbrush and toothpaste.
the worst experience ever had in india, the hotel staff member are least bothered abt there guest.wld never recommend to visit itz a horrible experience.
Intercontinental Eros is in the city center and has a very convenient locaiton. rooms are spacious and elegantly laid out.
a brilliant hotel, I always stay here when I am in Delhi. in the middle of the city, affordable price and great food...

the hotel is nice. rooms are comfortable and the dinings options are good. the room can do with some renovation - although it was clean and well maintaned, it wasn't the typical contemporary room that one has come to expect from 5-star hotels located in metros.

2 Hr complimentary internet internet is a great place to stay. great rooms and discounted rates...what else would you want..... 2 hr free internet : great prices and affordable rates - great deals and cheap rates.

the hotel is tired inside and out and in a second class location. the club lounge was well below my expectation and the rooms are old-fashioned. there are much better Delhi hotels including the Lalit which was Intercontinental until recently!!
the hotel is reminicent of a run-down westworld from the Yul Brynner 1973 film. the view out the huge windows bypasses the built up commercial areas and looks onto green patch of Delhi.

the breakfast buffet served food of the highest quality featuring local and international cuisine. the gym was busy in the morning with serious health buffs so that tells you the equipment is good.there's a market across the street in which everything from electronics to used clothes are sold.

the hotel is located in the south-east of the city, about 25 minute drive from the centre. taxis are very cheap, however if you want a bit of luxury, it offers reasonable prices for half day and full day rates for their cars and drivers, which are the Honda City, the Toyota Camry or the Audi A4.

stayed in two club rooms which were extremely comfortable. the club room included comforter, a spacious bathroom and top of the line bathroom amenities. we also had access to the Club Lounge which was the best Club lounge I have been to in India. our experience with the concierge who went out of his way to help us with future travel plans to Agra.

the hotel is stuck in time 15 years ago in more ways than one. the carpets smell musty, the decor is jaded and the staff seems bored and even the supposed traditional Indian welcome seems contrived...the breakfast is the standard buffet you can expect in such a hotel. no surprises or shocks. Yes the location is very convenient to check out Delhi.

we were there 3 days/2 nights found it to be a great place to sleep, eat, meet, work and relax. it was also very easy to operate from, to get in and out of, for getting to the places we wanted to go to.

great hotel, great facilities there, allways ready to help, less time consuming services and great food. great hotels, excellent facilities, good food and excellent food. a great location, saver - great breakfast and good breakfast.
the 24-hour fitness facility is well equipped with treadmills, ellipticals and stairmasters. the hotel does offer a driver service for pick-up and drop-off at the airport for about Rs.2,200.
the intercontinental is the hotel chain to stay at in india. the service is impeccable at this hotel. The second you walk in someone holds the door for you and you are served some fresh guava juice.

i like the services of this hotel coz we have already operated one chartered plain Qantas of 220 peoples. thanks to CHEERSPrince9899000220 - the hotel was good from front office bell desk to sales person...thanks to the cheersprince 98989990001202 saa tssy!
the bathroom a little tired with cracked plastic bath and loose electric switch hanging from the wall. good service, friendly but not imposing staff, room high standard but room low standard.

this hotel is absolutely fabulous...Very Grand and the service is brilliant. the moment you walk into the hotel, you are transferred into a frenzy of senses, smell, sound, sight - all very authentic and indian, beutiful insence etc etc...you cannot go wrong with this Hotel, though it is far out from the city!
staff are the best i have ever experienced. nothing was too much trouble. rooms were clean and functional, flat screen TV, desk, refrigerator. internet connection was expensive (200Rps per hour).
we have just returned from two over night stays at this hotel. staff very good- competent and charming. food at breakfast and in Indian restaurant good. Rooms quite spacious and clean.
this hotel was the friendliest and best appointed hotel of our trip. the evening buffet was super - especially the chef's made to order dosa!
we arrived into Delhi for a couple of days relaxation before our tour of Northern India & Tiger Safari. we stayed again at the end of the tour just to wind down before the return home to the UK.
this hotel was booked for us by a travel agent. the hotel is beauitful and the rooms are excellent, exactly what you would expect from 5 star hotel.

the hotel is very clean and modern and the pool area is large and pleasant. I did not come across any construction or renovation at the Intercontinental hotel. the staff is professional and adequate. The hotel had a couple restaurants with various chinese, indian and international selections.

very clean hotel with lots of marble and modern design. Small shopping centre nearby. Mostly Indian food with small choice of international dishes.We stayed for 2 nights which was about right., not a hotel for longer stays.
Nice Hotel but in a single room you never sleep along, as hotel is being restructured, mice run around rooms, good luck.

stayed at this hotel for a total of 3 hours and couldn't stand it anymore. they charged Inr12,000 plus 1,625 luxury tax and the internet was 800 + 100 VAT + service tax 99 so the total bill inr14,623 or US$365 for three hours.

Hong Kong hotel is 20 out of 10, this one is 0. room is so old and tired no life in it carpet carpet had stains on itbed is sagging no shower in the bathroom, have to stand in shower which has paint peeling off then at night when the next room flush the toilet it wake you up. will next time go back to another hotel again if you stay in a new hotel - it's the best place to stay!
the buffet on Sundays is fantastic. there are several parts to it with salads, hot food, desserts and cheeses.there is always a chocolate fountain on the dessert table which is delicious.
my credit card had been charged TWICE for my stay. I settled my bill in full when I left, and that charge was on my statement, dated a few days later. the hotel double-charged me.

the hotel is so beautiful and sparkling clean with fantastic service and food. it is just the management and front desk personnel that are a problem in this hotel. the service in the restaurants and the room attendants is fantastic.

my wife and I stayed a couple nights at the Intercontinental Nehru Place. the hotel is not cheap (around $230 after taxes), but it's nice, quiet and comfortable for our guests to stay in the midst of an expensive trip in Rajasthan. Delhi is expensive, and hotels are often poor value.
we lost about 20minutes to find the phone calls, and they charge me some calls not completed. i hope next time stay in other place more thurst.

India is expensive currently as there is a shortage of good quality hotel rooms. this hotel costs similar amount to some much poorer properties in New Delhi perhaps 20% more but worth the investment investment.

a smoking room in this hotel was cleaned quite well. the staff found the room and brought it to me and showed me how to wrap the sari! the food from the “coffee shop” was outstanding. I ate almost all Indian food and it was great, plus the service was excellent.
superb staff, clean and efficient, great restaurants. Not quite so central but you always use taxi anyway and it is a price worth paying for this real quality.
I was knocked out by the service standards of the first hotel I stayed in. they have this system where you dial "9' for any requests, this links them to their 'Instant Help Center'

stay at this property twice, and had a fabulous stay both times. on our first stay, we arived after midnight, yet it seemed that the entire staff came out to greet us in an receiving line. the suite was immaculate and rollaway beds were made up for the children. both bathrooms were supplied with every imaginable amenity.

the front desk at this hotel is terrible. they don't know what they are doing. I booked thru Orbitz and my reservation was fully paid for before I arrived. i even brought the receipts with me when I went to check out, they told them to call orbitz, and they insisted on taking my credit card.

this hotel is beautiful and opulent, as you would expect of a hotel of this price range and class. the rooms are lovely, furnished well and with super bathroom (see uploaded photos). my parent’s room smelled of smoke but they were given an non-smoking room when they asked to change so no problem there.

we stayed at this hotel on the last leg of the package, which was our next-to-last night in India. the hotel made up for the hassles and substandard facilities that I had to endure prior to checking into the IC. it's a nice business-class hotel, and I thought it was tourist-friendly as well, although most other guests there were on business.
I stayed at intercontinetal in december 2006. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to delhi.Only drawback is distance from the international airport which is about 45-60 minutes drive.

our trip to agra was fantastic - our tour company collected us from the hotel and physically put us in our first class train seats. the business centre is very good, but they do charge you for internet use. it was not very expensive. we would definately stay here again.

a helpful airport employee called the Hotel & put us in touch with the front desk. the hotel stated that they didn't have any flight or arrival information so could not send an car. we waited another 30 minutes for another driver to pick us up, and of course were charged for it.

was in Delhi for an extended time over the summer and decided to splurge for a weekend. the wrong set of keys were sent up and when the right set came they got stuck in the door for some time. staff are desperately in need of some training. finally, got it open after 15 minutes waiting outside our room.

this year due to sheer convenience I once again stayed at this hotel. the hotel's standard services are still the same one expects from every 5 star hotel, but it was the little things they did that made time there so great. i tried their chinese restaurant this time...I was thrilled by the authentic cuisine put together by an actual chef from East Asia.
the front desk staff need a better attitude to customer service and to actually do what they say they will do. the rooms are good, and clean: I've stayed in both the Club rooms and one of the Suites.

the manager at the reception with red tie offered me a complimentary juice and welcomed me back home. the staff were nice and the rooms were old but well maintained - there is noice travelling from outside if you want to eat in the car or go to the taxii. i was really tired and wanted to keep away from normal formality.

stayed for 3 days. Room service excellent. some reception staff very cool,some get very stressed. one person didnt have a clue and treated us. 24 hour restaurant -you can still see flies allover. music too loud for conversation.

we had 2 rooms for 3 days during an off-peak season. our price was quite good (6580 Rupees plus tax) but in the heat of summer, you'd expect a top hotel to apologize profusely, refund your room or offer another room, or something similar. the thermostats and climate control systems were old, but most of the hotel facilities had been updated.
warm and cozy rooms, plush interiors, nice service and tasty food. good connectivity for business and tour planner available in the hotel. a good breakfast and good value for the price paid.
we were made very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. the hotel is very plush and elegant it still had that comfy feeling. a lovely hotel - the staff was very nice and cosy.

the hotel is designed with class and ambience. Had meals in quite a few of the restaurants and all of them were superb. even tried the Bill Clinton meal in one! it's pretty big and can keep 3 people happily fed!

the hotel was so cramp it was the worst room out of all the other hotels we stayed in. the dublin bar was ok but didnt offer us a apology, it is the last night of our holiday and worst. i cant understand why we were thererecommended to stay looking back on the holiday.
the only place u can eat good food 24/7. the hotel is one of the nicest hotels in the city. great partys, lots of young people, and the perfect place to ate good foods 24/7.

the hotel security appears to be high because of other events in the country. the only downside is the large number of AA and Finnair flight crews do monopolize the business center computers periodically during the day. i plan on staying at the ITC Maurya in New Delhi.

my father and I stayed at the Maurya when in india last month. the hotel has a deluxe room with twin beds, but with separate duvets, it wasn't the problem. i ate several meals at this hotel, and the Bukhara is an old tradition of mine and yes, while it may be sometimes erratic in quality, I still love it. my standard order is the leg of lamb, daal and naan.
i stayed at this hotel, booked from the internet, all though december is high season. the rooms are large and comes with all mod cons of five star hotel.

the most famous resutrant in this hotel is bukhara and dal bhukara is the delicacy. the other side is a beautiful swimming pool, which i feel is not good enuf to swim but to just lie and soother your nerves)

hotel rooms are very well decorated, very clean and trendy. food at the main restaurant was really outstanding. staff was great with little delays for the check out. the hotel is an excellent place to stay in DELHI.
every 5* hotel in india is amazing. food and bars very good and very entertaining. well worth a visit. if they didn't have something that you wanted, they would get it for you.

wake up call automated service didn't work properly. hotelkeeping department should be focused on small things, placed in room, not to be missed. there should've been discrepance on ameneties in separete rooms.-they advertise Executive lounge but one is not in funcion.

this 5 star hotel is located in the green diplomatic enclave. the hotel has most features you would expect like a swimming pool and spa and has numerous top notch restaurants. however you can't go wrong by staying here.

stayed here for 5 nights in July for business in a quite part of the town (Diplomatic Enclave)+ Large, clean rooms with good amenities. great restaurant selection and food, although expensive (especially the alcohol)

I stayed at the Maurya Sheraton in 1984. it was beautiful and one could really experience Indian culture. I took a cab in every day to be with friends in Vijay Nagar. the whole trip was an exotic paradise.
this was the same hotel Bill Clinton chose to stay during his visit to India. it is surrounded by one of the greenest places in Delhi.
the rooms were spacious and very clean. the hotel is a little way from the sights - short cab ride its well worth to sometimes escape and be in an relaxing environment..
the best is the indian food restaurant- bukhara. overall food is exceptional in the hotel. a great property is well located. good location is close to the iia - st t..
the stay was very good overall, but restaurants in the hotel are quite expensive. on my arrival day, I needed cash for the day after and reception send their car to take me to nearest ATM.

the room's warm colors give you a sense of peace and comfort, especially at the end of an arduous day2. each room has its own mini-bar - stocked with the best alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks3.The swimming pool was large and very well maintained4. There was rich variety in food.

the hospitality is great - you are in a special world right from the time that the doorman greets you. the rooms are lovely and the offers like the trip to the Taj Mahal are really well thought-through. I love the shopping arena in the hotel which is open at unearthly hours for the last-minute shopper.
the food in the chinese was exp and ok. the room was big but didn't care much for it. Wouldn’t return.
one of good hotels in New-Delhi.Excellent location.Nearby to India Gate. located near to all Embassies.

the ITC Maurya has all the facilities (gym, pool, spa) that you will need to feel comfortable. the hotel taxis will try to tout you and ask you if they can stay and wait for you at your destination. sometimes it's cheaper to walk onto the street and grab and auto rickshaw.

it is a very good hotel to stay with I liked it as its half way from airport and the CP. the hotel has very modern looks of rooms, the staff is very prompt, and every minute details is taken care off when you stay at them.
the modern looks make it truly on par with any other 5 star hotel room across the world. the food is expensive but they do have good room service.
this is one of the most happening hotels in India, Speedy, efficient service. excellent location in the Diplomatic Enclave. a great coffee shop. nice location.
the hotel ambience is fantastic. the room was good and the breakfast buffett was great. it was an overnight stay for me and I really liked everything about the hospitality which it provided.
the experience at Maurya was bad to say the least.It looked like a cheap hotel which hasn't been maintained for ages.

Hotel Mourya is crown of historic city of Delhi. during business stay they provide all luxury and comforts which really miss in other place. good food and warmth service are the tool which fetch you again and again in hotel Mouya..
the BEST HOSPITALITY never found anywhere else in the world. it is one of the best hotels in Delhi with positive vibes and always look lively.
the best part of my stay at ITC was that they never let me feel that i was away from my home and looked after my comforts. I was so happy to stay with the staff and their staff was a pleasure..

Maurya hosts one of india's first discotheques. service is speedy, efficient & courteous. food at all the restaurants is great.- my Humble House is extremely quaint and dainty. Terrific coffee at the bar. great location..
hotel staff were always professional and helpful, without being obseqious and hungry for tips as they are in some Delhi hotels. I would definitely come back to the Maurya as I got a very good rate.

i stayed in couple of excellent hotels in & out of India. but when you enter the huge central Pavilion from front porch, you can't stop looking at bright lighting and gold finish elevator doors.Once inside your room, your dream walk to luxury continues with sparking clean interiors, 32 inches LCD TV, cozy bed, and variety of fruits, snacks available at your disposable.
it was offical conference organised by my organisation. it included introduction to PDMS etc. It was a full day conference with deligates from wide variety of industries.

the hotel was classy and the service was excellent. seems like ITC Maurya is 'the' hangout of celebrities and VVIPs in New Delhi. the only disappointed was an extra bed that we had asked for, which collapsed in the middle of the night while we were sleeping.

I chose my usual 500 Starpoints welcome amenity which helps build up my points for future redemptions. check-in is always in the same style as other Starwood properties where staff greet their guests with warmth and in style that reflects all starwood Hotels.

my husband has stayed at the Maurya Sheraton more than 25 times. the architecture, Interiors and Rooms are beautifully designed and the hotel is meant for the creme de la crème, but the mural dome in the lobby witnesses hundreds of business meetings,people who just come here to have a meeting and then move on!

the Maurya Sheraton excels in fulfilling this perquisite by a mile. every member of the staff is helpful, kind, compassionate & cheerful. they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and comfortable.
the food tastes so delicious here at this restaurant that people should be careful not to eat their own fingers!!. this is what I call dining in style... it's an awesome Mughal Experience...!

we spent 3 nights there while on a wedding ceremony in Delhi & Kathmandu. staff is professional and very keen to help you. many nice details, i.e. room staff can see from outside if room is occupied, there is european plug on the desk, no need for adapters! food is excellent, though we only had breakfast from the huge buffet and one dinner - all other nighs we were out of the hotel.

excellent, Fabulous and Magnificent.. Amazing food in Bukhara restaurant. it is one of the poshest restaurant of new Delhi - a restaurant in the city of san francisco. most foreign country ministries stay there during their visit to India. hotel is landmark of luxury.

the service is impeccable and totally reliable - pleasant and courteous staff go out of their way to make your stay a memorable one. the hotel does not overcharge for items such as the internet or the laundry (compared to other 5+ star hotels around the world).
it is one of the most comforting hotes with nice rooms and excellent food. it always nice to come and visit the hotel.
check-in process delayed my schedule by nearly an hour. hotel also houses the famed Bukhara and Dum Pukt restaraunts, the best known in india.
maurya's d best hotel Ive visisted so far. the ambience was awesome, the food sumptuous..services were prompt.

the hotel has hosted some of the world famous dignitarties including Bill Clinton. the massage chair, the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom and the music system are my favourites and I would recommend the ITC One rooms as they are an experience in themselves.I also enjoyed the food at Bukhara and entertaining a few clients there for business has provded helpful.

the Bhukara is the best in india. good loyalty program, the welcomaward. Happy hours at the Towers lounge is worth mentioning as excellent. personalised services. excellent food is of the highest qualtiy.

hotel upgraded me - I was glad. the upgraded room was wonderful. I particularly liked the massage chair in the room and the music system. i like the hotel's relative closeness to the airport.Would definitely recommend this for your next Delhi visit.
this hotel property is a great place to go to with friends or business guests for the food at Buhkara. recommend the stay to anyone who wants to be close to the great food in Mauyra.

the hotel is located near the posh diplomatic area of New Delhi and hence is in relatively verdant and peaceful surroundings. a good workout before or after meal at one of these places is recommended.
the front office staff were extremely courtious & their 'namaste' welcome with their smiles takes out all your stress.

all five star hotels in india are majestic and oversized. the main area of the hotel is a great place to stay in the iTC tower. all 5 star hotel in India are luxurious and majestic - this is no exception. only drawback is constant problems with internet access.Bhukara and Dhum Pukt are v. expensive but excellent restaurants. Bfast is average.

stayed in the Murya for several reasons. the hotel is a good hotel mainly because of its level of service. it also hosts many conferences, seminars as well as receives dignities from around the world.

stayed here one night for business in the Towers section of the hotel. enjoyed the Dublin Bar happy hour with co-workers from 6-8 PM - they kept on serving free onion rings, chicken fingers, nuts and even a "Clinton's special'

the rooms at this hotel were great. I had booked 2 rooms but when I arrived at the hotel, only 1 of them was ready. most of the staff were salivating for tips. they greet you hypocritically hoping that you'll drop a tip in their direction. i think it would be better to stay in the Sheraton in Saket which is cheaper as well as newer.

stayed in towers room which was a little small but the quality of the room and elec toys made up for it. massive flat screen tv. great hotel overall, good choice of restaurants, make sure you visit the Bukhara Restaurant, amazing food.

the hotel had some visiting dignitary and made your arrival seem like it was an inconvenience. after requesting a "non-smoking room, I returned back down to the reception and finally I was put in an unused gym room.

hotel looks spectacular and seems to be a favourite of Delhi's rich and famous. staff very friendly and efficient. Afterwards I can recommend the laundry service that makes your shirt look better than new!

stayed at the Executive Level in a newly renovated room. good size room with stable internet connection. Nice bathroom with glass separation to the bedroom.Very nice touch by room assistant who added personal touch to housekeeping.

the hotel is the preferred residence of visiting heads of state and global business leaders for over 25 years", it should be better. the towers Club staff are great, as are the poolside staff; the renovated rooms are a great improvement, especially as the windows now fit...
the hotel is not an easy walk from any shops or restaurants. it is a superb hotel although expensive by any country's standards.
stayed for 1 night in the hotel for a recent business trip. was booked in deluxe suite paying hefty USD630 per night - the most expensive hotel I have stayed in.

stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of March. the room was clean, the bed was very comfortable with supersoft pillows (my description, guests can choose from a choice of different pillows if they wish).
I went to new Delhi on a business trip and enjoyed my time at the Maurya. I sat in the lobby waiting on an associate and really enjoyed the live piano player and his'show tunes'

the hotel staff was very nice and were very eagar to help. it's one of the nicest hotels in India and it doesn't compare to a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons but it is isolated in the diplomatic enclave and you need an driver to take you around.

I stayed in the main Maurya hotel from 1/13 to 1/22/08. I had booked the room on the internet and checked in was very smooth. room was turned over twice a day. bathroom/showers and closet areas were excellent. breakfast buffet was included in price [$450]

the Starwoods in India make a Platinum guest feel appreciated. the hotel features two restaurants featured in the Thousand Things to Do Before You Die book. we tried Dum Puhkt and it was great but we were so sleepy we may not have fully appreciated it.
we did go back for dinner at Bukhara, and it was one of the best Indian meals we have ever had anywhere in the world. the rooms were nicely decked out but a little small.

the lobby is very nice.Executive rooms were very good (not very big though).Main restaurant is nice place to have lunch or dinner.Even the bar/pub was nice and happened to be a very popular place for the local youngsters.

we stayed here twice each for one night during out stay in india. we frequented both bars in the hotel and the Irish themed bar was dark and dingy but surprisingly appeared to be the more exclusive of the two bars. the best part about this hotel however is the Bukhara tandoori restaurant.

our room was called a Garden View Deluxe suite and was the size of two hotel rooms. the hotel was clean, luxurious, and hospitable. rooms were modern (flat screen Plasma TVs), luxurious bedding, fantastic air conditioning, & free from any odors even though smoking is common in hotels in india. some of our colleagues at the conference stayed at Taj Palace and the Taj Mahal Mansingh.
this was definitely one of the best rooms we had in India. the buffet is also very good. a great experience here. great, updated room with great bathroom.
the restaurant is surviving on business travellers with nowhere else to go. their terrible service, average food and expensive prices would make sure they close down fast!

reviewers have emphasized that the hotel seems to be overpriced. however, despite the prices, I had no complaints with the hotels. the room was clean with a very comfortable bed, service was acceptable, and breakfast buffet was serviceable.
a flat panel TV (37 in?) and several English cable channels were available. breakfast buffet (included with room) is really good. great selection (Indian and Western)

the room rate was nearly $500/night and, in my opinion, quite overpriced. I have stayed in hotels in Europe, the united states, and other parts of the world at the same room rates where the hotels were much more luxurious.

we chose Meriden for our first night and then Sheraton for the 2 separate stays we planned during our golden triangle tour. we were travelling back from Amritsar on a late train and phoned the hotel to arrange pick-up at the train station. he speedily packed all 4 suitcases in the car and got us there in quick time.
stayed on the refurbed 4 th floor - the Bakhara restaurant is in top 35 restaurants in the world. the tandoor lamb is fantastic! great room, nice environment, staff very helpful! would go back!

the staff at the Maurya Sheraton were so helpful to us in our little crisis. they went so above and beyond for us, advising us on the steps necessary to get our act together - -1st, going to the US Embassy, and then the Indian Tourism Bureau...and made it onto our flight with our emergency 1-year passport and the exit visa stamp. we spent quite a while lounging around the lobby and it was very pretty with murals that remind me of Orozco or Diego Rivera in
the hotel is close to the airport and not more than 15 minutes by auto rickshaw from the center of town and the railway station (convenient if you're taking a day trip to Agra)

i was on business w/ friend; he has very expensive tastes. but my 1 night was $500. ouch. great room, nice interior, outside is sort of ugly, but who cares.Free breakfast (omlette...maybe best ich've ever had)Only complaint is the $15 internet fee; miserly when you pay that much to get nickle and dimed.

I booked this hotel on their website and stayed for 8 days in Jan. 07. the booking process was not without glitches. I had booked the hotel at the last moment(big mistake) and had no choice because of the lack of availability of more moderately priced hotels.
the hotel has three separate divisions, the regular rooms, Tower rooms and the ITC One rooms. the staff was wonderful and went out of their way to make us feel like royalty.
