stay at this hotel for the 3rd time this year due to a conference at the hotel. it's difficult to work out for long time as there is almost no air conditioning in the gym.

the hotel is really three connected hotels - the Executive Tower, the Club Tower and the ITC One Club. rooms in the executive tower are very small, and were noisy during my last visit due to construction.

this hotel was excellent in some areas and unsatisfactory in others. the hotel staff will cater to your every need. most of the staff you will encounter speak English and are very polite. Supposed to stop at 7pm, but that's not true.
in the winter of 2005-6, my wife and I stayed at the Maurya Sheraton on 3 separate occasions. the club was a bit cheaper ($275.00US) and we were lucky to get the newly renovated 12th floor.

this was my first trip to India and my 4 night stay was a very good experience. the purpose of the trip was business and the desk and chair in the relatively spacious room on the third floor had good reception for the wireless internet connection.

if the Maurya qualifies as 5 star, I would give this place close to a 4 star (3.5 would probably fit the bill perfectly). the hotel's location is very central, with hardwood floors, plasma TVs, and marble bathrooms. -great bakery. lots of U.S. style cakes and pastries, but reasonably priced (also 1/2 price after 8pm).
the hotel's proximity to the Connaught Place by 3kms has made it a preferred stay option for both leisure and business travellers.
amazing is the word.. wonderful hotel, wonderful ambience and wonderful staff. what a place..a treat for everybody!. marvellous hotel and great staff!

hotel Siddharth is one of Comfortable Hotels. the hotel has almost all the required facilities like Swimming Pool, Doctor On call and the most thing i liked about it is the comfortability and quality of food and ofcourse the service they provide is very quick.

we were travelling with a tour party and had read reviews. the foyer was modern and welcoming, reception was efficient and our room on the second floor was clean and comfortable. staff were helpful and efficient. location of the hotel is never going to win prizes but was fairly close to the sights of New and Old Delhi. outside swimming pool closed for major refurbishment, just as well as the weather was unseasonably cold.

this is my first time in India and we went to walk the Gift Show. our travel agent tried to book several mid-priced hotels for us for $300 USD per night, which is still quite high for what we thought we would have to pay for a mid hotel in india. the hotel was clean and I had no problems using the towels or sleeping in the bed.

the first room they put us in really had a strong stench from smoking. the second room was better and we were pretty tired so we just put up with it. we then discovered that the fridge didn't work and the kettle did not work.

the city park hotel is under renovation and you had to access the elevator from the next level (not fun with suit cases). the air condition did not work all of the time throughout the entire building. the hotel was doing construction on the patio until 8pm.

some rooms are still not renovated, look like 15-20 years old, but it doesn't mean that they charge you less if they put you in such a room...the aircondition seems to be an absolute must, only arctic temperatures seem acceptable for their guests.

I was firstly given a room with an interconnecting door. you can hear your neighbours nocturnal noises etc. Had to sleep one night and then we were given the room on the fifth floor after complaining. even more disgusting...bathrooms were dirty...fixtures on wall were old and dusty. by no standards it can be called 4 star! for the price they charge it is definitely not worth it. I hope readers of this review will never stay in any of the Jaypee hotels as the

the room we had was refurbished and extremely nice with flat screen tv and waterfall shower. the view out the window was terrible - construction. no double beds were available. our friends tried to get some, but were moved back the next night. be warned about the construction! it begins at about 8am and proceeds to about 9pm.

a man occupying the desk at the hotel is useless and rude. he showed such indifference to my query that it was unbelievable. his bedroom was fine - comfortable and clean. I noted no smells anywhere. Better/double glazed windows might be good to keep out the noise from the street below.

you can stay at a much nicer hotel for the price they charge. the smell, are small, and the staff is rude. there was construction going on when i stayed. hotel also gave us trouble about the complementary taxi to the airport. Would definately not suggest.

we stayed at this hotel for one night passing through Delhi on the way to Agra. room service and housekeeping staff were extremely pleasant but refused to leave the room until they were tipped (every time) a sign outside states that refurbishments are in progress so perhaps this is to be improved so maybe this will be better. there are plenty of cheaper hotels that offer same standard of accommodation..and without the smell!
some of the staff who work on reception are unbelievably arrogant & rude. a shame as the rest of staff appear conscientious.
location isn't brilliant as there is little to visit within walking distance. Connaught place/Old Delhi are about 20 - 30 minutes by taxi. would stay there again.

we stayed one night only at this hotel as it was closer to the airport. we were greeted by a charming girl...but once she was gone there was not one friendly face except perhaps in the business centre. after all our wonderful memories in India...this one wasn't awful....just ordinary!! We had definitely been spoilt with our other choices.
the staff at the counter looks ok but do not help when accosted with a problem. realised that hotel is discriminatory quite late.
the service needs to improve a bit though.Had stayed at The Grand in the same area but remained away as heard it had caught fire some time back.

the hotel was close to the airport and was clean and had a plush entrance. there were no other hotels close by as these were mainly in the diplomatic area which was near the town centre. this becomes of major concern once you realise how bad the traffic can be at certain times of the day and you're in hurry to get to airport.

I stayed on 9th and 10th June 2009. the hotel tariff is reasonable and have all facilities Viz. secretarial services, conference facilities and health club. The hotel is nearer to airport and is veery close to my meeting place i.e. Indian Roads Congress. I enjoy staying in this hotel. this is 12th time I's staying. it is the best place to stay in the world.

we had two day business meeting in the hotel Vasant Continental. hotel is non smoking zone, the space alloted for smokers was open & very hot, i personally think its good way to discourage smoking but it would be good if hotel provides a little comfortable space for smoking as few members were annoyed by the heat. the swimming pool is very small so gets crowded in morning hours so couldn't really enjoy it.
Ambience PerfectFood : a must try for chicken dishes. spaciousEnvironment is just so perfect for staying and especially when you are stressed down with work.

stayed in this hotel while on business travel to delhi. the rooms are fantastic. i enjoyed the stay.Rooms are excellent. service is proffessional and staff is courteious. buffet breakfast is the only area that may be improved was the menu of Buffet breakfast.

I have stayed here for more than 5 times... and ambience here absolutely great... during IPL season - I i was staying along with Deccan chargers team and we could meet Gilchrist, Laxman, Gibbs etc...it was a wonderful evening...Suite room with complimentry wine will give pleasant sleep after tiresome business hours...Review by JP # 9W 111061985.

stayed at Jaypee Vasant Delhi when on a Page & Moy Tour during Oct 08.. hotel is some distance from the centre of new Delhi- (about 40 mins in Tuk TuK) but some would say that this is an advantage to be out of the hotel boundary.
the food quality is excellant and to my surprise the hotel has provided a complimentary wine bottle in my room. if I get an opportunity, I will not hesitate to Sign in once again.

my room was a good size compared to some of the hotels I have earlier stayed in. the staff was extremely warm and helpful and attentive. The best part is the restaurants (which I continue to visit), especially the Chinese and the cafe with quite an unusual name -Eggspectation..

despite promising first impressions on entering the hotel, this hotel was very disappointing. several problems occurred during my stay. a hotel is undergoing refurbishment in some rooms and my room had strong smell of glue / solvents. however, that smell was preferrable to the one that met me on enter the bathroom.

this hotel was selected for its peaceful ambience for a last evening in Delhi prior to flying out the following morning. the meal we had in the Restaurant ranked as one of the best of our trip. Authentically Indian. There are other restaurants in this building but this was the Best - check in was smooth and trouble free! we are not frequent users of 'City" Hotels' and this more than met our expectations. Friendly without being fussy. Large but not soulless.Just what we needed for good nights sleep
a nice hotel. not exceptional but clean, comfortable, good service and reasonable price. better classified as 4 star rather than 5 star.

this hotel is billed as a 5*, but not an european 5 *. it's about 15 minutes from the main airport, be amazed by the changing route, dual carriage way leading down into an awful road through mad traffic and every kind of transport you can imagine! the rooms are decent size, with all the normal facilities, very comfortable bed.
the massage room is far too small and the masseur not up to his job. bath room was a delight, even though I booked the cheapest room!

hotel Vasant Continental has a nice little gym, yoga classes, spa and salon. the breakfast buffet was delicious, they had both Western breakfast offerings, an omelette station, and South Indian breakfast as well, not to mention fresh fruit. I never tried the room service, as I like to be out exploring the city hot spots, but there was always plenty of bottled water, my sheets and towels were always clean and fresh.
breakfast included in our stay which was provided with a bottle of wine and fruits when we first checked in! - there was an event at the hotel on fri night! hip hop night.
this hotel is a bit away from the business quarter. rooms are adequate and service is what one would expect in an business-oriented hotel.

we stayed in Jaypee Vasant Continental just for a night in transit between international and domestic flight. hotel itself was clean and nice, room was also well maintained and room-service was prompt and food was of good quality.

hotel was pleasant surprise, as it was in a quiet area and had good food (though expensive) and newly refurbished and clean rooms. hotel is located near JNU campus and airport and around the corner is western style shopping area.
two computers is inadequate and the service should be included with the room rate at a hotel of this caliber. for women, check out the well priced beauty parlor.

the hotel is very conviniently located at the middle circle on CP. the rooms are clean and the beds are soft & comfortable. there are 2 issues (1) The room is small (2) One has to climb 2-3 flights of stairs to reach the room as its spread over 3 floors with no lift. insist for discount upto 20% of the tariff will be waived if you are not able to stay in the cc..
the hallways were clean, well lit; well decorated. the rooms were larger than the other hotel in the same area, in comparison, this seemed more deserving of the "mid-range' or 2-3 star designation.
a chap is introduced to you as the travel desk. he can give free maps, free travel advice and 15mins free of internet service.

our room was clean and comfortable, but it was the only hotel we stayed at in Delhi so difficult to make a comparison. do not trust this hotel with any of your travel arrangements, or this travel agency.

i paid about $80 for one night here in the Connaught location in November. it looked fine to me and was shown a room and told I could choose another if I wasn't happy with it. the bathroom was dirty and falling apart like I expected bathrooms in India to be (this was the first time it actually happened in an hotel though).

our girlfriend and we stayed at hotel Jukaso Inn (the one in Connaught Place) for our first night in India on 10/11/07. we booked the hotel online in a last minute rush because other than our plane tickets and initial waitlisted new Delhi-Jaisalmer train ticket, we had organised nothing for the holiday in india - we paid 3850Rs + tax for one double room!

I booked at the WRONG Jukaso Inn after reading a favorable review in Frommers guide book. the hotel was really nothing special, nor terrible. just average. but it's possible that others who have reviewed this hotel might have been reviewing the wrong location?
the hotel's interior visible through the glass lifts is adds to the excitement. the rooms are excellent, nicely done up, and the bell staff still gives you a taste of the legacy.
the breakfast there is complimentary.Room was a nice one with TV, comfertable bed with pillow, mood lighting and many more.
the hotel bar (Nero) was great, with a great humidified smoking room and very attentive staff. monsoon the Indian restaurant was pricy but worth it (the herb prawn starter was to die for)

I have stayed at this hotelabout 3 times in last 2 years and the serivce at hotel is always great.Location is great.the only thing I would say is that when I booked this time through AAA there was extra charge for breakfast rate and when reached hotel bkfst was complimentary.we enjoy our stay here everytime..
spent a quality time in delhi with my wife and I really like room hotel all environment,specially room service,publikas. spent time at hotel hotel in the u.s.
Ranks on the higher end of Le Meridien's that I've stayed at. I was satisfied by my stay and the value and service.

stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in two different rooms. clean, modern hotel with good design throughout including'mood lighting" in the rooms. staff were very helpful as you would hope/expect in a hotel of this class/price. only thing was we could not get the wi-fi to work so ended up using the expensive business centre to check email.
the hotel was my favourite place in the city! Friendly staff. Very safety. we received a welcome drinks (coffee and tee) and welcome bindi.

I stayed here always when I visited New Delhi. the lobby is amazing; futuristic style.Room is great and spacious, beautiful bathroom.Exquisite.Very clean and well organized.Large flat screen tv in the room.Wi-fi available with charge.The concierge was very helpful.the hotel staff friendly.excellent breakfast.there are some shopping arcade in hotel. Try to visit Jaipur Gem Palace, they have nice collection of jewelry with reasonable price.

the hotel is currently under renovation, which means jackhammers and workmen throwing stuff out windows. the renovated room was decorated out in a cross between Ikea and Norwegian wood, with lots of sharp corners to bump into at night.
the hotel is located in the city centre area, but the room rate is surprisingly low, and staffs are nice. buffet dinner on the ground floor cafe cost you US$70 per person.

great hotel, very modern interior, spacious and airy. didnt appear to be many western visitors there. highly recommend all restaurants, particularly the chinese rest located on top floor. colonial decor but with great food and great view over delhi.down side would be lack of fast free internet acces, poor pool and sundeck area.

it is one of the most classy elegant trendy trendy hotel i have ever seen during my business travel. the hotel is a beautiful clean stylish hotel where staff makes you feel at home if u alone. one imp thing internet is good. Would recommend business travelers definitely.

the hotel did not send a limo to the airport because my PA didn't inform them. this differentiates the best from the better.#2: security check has been stepped up. i love this but to surrendder my swiss knife shows lack of discretion.
great service, great food, excellent rooms and a good location. checkins are always quick and the room is always just right.
the staff are generally helpful and attentive (though note my comment later) it is a 5* hotel that caters well for business and leisure travellers.

the hotel is located in the center of the civic district, within walking distance of Connaught Place and short rides from the Beaux Arts buildings. the room I had was excellent--apparently recently renovated. room service was attentive and housekeeping was diligent. they provided complimentary water, which is very important for Delhi. too many pigeons and crow use it as a bird bath - and leave their stuff next to its rim.

there were four apples of the Red Delicious variety but the food I had was good and I was not tempted to snack. the reason is quite simple: poverty. The Indian who is serving you as waiter or driver has a monthly salary lower than the cost of your room. in India, it is 10%. this means that Indian worker is underpaid.

the service was not what I would expect from a 5* hotel when paying room rates. the hotel is very centrally located and the contemporary design sets it apart from other hotels in Delhi. also the rooms are fairly spacious (but too dark!)

this is less a hotel for tourists than for business travelers. the thermostats in the rest of the hotel worked properly and the airconditioning was so cold that my friends and I had to leave dinner to get jackets. i have never understood why Delhi hotels are able to charge what they do.

stayed two night here while temperatures were above 42C in the city. decor was superb with imported italian glass tiles everywhere. Rooms were in excellent shape, large, and beautifully done. tried all the restaurants and bars on the ground floor - Monsoon is one of the top indian restaurants in Delhi.
the htoel staff were lovely and friendly and happy to help in anyway possible. they even had Tom and Jerry playing on the television screens on lift and lobby :)

we conducted our Business get together for some of our esteemed clients and friends for getting our Master Card Certification. we enjoyed the hall and nice dinner buffet arrangement. Ambience was great. It was a wonderful evening.

the airport pick-up failed to arrive in spite of booking and a phone call to confirm. the check-in staff were arrogant and rude and in fact so were the majority of the staff in the hotel including lady duty manager who is rude, unhelpful. every member of staff wants to be tipped - quite why I do not know as they don't offer any form of service.
this is a great hotel - amazing service. the restaurant on the top floor offers great views. The rooms are comfortable. it is located in the heart of the city of london.
was impressed by the design & the bold statement the hotel makes. the service, courtesy was impeccable. just right for a business traveller.

the breakfast included in package is very tasty. love to sit in coffee shop at 24 hrs to eat something or can have a sip of beer any time. india gate is just walking distance. lot of internal changes happened since my last visit.

this is my favorite biz hotel while in DelhiNewly renovated, big size rooms and bathrooms, good breakfast. it could do with little better housekeeping as i noticed insufficient cleanliness on my last stay.
nice location, actually able to get out and walk somewhere which is unusual for a 5* in India. Pool area disappointing though. Service etc first class service etc.
